Summary: criminal law. assault. intent required for assault with intent to cause grievous bodily harm. on review, court querying unlawfulness. accused hitting prostitute with iron bar when she objected to him underpaying for her services. review court not happy with magistrate's questioning of accused and that accused properly admitted to all the elements of offence. conviction set aside and matter referred for retrial before another magistrate.

Judges: Kruger J and Daffue J
Summary: criminal law. drug offences. dagga. charged with dealing, alternatively possession of large quantity of dagga. accused confirming in answer to a leading question that he was in possession of 127,5 kg of dagga. vehicle in which dagga conveyed seized. admission by accused and charge.sheet discussed.

Judges: Van Zyl R and Lekale R
Summary: criminal law. driving under the influence. appeal against conviction. accused losing control of his vehicle at yield sign and driving into house. accused raising in defence that mechanical defect leading to accident. whether accused's skill impaired by alcohol. whether evidence of laypersons establishing this. evidence of accused's conduct after the accident examined.

Judges: CJ Musi J and KJ Moloi J
Summary: criminal law. murder and kidnapping. evidence required to sustain charges. appellant seen taking deceased away from boyfriend in tavern and leaving with her shortly before her death. deceased's body later found in veld. bloodstains on appellant's shirt matching dna of deceased. appellant's version that both were attacked by strangers, and that he ran for help, correctly rejected as false by trial court. conviction in order. appeal against conviction and sentence dismissed.

Judges: Ebrahim, J et Mthembu, AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. appellant closing his case without testifying or calling any witnesses. evidence as to the actual shooting of the deceased circumstantial. the proved facts did not exclude the reasonable inference being drawn from them that the appellant had acted in self.defence and that the killing was lawful \'97 conviction of murder and sentence set aside on appeal.

Judges: Zietsman AJ and Naidoo AJ
Summary: criminal law. robbery. with aggravating circumstances. accused found in possession of stolen vehicle, previously taken from complainant with force. complainant unable to identify attackers. evidence insufficient to sustain robbery conviction, even though accused not honest in his testimony. convicted instead under s 37 of general law amendment act 62 of 1955. absence of reasonable cause for believing goods properly acquired.

Judges: Mocumie J and Molemela J
Summary: criminal law. immigration. offences. sentence. section 49(1)(a) of the immigration act 13 of 2002. magistrate exceeding specified sentence. on special review, sentence adjusted to that specified. r1500 or 3 months.

Judges: Moloi J and Phalatsi AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. alibi. assessment of. accused entitled to acquittal if there is reasonable possibility that alibi evidence true. trial court misdirected itself by rejecting evidence in support of appellant's alibi. alibi defence accepted as possibly true it follows that it was reasonably possible that prosecution's evidence was mistaken or false. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Rampai AJP
Summary: criminal law. trial. right to a fair trial. whether breach of right by pre.trial conduct of police. lured to police station under false pretences and confronted with untrue facts. elicited confession out of accused under these conditions. no other evidence to implicate. irregular conduct of police. confession inadmissible evidence. not guilty.

Judges: Kruger J, Molemela J and Jordaan J
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. unlawfulness. self.defence. appellant and complainant both police officials. involved in fight at police station. evidence of complainant flawed and appellant provoked. nevertheless, court a quo convicting appellant of assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm on grounds exceeding bounds of self.defence. on appeal, court doubting evidence of witness who observed incident. guilt not established beyond reasonable doubt. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Rampai AJP and Monaledi AJ
Summary: criminal law. fraud. sentence. imprisonment. appellant defrauded major banks of over r50 million. in position of trust as attorney on panel of banks. 64 counts of fraud. fact of having plead guilty insignificant as remorse expressed not genuine. prescribed minimum sentence already tempered with mercy. sentenced to 10 instead of 15 years in respect of each offence. sentences of theft and money laundering also ordered to run concurrently. no misdirection from trial court. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Ebrahim J and Daffue J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. to sustain charge of rape of 14\'96year.old girl. single witness. cautionary rule. alibi. court correctly considering totality of evidence and concluding appellant's version not sustainable. sentence not disturbingly inappropriate nor inducing sense of shock. no material misdirection committed. conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: Mocumie J and Murray AJ
Summary: criminal law. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. charge sheet made pertinent reference to provisions of s 51 and stated victim 14 years old. conveys intention of state to invoke s 51(1). no obligation to make specific reference to s 51(1). legal representative made frequent references to life imprisonment, indicating realised only s 51(1) applicable. no misdirection on court's part, charge sheet contained sufficient information. substantial and compelling circumstances were present warranting a sentence of 20 years' imprisonment. not shockingly inappropriate. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Moloi J and Phalatsi AJ
Summary: criminal law. motor vehicle theft. appeal against conviction and sentence of 6 years. panelbeater found in possession of recently stolen car. able only to supply nickname of customer who brought it to him for repainting. accused's version may only be rejected if false beyond any reasonable doubt. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Rampai J and Van Zyl J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. versions of accused and complainant examined on review. accused conducting own defence and convicted of assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. accused's version reasonably possibly true. conviction and sentence set aside.

Defendant: Booi 2012 JDR 0793 (FB) \'97 Now reported at 2012 (2) SACR 52 (FB)
Judges: Hancke AJP and Cilli\'e8 J
Summary: criminal law. sexual offences. sexual assault. criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act 32 of 2007. where no penalty prescribed in act in respect of contravention. whether absence of penalty clause rendering criminalization clause ineffective. despite absence of penalty clause legislature had clearly characterized conduct as a criminal offence worthy of punishment. courts entitled to convict and to impose punishment.

Defendant: ALM 2013 JDR 1584 (FB) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 48 (FB)
Judges: Mocumie J and Sepato AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. appeal. overwhelming evidence, thus no reason to tamper with conviction. abused position as stepfather and raped his stepdaughter, age 14. although no previous convictions and no serious injuries inflicted, no compelling circumstances found and appeal against life sentence also dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security NO 2015 JDR 2578 (FB)
Judges: NM Mbhele AJ
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. seizure by police in terms of s 20 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 \'97 business raided and certain items confiscated by saps. authorisation of raid appropriate but execution going beyond object specified in s 13(7) of south african police service act 68 of 1995. immediate return of seized goods ordered.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. cautionary rules \'97correct approach is to weigh up all elements which point towards guilt of accused against all those that are indicative of his innocence, taking proper account of inherent strengths and weaknesses, probabilities and improbabilities on both sides. whether the balance weighs so heavily in favour of state as to exclude any reasonable doubt about accused' s guilt. numerous intrinsic improbabilities, omissions and contradictions in evidence and the lack of corroboration, in material respects, court rejects complainant's evidence as most improbable. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: C Plasket J, D Chetty J and R Brooks AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against sentence. cumulative effect of sentences. if necessary, ameliorate harshness of aggregate sentence. effective sentences are undoubtedly extremely long sentences. to be reserved for most heinous of offences. cumulative effect of all sentences not just. portions of sentences to run concurrently. effective sentences reduced from 42 and 47 years, respectively to 22 years' imprisonment. appeals against sentence succeed to extent set out in order.

Judges: T Brenner AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). possession of counterfeit cds, later withdrawn. no such offence. arrest and detention unlawful. traumatic and humiliating and future employment prospects compromised by criminal record that should not have. damages of r50 000 awarded.

Judges: I Opperman J and MI Mangena AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape \'97 evidence sufficient to sustain charge. appellant alleging consent, however, court a quo ascribing insufficient weight to testimony of appellant's witness in this regard, and failing to articulate the improbabilities she found to have existed in his version or identify facts she considered unreasonable. state accordingly unable to prove its case beyond reasonable doubt and conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and Z Buthelezi AJ
Summary: criminal law. heroin. possession of in contravention of s 4(b) of the drugs and drugs trafficking act 140 of 1992. being in possession of 0,023 grams of heroin. material misdirection concerning mass of substance. injustice resulting from sentence imposed. urgent release of appellant ordered prior to hearing of appeal. appeal upheld. sentence reduced to 5 months imprisonment.

Judges: I Opperman J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to rob and robbery. evidence to sustain charges. also rape (4 counts); kidnapping (3 counts); attempted murder and possession of unlicensed firearm (4 counts). hearsay evidence of first complaint admitted as witness untraceable. linked through dna evidence to all 4 complainants (athough obtained without consent, constituting reasonable and justifiable infringement of rights). accused's bare denial disbelieved. guilty as charged on all counts apart from count 1 where found guilty of aggravated robbery.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and Z Buthelezi AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. appeal against sentence of 7 years' imprisonment. appellant serving 15 years' imprisonment in respect of similar offence committed in the same month as present offence. court a quo's refusal to order concurrency of 2 sentences constituting misdirection. appeal upheld to extent that 2 sentences ordered to run concurrently.

Judges: I Opperman J and R Francis AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. appellant, deceased, erstwhile co.accused and others in fight. misdirection by magistrate in not articulating improbabilities or facts considered unreasonable in rejection of appellant's version warranting intervention. on conspectus of facts unable to reject appellant's version that acted in self.defence. appeal upheld and conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Lamont J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. admissibility of. assessment to be based on value placed on evidence. question disallowed.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. also charge of defeating the ends of justice. blood from corridor in accused's house and bakkie matching dna of deceased (his wife). cellphone records tracking movements corroborating state's case. evidence sufficient to establish guilt of accused. first offender, 36 years old and self.employed. accused brutally killed deceased, dumped body under bridge and reported her missing to police. no remorse shown. life term imposed for murder and 1 year imprisonment for defeating the ends of justice.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 1034 (GP)
Judges: MP Canca AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). on information for rape and murder. bloodstains on work overall. not properly investigated nor sent for forensic investigation and plaintiff's explanation for such credible. suspicion not based on reasonable grounds though arrest probably motivated by overzealousness rather than malice. awarded damages of r180 000 for unlawful arrest.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2014 JDR 1728 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (3) SA 122 (GP); 2015 (1) SACR 384 (GP)
Judges: WRC Prinsloo J and PD Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. confiscation order in terms of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. act not applicable in this instance. action of appellant, construction of road wider than 4 metres, does not resort under ills legislature sought to control and eliminate when enacting poca. cannot be considered 'offences relating to proceeds of unlawful activities'. appeal upheld, confiscation order set aside.

Judges: MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. twenty\'96nine year old man detained for 7 months before case withdrawn. ptsd resulting from violent arrest, racist attacks, threats of violence from fellow detainees and being kept with convicted men in unsafe and unhygienic conditions. pre.existing psychological problems exacerbated. awarded r2 700 00 in general damages and r100 000 for future medical expenses.

Judges: Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. to full bench. on basis that decision not to grant applicant parole irrational and unreasonable. no reasonable prospects of success on appeal. leave refused.

Judges: MJ Maluleke J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). onus. reasonable suspicion. justified and lawful. action dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 2430 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J, AA Louw J and NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. appeal against refusal of claim. whether arresting officer's suspicion was premised on reasonable ground, which must be objective. proper investigation not conducted to justify arrest and consequent detention. suspicion was not reasonable. appeal upheld, r 90 000 awarded.

Defendant: The Chairman of the Appeal Board 2017 JDR 1950 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 695 (GP)
Judges: DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. arms and ammunition. declaration of unfitness to possess a firearm in terms of s 102 of the firearms control act 60 of 2000. review of decision of chairman of appeal board. decision made taking into account irrelevant considerations and ignoring relevant considerations. evidence and findings not rationally connected. decision set aside and remitted to appeal board for reconsideration.

Judges: SL Magardie AJ and M Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. malicious prosecution. action for damages. special plea upheld for alleged failure to give notice of intended action against the state. appeal. notices were given rendering it nugatory for court a quo to have even entertained special plea. appeal upheld. special plea set aside and matter remitted for trial before new presiding officer. institution of legal proceedings against certain organs of state act 40 of 2002, s 3.

Judges: AC Basson J and PH Malungana AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, ss 40(1)(a) and (h). straw containing white powder, never subjected to forensic tests, found in back of vehicle and occupants arrested. actions reasonable in circumstances and arrest justified. appeal against refusal of claim for damages dismissed.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions NO 2015 JDR 1596 (GP)
Judges: KE Matojane J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. prosecutor. powers and duties of. diversion from of criminal case. application dismissed.

Judges: VRSN Nkosi AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). whether reasonable grounds existed at time of arrest to support belief plaintiff committed sch 1 offence. grounds for supporting reasonable belief had committed offence of fraud did not exist. documentation in plaintiff's possession proves contractual dispute, not misrepresentation. arrest and detention unlawful.

Judges: De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without a warrant. whether lawful in this case. inexperienced police officer arresting when he ought to have investigated further. r60 000.

Judges: DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. unlawful detention. detained in unhygienic cells for 4 days. toilet and shower facilities dirty. members of police forum, humiliation. police acted in arrogant and vicious manner. awarded r135 000 to each plaintiff.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 2103 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). reasonable suspicion. must be objectively sustainable. arresting officer to have reasonable belief plaintiff had committed sch 1 offence. court a quo had accepted version of arresting officer that had reasonable suspicion. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2015 JDR 2676 (GP)
Judges: C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. parole. applicant, in prison for more than 30 years on term of life imprisonment, refused parole by minister. decision not procedurally fair as first respondent not having all relevant information before him at time of refusal. respondents ordered, inter alia, to arrange appearance for applicant before parole board; ensure all relevant facts placed before said board; and to furnish first respondent with parole.board report in order to consider the matter afresh.

Judges: Ebersohn AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. general damages and legal costs. treated cruelly and under horrifying circumstances from when arrested. in presence of acquaintances, general public and subordinates. damages of r280 000 awarded for general damages and also damages for legal costs.

Applicant: The South African Hunters and Game Conservation Association
Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security of the Republic of South Africa 2017 JDR 1108 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 288 (GP)
Judges: RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. constitutional law. legislation. validity. firearms control act 60 of 2000, ss 24 and 28. renewal of firearm licences. provisions lacking rationality and clarity and accordingly unconstitutional.

Applicant: The National Director of Public Prosecutions
Judges: DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. forfeiture order. application for in terms of s 48 of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. 4 gold bars possessed in contravention of s 4(3) of precious metals act 37 of 2005. whether instrumentality of offence. level of purity 99, 9 % and failing to meet definition of unwrought precious metal. accordingly not subject to forfeiture and application dismissed.

Judges: SS Mphahlele J
Summary: criminal law. damages. action for damages. against police. liability. shooting incident. whether policemen acting in self.defence. contending that were attacked by crowd when shots fired and plaintiff struck. plaintiff apparently drunk and staggering and not in position to fight with police officers. onus to prove shooting justified accordingly not discharged. minister to pay 100 % of proven damages.

Judges: CP Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). shop looted and damaged during community protest. plaintiff arrested on basis of interviews and statement by shop owner who had ample time to observe incident. not unreasonable for police to have believed his version. conflicting version regarding alleged assault. claim not established on balance of probabilities.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 1147 (GP)
Judges: Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. relatively short period of time spent in detention however plaintiff was police officer and arrested by own colleagues. looked upon as criminal in community. r80 000 damages awarded for unlawful arrest and r1 000 for legal fees.

Judges: Molahlehi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(j). police trying to arrest brother of plaintiff for consuming alcohol in public area. plaintiff interfering in arrest. plaintiff and brother ultimately arrested. police acting arbitrarily and irrationally. arrest and detention not justified. awarded r85 000 in damages.

Judges: MNS Sithole AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). complainant unable to point out plaintiffs in identification parade and robbery charge subsequently withdrawn by public prosecutor. police officers acting hastily without sufficient information, suspicion accordingly not based on reasonable grounds. plaintiffs each awarded r70 000 for unlawful arrest and detention.

Judges: DT Skosana AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). on charge of stock theft. released after court appearance and matter withdrawn. arrested on statement based on hearsay. suspicion not reasonably formed and arrest unlawful. awarded r80 000 as damages and solatium for infringements of rights including the contumelia on his well.being and person.

Judges: AB Rossouw AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest and detention. plaintiff found to be in possession of goods and arrested in terms of s 40(1)(e) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, on suspicion of being stolen goods. was unable to explain how got to be in his possession, also changed version. suspicion became objectively reasonable. claim dismissed.

Judges: Teffo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. without warrant. acted on information received from informer, corroborated by first person arrested. found firearms and ammunition at address provided by informer, plaintiff did not have licence to possess \'97arresting officer entertained reasonable suspicion that plaintiff and husband committed schedule 1 offence. claim dismissed.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and SP Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. epileptic raped during seizure. corroborated in part by witness and supported by medical evidence. version of appellant so improbable as to be rejected. conviction in order. previous conviction, 32 years old with 2 minor children. no misdirection in finding that no substantial and compelling circumstances and imposition of prescribed term of 10 years. appeal dismissed.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ and Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. not found where accused had raped his lover's younger daughter. complainant saw him as father figure and abused that trust. appeal dismissed.

Judges: LM Molopa-Sethosa J (PM Mabuse J and CJ Collis AJ concurring)
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. multiple charges flowing from armed hijacking of motor vehicle. first offender, 25 years old and employed as taxi driver. counts linked in time and placed justifying concurrence. inherent powers of review used to intervene in sentence of erstwhile accused 2. effective sentence of 30 years' imprisonment for both appellant and accused 2 reduced to 20 years.

Judges: C Pretorius J and MM Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imprisonment. term of. non.parole period. section 276b of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. only in exceptional circumstances. non.compliance with provisions of s 276b. sentence shockingly harsh and inappropriate.

Judges: CP Rabie J, MF Legodi, HJ Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. aggravated robbery. home robbery and shooting of elderly woman. single witness identification credible. cellphone records contradicting alibi. convictions in order.

Judges: CP Rabie J and H de Vos J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. lacuna in prosecution's case. magistrate attempted to fill gap by asking prosecutor to present further evidence at time both sides cases had been closed and made submissions. serious irregularity. conviction and sentence on count 3 set aside, sentence on count 2 set aside, sentenced to 3 years' imprisonment.

Judges: Mudau AJ and De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. offence attracted minimum sentence in terms of act. court took into consideration appellants had been in custody awaiting trial for 18 months, but only found substantial and compelling circumstances in respect of appellant 2. court a quo gave careful consideration to all appellants personal circumstances. sentences imposed suitable, not necessary to interfere. appeal dismissed.

Judges: FG Preller J and AJ Bam J
Summary: criminal law. fraud. sentence. conditional suspension in terms of s 297(1)(b) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. no investigation into whether accused is in position to make payments, nor whether complaint might be satisfied with lesser amount that in means of accused. conviction confirmed, sentence set aside and referred back to regional court for proper enquiry.

Judges: AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. from magistrate's court to high court. onus on appellant to prove in interest of justice to be released. appellant charged with numerous counts of fraud and likelihood of 26 more being added along with murder. correctly found appellant to be flight risk based on information obtained during investigation. state has good case against appellant, protecting investigation and prosecution against hindrance which may be cause by appellant. appeal dismissed.

Judges: DS Molefe J, HJ Fabricius J and S Strauss AJ
Summary: criminal law. trial. record. record incomplete . reconstruction of. appeal only against sentence. appellant informed court he took responsibility for actions and must be punished. conviction was conceded by appellant. highly opportunistic to take advantage of unavailability of record and conviction to be set aside. appellant not prejudiced by irregularity. no circumstances justifying deviation from sentence. conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: S Strauss AJ and T J Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. cumulative effect of sentence of robbery with aggravating circumstances to run concurrently with sentence already serving. sentence does not induce a sense of shock or tainted by misdirection. sentence also not designed to exceed natural lifespan. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: WAR 2014 JDR 2224 (GP) \'97 Now reported at¬† 2015 (1) SACR 571 (GP)
Judges: NB Tuchten J and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. from magistrates' court to high court. application for in terms of s 309b of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. to lead further evidence. this court has power under s 19(d) of supreme court act 10 of 2013 to set aside decision which subject of appeal. application allowed.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and A Millar AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. waylaid when walking home, raped twice and cellphone and money taken. appellant arrested shortly after rape and full description provided by complainant. convictions in order. although raped twice only charged with 1 count, accordingly misdirection in imposition of life term. sentence reduced to 15 years for rape, 15 years imposed for aggravated robbery confirmed. sentence to run concurrently.

Judges: JW Louw J and T Mtati
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. no restriction that should be confined to same incident. in casu, despite court's incorrect approach, cumulative sentence not such as to warrant interference. sentence of 11 years' imprisonment for corrupt activities regarding illegal transfer of foreign exchange and immigration offences, confirmed. prevention and combating of corrupt activities act 12 of 2004, ss 1, 2, 24, 25 and 26; immigration act 13 of 2002, ss 49(1)(a) and 49(14).

Judges: TA Maumela J and JJ Strijdom AJ
Summary: criminal law. trial. right of accused to fair trial in terms of s 35(3) of constitution of the republic of south africa, 1996. applicability of minimum sentence provisions of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. accused to be informed at pleading stage of trial. irregularity not of such nature vitiates entire proceedings. court erred in sentencing in terms of act. appeal succeeds, sentences substituted.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and L Bam AJ
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to steal and theft. sentence. multiple counts and other related charges including unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition and attempted murder. effective 30 years' imprisonment. first offender, married and relatively young\'97 offences callous, merciless and brutal. no misdirection by court a quo in finding no compelling or substantial circumstances. no interference in sentence warranted.

Defendant: Vilakazi 2016 JDR 0013 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 432 (GP)
Judges: N Ranchod J and PM Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. drugs. guilty plea for 1 charge of possessing both cocaine and heroin. fine of r4000 with r1000 suspended for 5 years.

Judges: FG Preller J and N Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. sexual offences. consensual sexual penetration with certain children. whether prosecution must be authorised in writing by dpp if accused 16 years old at time of alleged commission of offence. both accused were over age of 16 years thus authority of dpp not required. proceedings and conviction in order.

Judges: Potterill J and PA Van Niekerk J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. 7 counts of indecent assault and 4 counts of rape. occurring over period of time and single witness reporting offences some years later. in issue whether contradictions, discrepancies and inconsistencies (inevitable in such an old case) material and to what extent affecting reliability and credibility of witness. majority finding that no misdirection in finding of court a quo that complainant's evidence credible and appeal accordingly dismissed. minority judgment of view that cautionary rule not satisfied and appeal should succeed.

Judges: DT Skosana AJ and CP Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. followed deceased outside restaurant and fired 8 shots at him, 6 of which struck his body. first offender, inebriated and provocative and rowdy within restaurant. misdirection in finding no substantial and compelling circumstances. sentence of 14 years reduced to 12, 7 years imposed for counts of illegal possession of firearm and possession reduced to 3 and 1 years respectively, all sentence to run concurrently.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and MA Hawyes AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. regional court. not competent to sentence accused under s 51(1) when accused charged under s 51(2). home invasion, kidnapping and rape of 13.year.old girl. injuries. previous convictions. life sentence set aside and replace with 15 years.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J, N. Kollapen J and SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. was medicated and heavily intoxicated at time of making statement. cannot be regarded as reliable witness in the circumstances. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Kubushi J and Tsasi AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. record. record lost, destroyed or incomplete. reconstruction of. if record inadequate for proper consideration of appeal, as rule, conviction and sentence to be set aside. no fair trial rights if no proper record provided. defects in reconstructed record so serious proper consideration not possible. convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: C Pretorius J and P Lazarus AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304(4) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. during questioning accused in terms of s 112(1)(b) of act, magistrate asked leading questions. purpose of questioning is to protect undefended accused from consequences of ill.considered plea of guilty. did not enquire if plea made freely and voluntarily. court did not adhere to principles set out. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and S Mokose AJ
Summary: criminal law. indictment and charge. 4 counts of rape. contention that appellant and accomplice each raped complainant twice but no allegation that appellant charged with rapes committed by accomplice. should accordingly have been convicted on 2 counts only. further 2 robbery convictions in order. sentence. complainant pregnant at time causing premature birth and breakup of relationship with father. threatened with firearm and made to lie on ground littered with broken bottles. aged 21 and first offender. 3 years in custody before sentencing. life terms imposed for rape reduced to 25 years, all sentences to run concurrently.

Judges: AA Louw J, NP Mngqibisa-Thusi J and PM Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. fundamental rights. right to legal representation. trial proceeding in absence of legal representation after 30 postponements. appellants refusing to take part further in trial \'96no irregularity and convictions on robbery, kidnapping and unlawful possession of firearm in order. however, appellants relatively youthful and effective sentence reduced from 45 years to 15 years.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and M Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. custodial sentence not competent in immigration offences without option of fine. justice requires accused should not be brought back to court to be re.sentenced. appropriate sentence is discharge with reprimand under s 297(1)(c) of cpa. order for deportation upon release. section 112(1)(a) of cpa.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. finding of guilt not misdirection. irregular for magistrate to give judgement without reasons. once given, reasons well balanced and plausible. however no basis for enquiry in terms of s60 of act 60 of 2000. sentence and conviction in accordance with justice, order in terms of act 60 of 2000 set aside.

Judges: AML Phatudi J and MF Kganyago AJ
Summary: criminal law. domestic violence. breached protection order granted days earlier. struck complainant with back of axe and fractured forearm. accused unemployed and not likely to be able to pay if given the option of a fine. 3 years direct imprisonment.

Judges: Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. evidence of shop owner and single witness satisfactory. appellant held and assaulted by members of public in shop. conviction in order. no misdirection in imposition of prescribed minimum of 15 years. imposition of non.parole period, however, unnecessary and inappropriate and accordingly set aside.

Judges: SP Mothle J and NB Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. children. as complainants in sexual offences. complainant both single witness and child witness. evidence of minor was credible and reliable. appellant's version found not to be reasonably possibly true. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. drug offences. dagga. dealing in in contravention of s 5(b) of drugs and drug trafficking act 140 of 1992. arrested at oshoek port of entry by sandf with 1,17 kg dagga in his bag. magistrate misdirecting himself in convicting of dealing when evidence on record only proved possession. conviction of dealing set aside and replaced with conviction for possession. suspended sentence and fine imposed by court a quo confirmed.

Defendant: TS 2015 JDR 1804 (GP) - Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 489 (WCC)
Judges: SAM Baqwa J and N Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. maintenance. failure to pay. arrears of r573 800. special review because recording of sentence did not accurately reflect legal position. sentence reviewed, set aside and appropriate order and sentence substituted. 18 month sentence suspended for 5 years on condition certain payments made.

Judges: MW Msimeki J and J Holland-M\'fctter AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. appeal against life imprisonment. victim thrown to the ground and raped by accused. when finished he invited his friend who also raped victim. minimum sentencing provisions applying and no grounds existing for reducing sentence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Makume J and T Moosa AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. onus placed on appellants and magistrate failing to give reasons for rejection of versions, or deal with testimony regarding 2 counts of assault against second appellant. insufficient evidence beyond reasonable doubt against first and second and convictions and sentence set aside. deceased not armed, however, and second appellant exceeding bounds of self.defence in using knife to ward off further attack. conviction for murder set aside and replaced with verdict of culpable homicide. sentenced to 6 years wholly suspended for 5 years.

Judges: LM Molopa-Sethosa J, D Mlambo J and E Bertelsmann J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. also charge of aggravated robbery. female owner of shop robbed and beaten to death with broom stick\'97 no misdirection in admission of pointing.out and confession \'97observed in company of co.accused in vicinity of shop at time of incident. appellant was appalling witness. convictions in order. brutal and callous attack. despite being 21 years old and first offender court a quo correctly finding no substantial and compelling circumstances. life term for murder and 15 years for aggravated robbery confirmed on appeal.

Defendant: Tladi 2015 JDR 0583 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 424 (GP)
Judges: S Potterill J and N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. increase of on appeal. appellants kidnapped and raped complainant 6 times. minimum sentence not to be deviated from unless compelling and substantial circumstances present. minimum to be deviated from if sentences disproportionate to appellants. this instance offences horrific and increase to life justified in respect of appellant 1. appellant 2 and 3, possibility of rehabilitation exists. sentence of appellant 1 increased to life, appellant 2 and 3 to 15 years' imprisonment.

Judges: AC Basson J and HJ De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. what constitutes. applicant and accused (2) represented by same practitioner. applicant admitting in warning statement that committed rape but that threatened by (2) to do so whereas (2)'s defence a bare denial. contending that representative must have been aware of conflict of interest between him and (2). guilty plea submitted during trial not conveying such facts and accepted by court a quo despite his having indicated his dissatisfaction therewith. court on review finding applicant not given opportunity to put version to court and consequently not receiving fair trial. conviction and sentence set aside and remitted to start de novo.

Judges: De Vos J and Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentence. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. period spent in custody awaiting trial. taken into consideration. found to be substantial and compelling circumstances, court however entitled to impose higher sentence than prescribed minimum. warranted in aggravating factors outweigh. appeal dismissed.

Judges: M Ismail J and NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. pre.trial\'96. preliminary enquiry. none held in terms of child justice act. section 43(3) peremptory. proceedings in terms of s 112 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 irregular, conviction set aside and matter to proceed de novo before different magistrate to hold preliminary enquiry. child justice act 75 of 2008, s 43.

Judges: AC Basson J and M Senyatsi AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. murder. witnesses unable to identify 3 appellants in identity parade despite implicating in attack. reasonable doubt concerning identity. convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: AA Louw J and DS Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. magistrate erroneously imposed higher sentence in terms of s 276(1)(i) of cpa instead of 5 years. sentence set aside and substituted with sentence of 5 years.

Judges: Jansen J and Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. pre.sentence report. non.compliance with s 71 of child justice act 75 of 2008. courts to take such reports seriously. juvenile offenders. due to non.compliance with act and served 6 months prison sentence set aside.

Judges: Holland-M\'fcter AJ and Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. father raping daughter aged 10. first offender, married with 3 minor children and employed. no remorse. abuse of position of trust. no substantial and compelling circumstances. appeal against life term dismissed.

Judges: AJ Bam J and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. chocolates to value of r167,90. fourteen previous convictions for 'petty thefts'. problem with recidivism possibly including kleptomania. sentence of 3 years' imprisonment too severe in circumstances and set aside. matter remitted to court a quo for resentencing after having obtained a pre.sentence report.

Judges: De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. rape. of child under 16. mother and lover raped daughter age 3. made video film of rape. 2 counts. drug use by both adults. 18 years each on each of counts leading to an effective sentence of 24 years.

Judges: De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. rape. rape of minor. mother videotaped boyfriend raping 5 year.old daughter. acted with common purpose. plead guilty. both accused found guilty on counts 1, 2 and 11 as set out in indictment.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ and De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. appeal. no reason to interfere. sports coach grooming boys and engaging in oral sex with them. complainants all below 16 years of age. 10 years for rape and 3 and 5 year sentences for sexual assault.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. malicious damage to property. intent. whether appellant had requisite intention to damage complainant's property. state bore onus to prove. appellant's defence damage occurred while appellant was acting to protect himself from injury. appeal succeeds, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and MA Makume J
Summary: criminal law. fraud and theft. r1,8 million from funds of non.profit organisation where she had a position of trust. kind.hearted person not posing a danger to society. used the money to enhance her status and to enjoy a lifestyle she could not afford on her salary. 7 years suspended entirely with conditions.

Judges: DPJ Rossouw AJ and DS Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. corruption. public officer. quid pro quo for gratification received. interpretation of. no more is required than a demand and receipt of money to fall within ambit of relevant section. prevention and combating of corrupt activities act 12 of 2004, s 9.

Judges: DP de Villiers AJ and N Janse van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. armed robbery outside spaza shop while appellant inside. keys of truck belonging to owner taken (among other items). appellant played no role in robbery but allegedly left with robber in truck. identification of appellant not proven beyond reasonable doubt on totality of evidence. appeal upheld and conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. if in interests of justice bail may be granted. no exceptional circumstances exist. previous conviction of murder, atmosphere of enmity between him and his community. accused failed to disclose previous convictions. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MD Mohlamonyane AJ and MM Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. example where court to send clear message to accused and potential rapists. prowled on unsuspecting minor girls and stepdaughter. worst kind of rape. sentence of life imprisonment not disproportionate to seriousness of offences committed.

Judges: AJ Bam J and FG Preller J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. complainant had opportunity to observe appellant on several occasions during the ordeal. never deviated or contradicted himself in any material aspect. identification of 2 other accused confirmed by objective evidence. reliable, honest and trustworthy witness.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and WRC Prinsloo J and GC Muller AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. robbery with aggravating circumstances; attempted murder, and unlawful possession of firearms and ammunition. owner of shop shot during robbery by armed group. committed while first appellant serving suspended sentence for robbery. as to appellant 2, his personal circumstances and that he did not pull the trigger requiring deviation from minimum sentence: sentence reduced accordingly from life to 20 years. remaining sentences confirmed.

Judges: PM Mabuse J and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. unavailability of to continue with trial. part.heard matter before contract magistrate. failed to finalise matter. to ensure matter finalised part of proceedings set aside. matter to proceed in normal course.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. also charge of kidnapping. family assaulted and house ransacked. robbed of property to value of r54 000 at gunpoint. son forced to drive assailants to offload stolen property then released. stolen cellphone recovered days later in possession of appellant. testimony of erstwhile co.accused implicating appellant. convictions in order. sentence. twenty.six.year old first offender from mozambique. no misdirection in imposition of prescribed minimum of 15 years' imprisonment for robbery and 5 years for kidnapping.

Judges: W Hughes J and AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. eleven.year.old girl. in veld after taking her shopping and afterwards forcing her to drink alcohol. taken into shack to rape again but saved by 2 priests who assaulted appellant allowing complainant to escape. medical evidence \'97 conviction in order.

Judges: AJ Bam J, TJ Raulinga J and LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. murder. proof of. deceased severely assaulted and strangled. not case where assailants intended to prevent deceased from crying out. no object covering his mouth. rope was around neck to strangle. all probabilities deceased knew assailants, accused 1 was employed at same place. motive to silence deceased permanently. reasonable inference was intention to kill \'97was common purpose to murder. murder conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: S Potterill J and SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. life imprisonment. accused convicted of 2 counts of rape of under 16 year olds. rape of young girls despicable. life sentence thus not disproportionate to crime itself. no substantial and compelling circumstances to deviate from prescribed minimum.

Judges: ALCM Lephoko AJ and TM Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. traffic offences. national road traffic act 93 of 1996, s 65(1)(a) read with s 69(1). public road. rational interpretation of s 69(1) is that state merely has to allege road concerned is public road. presumption kicks in and road is presumed public road. accused to adduce contrary evidence. court has to weigh evidence against evidence of state to determine whether proved beyond reasonable doubt, public road. no contrary evidence led, argument thus without merit that not public road. appeal fails.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J and Rautenbach AJ
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. adequacy of proof \'97 single witness. plea explanations that part of arrangement and no intent to commit offence. appellants not testifying. prima facie case becoming conclusive evidence. appeal against convictions dismissed.

Judges: PM Mabuse J, CP Rabie J and MF Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. whether sufficient to convict. assailants took cellphone and r110 at gun.and knifepoint. appellant known to complainant and identification sound. common purpose. age 26, stolen item of low value and no injuries inflicted. court a quo correct in finding substantial and compelling circumstances and adjusting sentence to 1 of 10 years.

Judges: Modiba AJ and Bertelsmann J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. sexual offences. contradictions in state case relates to events earlier in day and not actual sexual incident. totality of evidence indicative of appellant's guilt. objective medical evidence of both grievous bodily harm and sexual encounter. magistrate correct to find complainant did not consent to sexual intercourse. appeal dismissed.

Judges: C Pretorius J and J Du Plessis AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence to sustain charges. also unlawful pointing of a firearm (count 1). no misdirection in convictions. court correctly finding substantial and compelling circumstances. sentence of 8 years imposed for rape in order but sentence on count 1 of 8 years too harsh and reduced to 2 years, to run concurrently.

Judges: AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. single and child witness. rape of eight.year.old girl. cautionary rule applied. corroboration by circumstantial evidence. credibility findings sound. no material misdirection committed in imposition of life imprisonment. appeal against conviction and sentence dismissed.

Judges: AC Bekker AJ and RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. immigration offences. factors to be taken into account. whether accused in position to pay fine. proportionality. current matters period of alternative imprisonment of 6 months excessive and disproportionate to fine imposed. sentences set aside, r 2000 fine or 3 months imprisonment.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J; MF Legodi J and TJ Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. murder. appellants, who were policemen, were convicted of the murder and assault of suspects they took into custody on charge of theft. they contended that members of the community had the assaulted them before they were handed over to them. on appeal, court finding that material misdirections in evaluation of evidence by court below such that interference warranted. nothing improbable in version of defence and at the least reasonably probably true. appeal upheld. convictions and sentences for both appellants and accused 6 and 7, also policemen, set aside.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and ALCM Lephoko AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. assessment of. inferential reasoning. no fault with reasoning and conclusion of magistrate. appellant's version improbable, and inconsistent with normal conduct of person who had been victim of hijacking. sentence is disproportionate. misdirection on sentence. conviction appeal dismissed, sentence set aside and reduced to 5 years' imprisonment.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and MJ Mushasha AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. failed to take court or social worker into his confidence. limited insight into consequences of his crimes. no possibility of being rehabilitated. menace to community. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MJ Mosopa AJ and CP Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. multiple counts including 4 counts of rape and 4 of robbery. linked by dna evidence to all rape counts. complainants threatened with firearm or knife. same modus operandi used by luring with offer of employment. convictions in order. complainants not raped more than once, or by 2 or more people and misdirection in imposing life terms for rape and not applying s 51(2) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. life terms on 4 counts of rape accordingly substituted by 10 years, to run concurrently with sentences imposed on robbery counts. to serve effective sentence of 54 years.

Judges: PD Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. refusal of. appeal against. charged with offence contained in schedule 5 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. onus to prove in interests of justice to release on bail. court considers strength of state case against appellants. guilt or innocence dealt with by trial court. right to be presumed innocent has no bearing. evidence adduced by appellants not sufficient to discharge onus. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Setshedi 2017 JDR 0246 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 504 (GP)
Judges: WRC Prinsloo J; AA Louw J and SP Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. charge.sheet not reflecting applicability of act. effect of on sentence on appeal set out.

Judges: N Davis J and CJ Van Der Westhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. alteration of to 1 of not guilty. questioning by magistrate not approached in correct fashion and proceedings therefore not in accordance with justice. conviction and sentence set aside and matter remitted in terms of s 312 of act. if matter proceeded with plea of not guilty to be noted by magistrate.

Judges: JW Louw J and Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. first offender, 20 years old, pleaded guilty at onset. lower court did not exercise discretion judicially and properly, sentence imposed is harsh and shockingly inappropriate. sentence of 5 years' imprisonment set aside, replaced with fine of r1500 or 6 months imprisonment wholly suspended.

Judges: LM Molopa-Sethosa J and D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. assault. sentence. whether sentence proportional. failure by court to properly take personal circumstances into account. sentence shockingly severe. only caters for retribution and general deterrence and rehabilitation and individual deterrence not afforded any consideration. sentence amended accordingly.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and MHE Ismail J and CP Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. murder of passenger in vehicle and attempted murder of ex.wife and daughter. latter parties credible witnesses despite previous difficulties with appellant. no grounds for interference with rejection by court a quo defence of private defence on facts. convictions on all 3 counts upheld on appeal.

Judges: NM Mavundla J, WRC Prinsloo J and KE Matojane J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. also charges of assault, aggravated robbery and unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition. dna evidence chain broken. state failing to negate alibi and show not merely holding firearm and ammunition (linked to offences) for friend. accordingly acquitted on all charges except relating to unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition. sentence of 2 years (counts taken together) confirmed on appeal.

Judges: NA Engelbrecht JA and Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. rape. gang rape and common purpose. on route to vehicle theft. 3 perpetrators taking turns to rape victim. whether they could be convicted of only the rapes committed themselves or also the rapes of their fellow accused. whether acted in concert or by themselves.

Judges: AC Basson J and W Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification evidence. raped during pregnancy termination. sufficient opportunity to observe appellant. cautionary rules correctly applied. appeal dismissed.

Judges: AC Basson J and W Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. rape. single witness complainant meeting 'doctor' to obtain abortion. instead inserted fingers into vagina. later positively identified in visit accompanied by investigating officer. found in possession of cellphone contacted by complainant. no misdirection in acceptance of identification by court a quo. although no violence used, took advantage of young woman in desperate situation. magistrate correct in finding not required to deviate from minimum sentence of 10 years. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Botes AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. charged with rhino.poaching and firearm related offences. onus to prove in interests of justice to permit release. evidence adduced to be analysed and considered in a comprehensive manner. seriousness and severity of offence relevant, clear message to be sent to poachers. accused failed to discharge onus. likelihood to undermine or jeopardise objectives of criminal justice system. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. accused was not properly represented as legal representative lacked necessary right of appearance. proceedings thus irregular and not in accordance with justice. stand to be set aside.

Judges: Ranchod J and Nobanda AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. credibility. single witness. necessary caution applied. evidence satisfactory in material respects. convictions for corruption in order. police officer, 37 years old and married with 7 children. no previous convictions. sentence of 5 years not excessive. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Seedat 2015 JDR 0917 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 612 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J and S Strauss J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. restorative justice. appropriateness of sentence based on restorative justice. where sentence of 7 years' imprisonment set aside and suspended for period of 5 years, imposed for rape of elderly woman partially suspended on conditions attempting to effect restorative justice. ordered to pay compensation in amount of r100 000. use of restorative justice as sentence for serious offences.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. sentence. convicted of theft and robbery and sentenced to be detained in treatment centre due to substance abuse problem. sentence imposed against tenant of child justice act 75 of 2008. sentence set aside and remitted back to court to be dealt with in terms of ch 10 of the child justice act.

Judges: C Pretorius J; VV Tlhapi J and TP Mudau J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. murder, aggravated robbery, arms and ammunition charges arising out of carjacking. convictions could not be faulted except for unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition convictions which state conceded were incorrect. would have no impact on effective sentence as ordered to run concurrently with those on other counts. accordingly, convictions for murder and aggravated robbery and effective sentence of 25 years confirmed, remaining convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: TV Ratshibvumo AJ and NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. assault. sentence. captain in police services assaulted 3 fellow female offices. magistrate allowed natural indignation towards either accused or legal representative to override better judgment on sentence. punishment to fit crime. sentence set aside and substituted with 12 months imprisonment wholly suspended for 3 years, conditionally.

Judges: Makgoka J and Ranchod J and Shirilele AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. mens rea. intention to kill. dolus eventualis. elderly woman raped and left tied up in manner leading to anoxia. insufficient to establish dolus eventualis and conviction altered to culpable homicide. first offender, 24 years old and employed as bricklayer. prescribed life term imposed for rape confirmed. life term imposed for murder set aside and replaced with 7 years for culpable homicide.

Judges: J W Louw J and K. LaM. Manamela AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. female complainants, aged 15 and 16 respectively, reporting that each raped twice by appellant some years before at school. contention that acting under influence of certain teacher correctly dismissed. contradiction in evidence of second complainant, however, material. conviction on charges re first complainant confirmed and second complainant dismissed.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J and P Van Niekerk AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. rape and indecent assault (four counts) over period of 6 years by husband of aunt, starting when complainant was aged 7. single and child witness approached with necessary caution. no basis on which to interfere with court a quo's factual findings. convictions in order. also no grounds to interfere 15 years' imprisonment (effective) imposed as sentence.

Defendant: RM 2017 JDR 2119 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 357 (GP)
Judges: Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witness. cross.examination. rule requiring accused to put version to prosecution witnesses. not requiring whole of accused's version to be put to witness, only material parts thereof.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ and De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. fraud. sentence. whether all relevant factors taken into consideration. pre.meditated over period of 2 years, position of trust. custodial sentence is only appropriate sentence. sympathy for accused cannot deter court from imposing kind of sentence dictated by justice and in interests of society as whole. appeal dismissed.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and AA Louw J and W Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. bail. cancellation of. violation of conditions. witnesses threatened and offered money not to testify. no misdirection in findings of court a quo. appeal against order dismissed. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 66.

Judges: AJ Bam J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. whether magistrate erred in refusing bail. magistrate considered all relevant aspects to application for. magistrate did not err in decision. appeal refused.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. sentences. prescribed sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. none found warranting deviation. appellant raping complainant since age of 8.years.old, fortnightly, over period of 6 years. cannot be said to not be worst kind of rape due to no physical injury or trauma. this rape should be placed amongst the very worst kind. psychological damage inferred from other evidence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: AA Louw J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. differences between versions of state witnesses. between written statements and their viva voce evidence. witnesses also contradicted 1 another. contradictions of such a nature appellant to be given benefit of the doubt. appeal upheld, convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: AA Louw J and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. attempted theft. what constitutes. contrectatio. magistrate in correct in finding contrectatio was requirement and theft completed. being watched entire duration of attempted theft, did not succeed in excluding owner of control of copper. appeal against conviction of theft succeeds, substituted with attempted theft.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. misdirection of magistrate to prefer state's witnesses despite agreeing with version of appellant. general weakness of evidence of state. conclusion, magistrate out to have found version of appellant reasonably possibly true. appeal succeeds, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Jansen J and Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. generally. trial court's evaluation of evidence. presumption that trial court's findings of fact are correct. state witnesses credible and corroborated 1 another. version inherently probable. conflicting versions by appellant not probable. conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J and P A Van Niekerk AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence to sustain charge. multiple counts including rape, theft, assault gbh and kidnapping. complainant, aged 47, abducted, tied up and raped 8 times (and assaulted) over period of 4 days, until her escape. no misdirection in convictions. no grounds for interference in imposition of prescribed life term for rape, 12 months for theft, 3 months for assault and 5 years for kidnapping.

Judges: RG Tolmay J, N Tuchten J and TAN Makhubele AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. proof of. thirteen.year.old girl allegedly raped by mother's boyfriend. contradictions and improbabilities in evidence of complainant. lack of medical evidence. appellant's version reasonably probably true. appeal upheld and conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Brenner AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. guilty plea \'97 attention not drawn to provisions at any stage and impinging on right to fair trial. kidnapped and raped 6.year.old girl. first offender and 25 years old. sentence reduced from life to 15 years for rape and 10 to 7 years for the kidnapping.

Judges: Ellis AJ and LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imprisonment. term of. non.parole period. misdirection in court assuming that fixing non.parole period obligatory in terms of s 276b of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. in casu no exceptional circumstances warranting such and non.parole period accordingly set aside. sentences imposed on charges, however, confirmed.

Judges: Makhubele AJ and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. attempted murder. assaulted, dragged into bushes and raped by appellant and another. stabbed repeatedly and left for dead after being pushed into stream. previous conviction, 21 years old with 1 child. unknown person main instigator of offences. court a quo should have obtained pre.sentence report or enquired more thoroughly into personal circumstances. youthfulness insufficiently considered. deviation from prescribed minimum warranted. life term on rape charge set aside and replaced with 15 years, sentence of 12 years for attempted murder confirmed.

Judges: SK Hassim AJ and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. pre.sentence report. calling for pre.sentencing report within discretion of trial court. whether failure to call for report a misdirection. appeal dismissed.

Judges: C Swanepoel AJ and S A M Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. five.year.old complainant. material contradictions in evidence of state witnesses casting doubt on reliability of complainant. appeal upheld and conviction set aside.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and G Webster J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. generally. approach on appeal. credibility findings of trial court. evidence not tested critically. convictions and sentences on counts 2 and 5 upheld, appeal on count 1 dismissed.

Judges: JW Louw J and PD Moseamo AJ and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. charge.sheet. error in. charge.sheet stating offence as 1 of contravening s 51. no reference made to subsection applicable. reference to s 51 adequate warning minimum sentencing legislation applicable. no prejudice towards appellant in way trial was conducted. appeal dismissed.

Judges: RG Tolmay J, C Pretorius and N Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. appellant and erstwhile c.accused brutally murdered and robbed employer. premeditated and manner of death consistent with dolus directus. misdirection by court a quo in insufficiently emphasising youthfulness and lack of previous convictions entitling intervention by appeal court. life term for murder reduced to 25 years. fifteen years' imprisonment for robbery confirmed, 10 years run concurrently.

Judges: Masipa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. physical disability of accused. double amputee. concerns addressed regarding services available. department of correctional services deals with variety of disabilities and vulnerabilities. accused needs will be sufficiently seen to. custodial sentence appropriate. sentence of 5 years' imprisonment imposed on culpable homicide count and 3 years, suspended, on discharging firearm.

Judges: Masipa J
Summary: criminal law. murder. mens rea. intention to kill. dolus eventualis. accused did not subjectively foresee possibility he would kill person behind door, let alone deceased, believed she was in bedroom. accused's erroneous belief his life in danger excludes dolus. not guilty of murder dolus eventualis.

Judges: C.J. Claassen J and Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. court misdirected in not ordering entire period of 10 years' imprisonment to run concurrently with sentence on first charge. 2 offences were committed in close proximity in time and place. sentences ordered to run concurrently. effective 15 years' imprisonment imposed.

Judges: MF Legodi J, CP Rabie J and PM Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. identification parade. pointing out of appellant i on aggravated robbery charge (count 6). no evidence of safety and reliability of parade. dock identification questionable. appellant 1 to be given benefit of doubt on this count. further convictions on murder and aggravated robbery and related charges on basis of common purpose (for appellants 1 and 2) not well founded. appeals upheld. convictions and sentences set aside, appellants ordered released from prison with immediate effect.

Judges: JJ Strijdom AJ and Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. factors to be taken into account. habitual criminal. out of necessity and financial hardship. sentence shockingly inappropriate.

Judges: SK Hassim AJ and DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. pre.sentence report. importance of. no obligation to obtain. required to exercise proper judicial sentencing discretion. does not amount to misdirection. appeal dismissed.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and E E Sethole AJ
Summary: criminal law. arms and ammunition. unlawful possession of arms and ammunition evidence sufficient to sustain charges. stolen firearm found in engine compartment of vehicle. no reasonable explanation for possession. conviction in order. firearm used in crime. first offender, 26 years old and employed as taxi driver. no misdirection in imposition of 10 years' imprisonment.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. life imprisonment. prescribed minimum sentence. stranger entered home, locked door and raped complainant twice. threatened with knife, choked. injuries. previous convictions. reference to 51(2) instead of 51(1). misdirection by magistrate in imposing life imprisonment on each count. interference warranted. sentence altered to 35 on each count, to run concurrently.

Judges: Du Plessis AJ and Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence to sustain charge. rape of 6.year.old child. no medical evidence to support charges. complainant informing the court that mother told her to say appellant raped her. material misdirection in findings of fact. insufficient evidence to support conviction. appeal upheld.

Judges: K la M Manamela, AJ and JW Louw J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. rape of 4 or 5.year.old girl. guilty plea. twenty.one years old and unmarried. difficult childhood. previous convictions for assault and attempted rape of 11.year.old girl. prospects for rehabilitation not considered warranting interference. prescribed life term reduced to 20 years.

Judges: AC Basson J and CJ Van der Westhuizen AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. record missing after accused re.arrested on bench warrant (after failing to appear for sentence proceedings). presiding magistrate since deceased. proceedings and conviction set aside. remitted for trial de novo.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and SP Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. drug offences. cocaine. dealing in contravention of s 5(b) of drugs and drug trafficking act 140 of 1992. 2 acts of dealing on consecutive days, 2 convictions. sold for profit, drug dealer and displayed no remorse. nothing on record to show good prospects of rehabilitation. sentence imposed relatively low for offences convicted of. no misdirection. appeal dismissed.

Judges: S Strauss AJ and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. drug offences. sentence. generally. sentencing court discretion to be exercised judiciously. utmost importance all factors of appellant's personal profile be specified in sentence component of trial. particularly when attracts severe form of punishment. mitigation factors were not correctly considered. sentences shockingly inappropriate. appeal upheld against sentence.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J and V Thlapi J
Summary: criminal law. indictment and charge. duplication of convictions. convicted of main charge of contravening s 17 of the domestic violence act 116 of 1998 and alternative charge of assault. legally unsustainable. conviction for assault reviewed and set aside.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J; RG Tolmay J and NB Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. 3 counts of rape. no mention of reliance on s 51 read with part 1 of sch 2 of the criminal law amendment act 105 of 197 in charge.sheet \'97constituting misdirection entitling court to interfere with sentence. forty.year.old with previous convictions displaying no remorse. no evidence prejudiced by failure to warn of possible life sentence. life imprisonment suitable in circumstances.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and A Basson J
Summary: criminal law. trial. mental state of accused. accused charged with rape of 11.year.old stepdaughter. mother of accused informing court that was mentally disturbed. examined by district surgeon who was of opinion that fit to stand trial and trial proceed with. misdirection in not calling mother to adduce evidence re assertion and if warranted referring for evaluation in terms of ss 77, 78 and 79 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: DM Thulare AJ and MF Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. accused aged 30 and victim aged 6. promised toys to little girl and walked her 400 metres to an open veld where he raped her. life sentence.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and TD Vilakazi AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. raped daughter aged 15 twice during visit at his home. caution exercised in evaluation of young and single witness. corroboration in uncontested medical evidence. accused's version far.fetched. conviction in order. first offender, aged 43 and suffering from life.threatening disease. abuse of trust. imposition of 2 life terms confirmed.

Judges: TAN Makhubele AJ and AJ Bam J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. increase on appeal. each case should be judged on its own merits and correct question to ask is whether life imprisonment is appropriate sentence under circumstances. sentence imposed by the court a quo was shockingly lenient and inappropriate. should be increased to 1 of life imprisonment. appeal on conviction dismissed, sentence set aside and substituted with life imprisonment.

Judges: Jansen J and Kooverjie AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. single witness. tax.driver shot and robbed of motor vehicle worth r120 000 and other items. recovered through tracker system. interior light on in taxi and sufficient time to identify. pointed out at identity parade. alibi not persuasive. convictions for attempted murder, aggravated robbery and firearm charge in order. first offenders aged 30 and 26. sentence not tempered with mercy and reduced from 20 years to effective 15 years.

Defendant: Nonjini 2015 JDR 0763 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 404 (GP)
Judges: DS Fourie J and NB Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. superior courts act 10 of 2013, s 22 (1)(c). failure to comply with statutory provision that is peremptory. failure amounts to gross irregularity. renders it reviewable. proceedings and order set aside in toto.

Judges: N Kollapen J and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. onus of proof on state. whether version of appellant to be rejected. totality of evidence does not support version of appellant. complainant's mother strict, highly improbable if had consensual sex, to return home to angry mother, rather to aunt's home who less restrictive. complainant arrived at parental home traumatised. appellant's version improbable. appeal dismissed against conviction and sentence.

Judges: VV Tlhapi J and A Crutchfield AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. dock identification. complainant raped and partner robbed at gunpoint of cellphone. dock identification not preceded by identification parade. alibi reasonably possibly true. guilt of appellant not established beyond reasonable doubt. appeal against conviction and sentence upheld.

Judges: NP Mngqibisa-Thusi J and P Phahlane AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape \'97 evidence sufficient to sustain charges. forcefully dragged ex.girlfriend to house and raped her resulting in charges of rape, kidnapping and assault gbh. evidence of single witness approached with necessary caution. convictions for 3 counts in order. no misdirection in imposition of effective 10 years' imprisonment.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and JJC Swanepoel AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. assessment. taxi driver robbed of vehicle by passengers at gunpoint. appellant identified at parade. vehicle recovered. conviction in order. no misdirection in imposition of prescribed life term.

Judges: TS Madima AJ and NV Khumalo J
