Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. no reasonable prospects of success in that another court may come to different conclusion. no new issues raised in application not already canvassed in court a quo. appeals dismissed.

Judges: Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. onus of proof on state. reasonable possibility that appellant not guilty. improbable evidence of appellant. appellant to be convicted only if court finding not only that his version improbable, but also that it falls beyond reasonable doubt. material inconsistencies in single witness testimony, which cannot be ignored. state failed to discharge onus. appeal upheld.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. sentence. fine. had to be within realistic ability of accused to pay. first offender, 19.year.old youth from rural area sentenced to fine of r4000. unlikely to be able to raise large sum of money. sentence excessive and reduced to r2000.

Judges: Strauss AJ and NF De Jager AJ
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. questioning in terms of s 112(1)(b) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. questioning ought to be such that can establish whether accused truly guilty of offence pleading guilty to. failed to establish guilt. conviction and sentence set aside.

Defendant: Maluka 2014 JDR 2296 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 273 (GP)
Judges: N Kollapen J and S Thobane AJ and D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. automatic review. orders made in terms of s 77 and 78 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. legislature did not create automatic right of review in respect of such orders. in view of serious prejudice to accused person where order is made, some kind of review mechanism is desirable. matter of good practice to refer for review. order in accordance with justice and confirmed, matter referred to minister of justice and speaker of national assembly for consideration and attention.

Judges: AJ Bam J, D Mlambo JP and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. calling, examination and refutation of. the oath. s 165 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 allows for interpreter to administer oath. consistent with provisions of s162 of the act. no irregularity. administration of oath correct in law.

Judges: E Bertelsmann J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304(4) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. number of irregularities but not in interests of justice to set aside. accused intended to plead guilty. sentences to be corrected. sentence set aside, fine of r1000.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ and De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. environmental offences. construction of road. without requisite environmental authorisation. no adverse impact on environment, factor to be considered in appeal against fine imposed. sentence company's motive for building road completely altruistic and in order to reduce environmental impact. no benefit to company having been proven. national environmental management act 107 of 1998, s 24.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. stock theft. sentence. appeal against sentence. theft and slaughter of 22 sheep. court did not accept personal circumstances of accused as placed on record. treated with ridicule and contempt. sentence too harsh, reduced to 5 years' imprisonment, portion suspended conditionally as contained in order.

Judges: AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. rape of girl under the age of 16. personal circumstances can be substantial and compelling warranting imposition of lesser sentence. current sentence on lively 25 year old appellant too severe and induces sense of shock. youthful age dictates candidate for rehabilitation. appeal against sentence succeeds, reduced to 20 years imprisonment.

Judges: Bam J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. murder. police officers assaulting man and dragging him behind a police vehicle. killing family man and breadwinner. none having previous convictions. good service records. deceased arrogant and aggressive when confronted with an alleged traffic violation. 15 years each.

Judges: MJ Mushasha AJ and N Ranchod J and WRC Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. rape. elements of. penetration. proof of. medical report showed no signs but confirmed by doctor hymen would not necessarily have perforated. even slightest penetration sufficient to sustain charge of rape. complainant aged 7 at time of rape and indications of severe trauma. sufficient to drive to conclusion evidence credible and reliable. appeal dismissed.

Judges: T Brenner AJ and P Rabie J and R Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification of. assessment of. appellants were identical twins. both identified by witness who knew them previously. appellants identified separately, but witnesses unable to confirm which twin. version of appellants inherently improbable. no misdirection in finding of guilty on murder, robbery and firearm charges. appeal dismissed.

Judges: PD Moseamo AJ and JW Louw J
Summary: criminal law. record. incomplete record. destroyed in fire. record before court not reflect if child witness admonished. incomplete, not automatically mean appeal to be upheld.

Judges: DS Molefe J and KLAM Manamela AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. murder and rape. life sentence appealed against. no substantial and compelling circumstances for married first offender with child who spent 11 months in custody awaiting trial. raped victim causing genital injuries then crushed her skull flat. appeal dismissed.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and J Holland-Muter J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. multiple counts of rape and aggravated robbery. single witnesses corroborated by medical evidence and fingerprint link to 1 robbery. appellant's evidence contradictory and highly improbable. convictions in order apart from splitting of charges regarding 2 counts of robbery, convictions and sentences for said counts set aside. sentence. previous convictions, drug abuser, no sense of responsibility towards his 4 children, no remorse and denigrating attitude towards women. effective life term confirmed.

Judges: Hughes J and Louw J
Summary: criminal law. rape. what constitutes. lacuna in state's case. failure of state to prove rape as defined within s 3 of the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act 32 of 2007. failed to also prove sexual intercourse was without complainant consent. complainant 13 year.old girl admitted to sexual relationship with appellant. on night in question, complainant was intoxicated and could not recall what happened. appellant not aware of age of complainant. appeal upheld, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Bam J and ML Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. sentence. robbery with aggravating circumstances. minimum sentence in terms of s 51 of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. court has discretion to increase minimum sentence and defence needs to be alerted of court's consideration. irregular that defence did not address court on possible increase. magistrate also failed to give reasons as to increase. no substantial and compelling circumstances found. minimum sentence applicable.

Judges: MV Semenya AJ and N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. appeal against. 10 previous convictions. 1 gang rape. armed robbery. other rape victim suffering grievous bodily injury during rape. both rapes at the victims' homes and accompanied by robbery. life sentence correct for the 2 rape charges. appeal dismissed.

Judges: TA Maumela J and HMS Msimang AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment. appellant admitting to an altercation with deceased at his tuckshop over sim card, but denying fired shots. known to witness as repeat customer. found in possession of firearm linked to crime. no misdirection in convictions for murder and firearm offences \'97 married with 2 children, sole breadwinner and first offender. no grounds for interference in sentence. sentence of life imprisonment for murder and 15 and 3 years, respectively, for unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition, confirmed.

Judges: CJ Van Der Westhuizen AJ and N Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. plea explanation not including all elements to charge of assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm, but only assault. plea of not guilty should have been entered and matter remitted for trial. as had already served sentence this would serve no purpose. appropriate in circumstances to set aside conviction and sentence and convict on lesser competent charge of assault. sentenced to sentence already served.

Judges: SC Mia AJ and PM Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to steal and theft. sentence. stolen items (value r4300) recovered. guilty plea. previous convictions. no misdirection by trial court warranting interference. appeal against sentence of 6 years dismissed.

Judges: DS Molefe J and TJ Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. theft. evidence to sustain charge. theft of motor vehicle. caught in possession of stolen vehicle by policemen \'97 no misdirection in conviction. first offender, 39 years old and sole breadwinner for 3 children. sentence of 10 years shockingly inappropriate and reduced to 4 years on appeal.

Defendant: Mahlangu 2017 JDR 1555 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 64 (GP)
Judges: RE Monama J and A Basson J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. threatened with firearms, assaulted, tied up and home ransacked. complainant identifying appellant as previous employee through voice at identity parade. no misdirection in conviction for aggravated robbery. misdirection, however, in treating as second offender due to theft previous conviction. sentence of 18 years reduced to 15.

Judges: DT Skosana AJ and NP Mali J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. new evidence on appeal. on basis that prosecutor failed to disclose statements by appellant containing exculpatory information. requirements in terms of s 19(b) of superior court act 10 of 2013. grounds raised not fulfilling requirements. application to lead further evidence and appeal dismissed.

Judges: N Nkosi AJ and E Molahlehi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. housebreaking with intent to rob and robbery with aggravating circumstances, rape and theft of motor vehicle. appellant 37 years old, married and employed with previous convictions. sentence of 15 years for housebreaking and robbery and 5 years for theft confirmed. misdirection by magistrate in giving maximum of 15 years on rape count without motivation except that 'too light' and reduced from 15 years to 10 years.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J, N Ranchod J and HJ Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. also attempted murder, aggravated robbery and unlawful possession of firearms and ammunition. group armed robbery of retail store in which multiple shots fired. identification satisfactory. supported by testimony of co.perpetrator under caution. convictions in order. effective sentence of 20 years for first appellant altered to 16 years; effective sentence of 12 years imprisonment for second appellant confirmed.

Judges: Madiba AJ and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. rape. child complainant a good witness. appellant's version and allegations of motive to falsely accuse him not credible. prevalence of child rape. no substantial and compelling circumstances. conviction and life sentence confirmed on appeal.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J, EM Kubushi J and GC Muller AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. witness recalled attacker had deformity of 1 hand and leg. appellant had similar deformities and witness also recalled his face due to lighting at time of incident and being very close to attacker. inherently improbable that perpetrator and appellant have same deformities. s special features she recalls and fact she saw his face. necessary cautionary rules applied. appeal has to fail.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and MA Makume J
Summary: criminal law. rape. abducted, detained and raped victim 3 times. minimum of life applying. perpetrator age 34 and victim age 19. pleaded not guilty and made offensive allegations during trial in a failed attempt to show that victim consented. victim not seriously injured and perpetrator a first offender. life sentence imposed by regional court reduced to 26 years on appeal.

Judges: Jansen J and Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. rape. youthful offender age 17. victim age 5 so life sentence normally applying. minimum sentence not applying. on appeal sentence of 20 years reduced to 10.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ and N Janse Van Niewenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. found where appellant had raped minor under age of 16. life sentences to be reserved for more serious cases of rape. appeal upheld, sentence of life set aside and replaced with 25 years' imprisonment.

Judges: MA Makume J and N Nkosi AJ
Summary: criminal law. arms and ammunition. declaration of unfitness to possess firearm in terms of s 103(2)(a) of firearms control act 60 of 2000. convicted of common assault and sentenced to a fine. proper enquiry not held as required before declaration that unfit to possess firearm. conviction confirmed but matter remitted to magistrate to conduct such.

Judges: E Bertelsmann J and FG Preller J
Summary: criminal law. admission of guilt. accused paying admission of guilt fine subsequent to having pleaded not guilty. an admission of guilt fine can only be paid after accused's appearance in court if accused has not yet pleaded to charge. acceptance of fine constituted an irregularity. on special review, admission of guilt fine set aside, fine to be refunded, and trial proceedings to be concluded in terms of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Judges: NF De Jager AJ
Summary: criminal law. robbery aggravating. sentence. elderly couple on farm violently attacked and robbed, leaving farmer with such injuries as unable to continue farming. 20 year sentence confirmed, but appeal succeeding in that ordered to run concurrently with accused's other sentences.

Judges: EE Sethole AJ and N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. 2 counts. no evidence of any act envisaged by s 1 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. verdict accordingly altered to robbery. sentence of 12 years shockingly inappropriate warranting interference. appellant 29 years old, unemployed and repeat offender. sentence reduced to 7 years on each count, to run concurrently.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. substantial and compelling circumstances. in circumstances where the accused has committed multiple acts of rape and robbery. plea of guilty while possibly showing remorse not constituting substantial and compelling circumstances justifying lesser imprisonment. agreement between state and defence in terms of s 105 a of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 as amended.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and PD Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. presumptions. doctrine of recent possession. appellant arrested at shack where household items stolen were found, an hour after robbery. presence of appellant's photo suggested some form of residence in shack, therefore had control of premises where stolen goods found. in addition, not credible witness. court a quo correct in finding in possession of stolen goods and 1 of robbers. appeal against convictions fails, sentence reduced to 10 years' imprisonment.

Judges: AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. legal practitioners. attorney. rights and duties. conflict of interest. emerged accused attorney works for same firm that represented complainant in civil matter against accused. court found no conflict. only common denominator is that attorneys at the same firm. attorney may proceed to represent accused.

Defendant: Mabuza 2017 JDR 1491 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 54 (GP)
Judges: Ranchod J and Lukhaimane AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence \'97 witnesses. children. evidence through intermediary. competency reports. such not witness statements and could not be used in cross.examination of witnesses. conviction of accused on 4 counts of trafficking for sexual purposes and rape in order. appeal against convictions dismissed.

Judges: Sikwari AJ and Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. multiple rapes. accused detained and raped the victim over 5 hours. 4 rapes including vaginal and anal. threatened with knife during rapes. assaulted with open hands. threatened with death on her release. life sentence appealed against. appeal court finding substantial and compelling circumstances and reducing sentence to 15 years.

Judges: PM Mabuse J and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to steal and theft. sentence. 2 counts. guilty plea. paucity of detailed information in magistrate's reasons for judgment. seriousness of offence overemphasised. reduced from 3 years on each count (on 1 count term wholly suspended) to 2 years of which 6 months was suspended on each count.

Judges: JW Louw J, HJ De Vos J, C P Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. common purpose. police officer shot and robbed of firearm. witness unsure as to which of appellant and erstwhile co.accused did shooting. misdirection in finding of common purpose between 2 men. appeal accordingly upheld and convictions on all counts set aside.

Judges: PD Moseamo AJ and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. court failed to consider youthfulness of appellants and can still be rehabilitated. appeal against sentence upheld and reduced to 15 years' imprisonment.

Judges: S Potterill J and AJ Bam J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. alteration of to plea of not guilty. after conviction and sentence. accused explaining during questioning that only borrowed goods and did not intend to deprive complainant permanently thereof. trite that intention had to be admitted for plea of guilty to stand. conviction and sentence set aside on review. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 112(1)(b).

Judges: AM Makume J and NB Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. first appellant very well.known to complainant \'96 other appellants robbed complainant and handed money to first appellant and fled store. store was very well lit for complainant to identify correctly. identification reliable. appeal fails.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and M Sello AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. guilty plea. raped more than once. terminally ill and 35 years old. on parole for rape conviction when present offence committed \'97complainant suffering injuries to private parts. contended that year spent in custody awaiting trial disregarded in imposition of life term. life term imposed proportionate to offence committed and appeal sentence dismissed.

Judges: MW Msimeki J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. factors to be taken into account. to be blended with measure of mercy according to the circumstances \'97discretion of trial court not to be eroded. sentence ordered to run concurrently. erred in imposing 10 years imprisonment on count 2. 5 years' appropriate. sentences on count 1 and 3 confirmed, reduced to 5 years' imprisonment on count 2.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and M Sello AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. assessment of. 3 counts of rape. identified after incident by complainants leading to arrest. same modus operandi \'97\'97 absence of dna.evidence not assisting appellant. convictions in order. no previous convictions, age 24, single with 1 child. no victim impact report. not worst kind of rapes. insufficient evidence to justify imposition of life term. sentence reduced to 30 years.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and LI Vorster AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. age of appellant was not given sufficient weight when imposing sentence. sentence is disproportionate if consideration for age factored in. sentence of life imprisonment set aside and replaced with 15 years.

Judges: Van Oosten J
Summary: criminal law. murder \'97 sentence. shot spouse. tumultuous relationship with a protection order. intimate partner violence alarmingly prevalent as a serious social problem in society and deterrent sentences are called for. 15 year sentence.

Defendant: LR 2014 JDR 2656 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 497 (GP)
Judges: AML Phatudi J and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. diversion of. from criminal justice system. requirements of. preliminary enquiry to consider diversion: child acknowledges responsibility and prosecutor indicates matter may be diverted in terms of child justice act 75 of 2008. magistrate erred and acted irregularly. provisions of s 52 (1) of the act were not complied with. reviewed and set aside.

Judges: ST Kekana AJ and DS Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. rape. proof of. assessment of evidence. complainant believing appellant to be her husband and pushing him away when discovering it was not so. mutually destructive versions. cautionary rule not properly applied. probabilities not correctly assessed. court a quo misdirecting itself in finding appellant guilty beyond reasonable doubt. appeal against conviction upheld.

Judges: JW Louw J (Mohlala AJ concurring)
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravated robbery. sentence. home invasion. cellphone and digital camera taken, female complainant threatened with knife and tied up. age 29, pleaded guilty and had 1 previous conviction for theft of motor vehicle. no grounds for interference in imposition of prescribed minimum of 15 years' imprisonment.

Judges: KE Matojane J, WRC Prinsloo J and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. court had scant personal information about appellant and why offence committed. leaves assessment of penalty to a hazardous guess based on no or inadequate information. pre.sentencing report vital. necessary enquiry not conducted.

Defendant: Linus 2014 JDR 1802 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 381 (GP)
Judges: MV Semenya AJ and LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. drug offences. methcathinone. dealing in contravention of s 5(b) of drugs and drug trafficking act 140 of 1992. sentence. appellant on 2 occasions sold units of powder containing methcathinone and methamphetamine to undercover agent. offence is serious 1 warranting correction supervision. magistrate correctly weighed personal circumstances of accused against interests of community. section 17(e) of act prescribes sentence not exceeding 25 years, indicative of how serious legislature views such offences. sentence not shockingly disproportionate. appeal dismissed.

Judges: LI Vorster AJ and HJ Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. evidence as whole indicates evidence not satisfactory in all material aspects. 3 charges of rape against appellant, charge 1 and 3 dismissed. convicted on charge 2. material contradictions and improbabilities in complainant's version. doubt as to whether raped by appellant or at all. appeal succeeds, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and Holland-Muter AJ
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. common purpose. what constitutes. appellant entering complainant's residence at 03h00 after first intruder who had simultaneously bridged firearm he was holding. sufficient to find appellant guilty as co.perpetrator on charge of housebreaking with intent to commit crime unknown to state and joint possessor of firearm and ammunition, on basis of common purpose.

Judges: E Jordaan J and AJ Bam J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304(4) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977\'97 sentences not in accordance with justice. remitted to magistrate for sentence and for inquiry to be held in terms of s 35 (3) of national road traffic act 93 of 1996.

Judges: Sikhwari AJ and Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. fingerprint evidence. convicted on various counts of housebreaking with intent to steal and theft, kidnapping and aggravated robbery issues included (1) whether presence of appellant's fingerprints at various crime scenes justified inference of participation in crimes; and (2) whether fingerprints belonged to appellant or 1 aaron phashe. convictions justified on totality of evidence. police expert's testimony, that appellant and aaron phashe 1 and the same, not materially challenged in trial court and therefore accepted. appeal dismissed.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and L Vuma AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. conceded correctness of dna results and challenge to conviction fell away. incorrect provision of minimum sentencing act in charge sheet and interference by court in sentence warranted. sentence reduced from life term to 15 years.

Judges: MW Msimeki J and VRSN Nkosi J
Summary: criminal law. culpable homicide. general principles of liability. defences. private defence. argument between neighbours. deceased shot after attack had been completed and no reasonable relationship between attack and defensive act. limits of private defence clearly exceeded. conviction upheld but conviction on charge of unlawful pointing of firearm set aside. trained policeman inflicting irreparable harm when had less harmful ways for resolving conflict. failed to render assistance or call emergency services. no remorse. no misdirection in sentence of 5 years' imprisonment.

Judges: C Pretorius J and J Du Plessis AJ
Summary: criminal law. assault. assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. complainant deceased before completion of cross.examination. no other evidence to support charge. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. complainants unable to identify assailants. convicted on dna evidence found in vagina of complainant. appellant's version of consensual intercourse explaining presence of dna, highly improbable. sentence not too harsh. appeal dismissed on conviction and sentence.

Judges: PD Phahlane AJ and N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity. what constitutes. whether certain warning/explanations directed by court to witnesses, to repeat the answers already provided to public prosecutor in examination.in.chief, rendering trial unfair. court on appeal finding that such tainting whole trial. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: SP Mothle J, Bertelsmann J and Preller J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. charge.sheet. error in. charge.sheet incorrectly stating offence as 1 of contravening s 51(2) instead of s 51(1). court not precluded from imposing life sentence or referring case to higher court.

Judges: MW Msimeki J and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. review. juvenile offenders. section 85(1) of child justice act 75 of 2008 providing for automatic review in respect of all children convicted in terms of cja. sections to be interpreted in a way that favours juvenile. reviewable irrespective of duration of sentence, whether legally represented or not, or sentenced by regional court. proceedings were in accordance with justice, conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: NJ Coetzee J and FG Preller J
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. unavailability of to continue with trial. part.heard trial. magistrate on contract which expired. failed to attend to partly heard matter. order setting aside proceedings, matter to start de novo.

Judges: W Hughes J and Rangata AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. fifty.eight.year.old raped while hitchhiking by fellow hiker. single witness approached with necessary caution. appellant's evidence contradictory and corroborating complainant in certain respects. conviction in order. no misdirection in imposition of 10 years imprisonment on 25 .year.old appellant

Judges: C Pretorius J, NM Mavundla J and AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. murder. proof of. deceased last seen being dragged away by appellant with whom she was in a relationship. body found in veld. pointing.out of scene by appellant which was accepted after trial.within.a.trial. although evidence largely circumstantial, conclusions of trial court could not be faulted. conviction confirmed.

Judges: CG Lamont J
Summary: criminal law. drugs. 25 kg of methamphetamine. crime boss intended drugs for international export. sentence of 25 years. kidnapping for 5 days where victim tortured to reveal location of brother. 15 years. attempted murder for pouring boiling water over the same victim. 15 years.

Judges: AJ Bam J and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. child. trial of. fact that second accused under 18 years of age only coming to attention of court during trial. magistrate separated case from others and removed from roll. proceedings reviewed and set aside and remitted to magistrate so could be dealt with in terms of child justice act 75 of 2008.

Judges: AA Louw J and HK Kooverjie AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. cautionary rule. children. complainant both single witness and child witness. evidence to be clear and satisfactory in every material aspect. complainant's evidence does not meet this standard. appeal upheld, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and Ledwaba DJP
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. magistrate misdirected to impose non.parole period when sentencing. exceptional circumstances required not placed before her. in absence thereof was a misdirection. sentence imposed suitable, save for portion imposing non.parole period, which is set aside.

Defendant: Knight 2017 JDR 1330 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 583 (GP)
Judges: Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. plea and sentence agreement. requirements for. certificate of authorisation by ndpp required to be handed into court. court also required to pronounce on conviction of accused. without such there could be no valid sentence imposed. court failed to do so in casu and proceedings remitted for consideration de novo. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 150a(8).

Judges: MS Makamu AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. application by way of affidavit. on allegedly new facts relating to deterioration of health. such already in existence when initial application brought. appeal dismissed.

Judges: N Kollapen J and PD Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. onus of proof on state. reasonable possibility that accused not guilty. contradictions in evidence of complainant. dna evidence found not dealt with sufficiently, not belong to appellant. appeal upheld.

Judges: CP Rabie J and A Basson J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. summary conviction after plea of guilty for contravention of s 49 of immigration act 13 of 2002 in terms of s 112(1)(a) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. sentence imposed of r15 000 exceeding monetary jurisdiction of r5000. sentence set aside and replaced by 1 of r5000 or 3 months' imprisonment.

Judges: MD Mohlamonyane AJ and MHE Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. 1 course of conduct for purposes of sentence. appellant committed 4 counts of rape with 1 single course of conduct over single night. overemphasised needs of society in imposing sentence. sentence reduced to 24 years' imprisonment.

Judges: K Makhafola J, DS Fourie J and C Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. sentences. factors to be taken into account. sufficient weight to be given to personal circumstances. allows for individualization of sentence, which is part of our law. insufficient weight given to fact sentence of 50 years' imprisonment imposed on 37.year.old appellant was excessive. rider of 'no parole' until 33 years stifling flexibility of judicial discretion. appeal upheld, non.parole period set aside, sentences on counts 2,3 and 4 confirmed, count 1 sentence substituted to 30 years' imprisonment, ordered to run concurrently.

Judges: FW Botes AJ, Makgoba J and Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. sentences. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. sufficient circumstances present not to impose prescribed minimum sentence of 15 years. youthful, first offender and no injury to complaint during robbery. appeal in respect of sentence upheld, accused sentenced to 12 years' imprisonment.

Judges: N. Ranchod J, SAM Baqwa J and N Mali AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. calling, examination and refutation of. material differences between witness's evidence and prior statement. inconsistencies not material. length of time that elapsed between day of incident, taking of statement and trial explains inconsistencies. honest mistakes. court did not misdirect itself on factual findings made. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal. against refusal of. section 60 (4) (b) read with s 60(6) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, will attempt to evade trial. accused mozambican national and no residence in republic, will return to mozambique on release. also no emotional or family ties in republic. court correctly took into consideration all evidence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: AA Louw J and N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. record destroyed by fire. whether complainant must testify again. transcription of her evidence placed before judge. case to proceed from complainant's evidence.

Judges: VV Tlhapi J and DSS Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentence. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. aggravating circumstances far outweighed personal circumstances. conduct of appellant when fleeing crime scene was aggravating. callous manner in which shot at police officers. killing of police officers repugnant conduct. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MD Mohlamonyane AJ and MM Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. verdict. competent verdicts. rape. complainant was sexually assaulted and physically assaulted. dna recovered not matched to that of appellant. raises doubt of whether raped complainant. count of rape not proved beyond reasonable doubt. assault competent verdict to rape. convictions and sentences of rape set aside, substituted with assault intent to do grievous bodily harm.

Judges: MW Msimeki J, S Potterill J, N Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. common purpose arising from agreement. requirements. accused 3 aware of robbery as witness informed him deceased calling for help and he ignored the call. inference and logic informs accused could not do so as knew what was happening. appeal on conviction dismissed.

Judges: W Hughes J and GT Avvakoumides AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. elements of. absence of consent. whether complainant clearly indicated she did not want to engage in sexual intercourse. conduct and actions of complainant not to be confused as consent. evidence alone of accused corroborated complainant's that sexual intercourse without her consent. accused apologised for this fact at family meeting and in trial proceedings. clear indication appellant aware complainant was not consenting nor a willing participant. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MG Phatudi AJ and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. fingerprints removed from scene placing accused. accused version improbable. appeal dismissed.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and JJ Strydom AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrency of sentences. it is competent for a court to direct that a sentence of imprisonment without the option of a fine may run concurrently with a sentence of a fine with the alternative of imprisonment in terms of s 280 (2) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Defendant: JR and WN 2014 JDR 2515 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 162 (GP)
Judges: N Ranchod J and NP Mngqibisa-Thusi J
Summary: criminal law. child. neglect of injuries. children's act 38 of 2005, s 305(3)(a). mother and partner. child suffering bruises, broken arm, broken ribs, strangled and raped with finger. even a person who voluntarily cares for a child temporarily or partially may be guilty of the offence of deliberately neglecting a child. it is clear from the wording that the legislature sought to spread the sub.section's net as widely as possible in relation to who is deemed to be a caregiver.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. review. record. record lost and impossible to reconstruct. conviction and sentence to be set aside. not permissible to refer matter back to trial court for trial de novo. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: C Pretorius J and RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. fundamental rights. right to a fair trial. right to be tried in language that accused understands, or to have proceedings interpreted. no similar provisions in criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 to deal with this type of matter. provisions of s 35(3)(k) of constitution should equally apply to witness in criminal trial. proceedings set aside, accused to be tried before another magistrate. complainant to testify in sepedi.

Judges: NM Mavundla J and S Strauss J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. identification parade. witnesses had sufficient opportunity to observe intruder subsequently identified as appellant. 2 witnesses corroborated each other, credible and reliable. not interfere unless demonstrably clear credibility finding patently incorrect. absence any misdirection, trial's court's findings of fact and acceptance of evidence regarded as correct. appeal dismissed, sentence confirmed.

Judges: MD Mohlamonyane AJ and MM Jansen J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility \'96 single witness. evidence was not clear and satisfactory in all material respects. misdirected in rejecting evidence of appellant as not being reasonably possibly true. cannot hold that penetration with penis as alleged. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: C Pretorius J; NM Mavundla and AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. contract killing. accused hired by someone to kill deceased. nothing on record suggesting they knew anything of motive or history of relationship with deceased. sum total of mitigating features amounting to personal circumstances which appellant's counsel never placed before the court. age, no previous convictions, employed and 4 minor children. nothing mitigating in commission of offence. hired to kill deceased yet also robbed of vehicle. no substantial and compelling circumstances justified lesser sentence than prescribed sentence of life imprisonment for murder.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. child. trial. child pleaded guilty to stealing 2 chicken pies. under age of 18 years though 28 according to charge.sheet. procedure in terms of s 85 of the child justice act 75 of 2008 should have been followed. proceedings set aside.

Defendant: Hlongwane 2014 JDR 1052 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 397 (GP)
Judges: Spilg J and Masipa J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. what constitutes. interpretation of 'wielding' within subsection (i) of s 1 (b) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. intention of legislator. cannot cast net too wide. restrict meaning to standard dictionary meaning, which requires more than just possession or holding. in present case drawing of knife constitute in circumstances a threat to inflict bodily harm within meaning of definition of 'aggravating circumstances'. conviction upheld, sentence set aside and remitted to regional magistrate to b imposed afresh.

Judges: Bam J
Summary: criminal law. rape. of under 16. famous tennis coach now age 75. poor health and suffering from hostile public comments. 8 years' imprisonment on each of 2 counts with 2 years suspended.

Defendant: HCB 2014 JDR 1327 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 77 (GP)
Judges: SA Thobane AJ and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. applicable to accomplices. act identifies accomplices as perpetrators in addition to accused and co.perpetrator. no substantial and compelling circumstances warranting deviation from minimum sentence. accomplice to own children's abuse. appeal dismissed, sentences confirmed.

Defendant: Haupt 2017 JDR 1351 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 12 (GP)
Judges: SAM Baqwa J and MA Hawyes AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. attempted rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. attempted rape (two counts) and sexual assault of 12.year.old girl. testimony not clear and reliable and cautionary rule not adequately applied. evidence not persuasive of guilt beyond reasonable. appeal succeeds and convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: Holland-Muter AJ and L Scholtz AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. in what cases. special review in terms of s 304a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. unclear whether sentences on 2 counts of theft to be served separately. ordered that rider by magistrate that 'counts taken together for purpose of sentence' be struck and be replaced by 'sentences on both counts to run concurrently'.

Judges: ALCM Lephoko AJ and TM Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. theft. attempted theft. what constitutes. prove beyond reasonable doubt that appellant had necessary intention to commit offence, commenced with steps to achieve objective but failed due to some intervening cause. evidence of state witnesses did not advance state case in this regard. conviction and sentence on attempted theft of motor vehicle set aside, conviction and sentence on count 2 confirmed.

Judges: Msimeki J and Holland-M\'fctter AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. more than once. accused and another raped victim. later in the evening at different locations, the accused raped the victim twice more. argued that his time awaiting trial and that victim not injured amounting to substantial and compelling circumstances. that victim not injured not such circumstance. society needing protection from the likes of accused. life imprisonment confirmed on appeal.

Judges: NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. factors to be taken into account. accused, suspect in 6 other incidents of stock theft, value r2 400 000. appellant handed himself over to police. likelihood of interference with state witnesses or evading trial. failure by applicant to rebut existence of prima facie case, when likelihood of interference, severity of charge, gravity of punishment, it would not be interest of justice to release applicant on bail. might be flight risk. appeal against refusal of bail dismissed.

Judges: Fisher J (Munzhelele AJ concurring)
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. court committing error in law by imputing consent to child below age of 12 and considering imputation in its sentence. supreme court of appeal setting aside sentence of 10 years, 5 of which were conditionally suspended, and matter remitted for consideration of sentence afresh. upon such reconsideration, present court imposing life sentence.

Judges: W Pienaar J and N Mali J
Summary: criminal law. indictment and charge. duplication of convictions. conspiracy to commit robbery and attempted robbery. inherent power of review used to prevent travesty of justice. conviction on count of conspiracy set aside. misdirection by magistrate in overemphasizing seriousness of offence entitling court to sentence afresh\'97 pregnant single mother, aged 38, with 3 other children. expressed remorse. tried to prevent complainant being hurt by co.perpetrator. sentence of 5 years imprisonment set aside and replaced with correctional supervision in terms of s 276(1)(i).

Judges: VV Tlhapi J and L Vukeya AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. attempted murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. also 1 count of kidnapping and 2 counts of grievous assault. no merit in appellant's argument of conspiracy to concoct evidence. no misdirection in convictions. sentences of 3 years' imprisonment each for attempted murder and kidnapping confirmed. similar sentences for assault charges too harsh and substituted with 6 months on each count.

Judges: M Beatson AJ and DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. theft of motor vehicle. over.emphasised gravity of offence by holding appellant part of group who stole vehicles daily. no evidence to support such finding. failed to consider appellant first offender. sentence disproportionate to crime. appeal allowed, sentence set aside and replaced with 5 years' imprisonment.

Judges: Shirjlele AJ (Hughes J concurring)
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to steal and theft. sentence. generator and monkey wrench. pleaded guilty and first offender\'97 remorseful and co.operated with police. father of 5 and 27 years old. sentence too harsh and appeared that court a quo influenced by its views on foreign nationals. appeal upheld and 2 years of four.year sentence suspended.

Judges: C Pretorius J and RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. against refusal of. no reasonable possibility another court will come to different conclusion on conviction and sentence. magistrate did not err when convicting. application dismissed.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. sentence. factors to be taken into account. provoked by complainant in count 1, showed remorse, pleaded guilty. no evidence of nature of injuries. sentence too harsh, considering suspended sentence might be put into operation. sentence set aside, sentenced to 2 years' imprisonment, suspended.

Judges: EE Sethole AJ and NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. rape of 7.year.old. evidence of complainant acceptable despite delay in first report of claim. conviction in order. accused 46 years.old, uncle of complainant and first offender. no misdirection in imposition of sentence by court a quo and life term confirmed on appeal.

Judges: BR Southwood J and P Ellis AJ and S Potterill AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. life sentences to be reserved for cases devoid of substantial and compelling circumstances. cases of extreme violence and humiliation regarded as such. no violence or injuries in this instance. personal circumstances of accused to be taken into consideration. appeal upheld, sentence set aside and reduced to 10 years'.

Judges: Makhubele AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against refusal of bail. onus on appellant to prove interests of justice favour release on bail. applicant being foreigner not reason enough to refuse bail. magistrate erred by not failed to take all factors into consideration and not imposing suitable conditions to bail. bail granted subject to conditions contained in order of court.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and MJ Teffo J
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. trial. review. transpired accused a minor at time of committing offence. proceedings set aside and to be dealt with in terms of provisions of child justice act 75 of 2008.

Judges: K la M Manamela, AJ and JW Louw J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single and child witness. cautionary rules. corroboration found in medical evidence. corroborated by medical evidence. appellant's denial highly improbable. conviction in order. sentence. forty.year.old stepfather of 12. year.old complainant. first offender. breadwinner. trial court not properly balancing all objects of punishment. life term reduced to 18 years.

Defendant: Essop 2017 JDR 1961 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 99 (GP)
Judges: SS Maakane AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. application for. pending appeal. appeal against sentence. prospects of success. magistrate misdirecting himself as to nature of offences. bail granted.

Judges: Magardie AJ and Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. charges included rape, sexual assault, sexual grooming and compelling complainant to witness sexual acts or masturbation. appellant's stepdaughter and between ages of 14 and 17 at time of offences, the rape at age 17. pleaded guilty and showed remorse. pre.sentencing report recommending correctional supervision. effective sentence of 23 years inducing sense of shock. sentence altered to imposition of correctional supervision on rape charge. suspended sentences imposed on remaining counts and name to be entered in register for sex offenders.

Defendant: Engelbrecht 2015 JDR 0584 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 392 (GP)
Judges: S Potterill J and KE Matojane J
Summary: criminal law. review. in what cases. juvenile. non.compliance with s 85 (1)(b) of child justice act 75 of 2008. although did not comply with all procedural requirements, question is whether justice prevailed, and if in interests of justice to set aside conviction and sentence. conviction set aside and replaced with common law crime of escaping custody. no prejudice to accused as was legally represented. sentence set aside, to be reconsidered taking into consideration child justice act.

Judges: I Ellis AJ and LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to rape and rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. shack broken into and student raped twice by sisters' boyfriend. corroborated by medical evidence and first report. evidence of complainant treated with necessary caution. appellant unimpressive witness. conviction in order. abuse of trust. no condom used. no reason to interfere with imposition of prescribed life term.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and AA Louw J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. assessment of. inferential reasoning. court measure proven facts against explanation of first appellant, found to be improbable. in consideration of all proven facts, state proved beyond reasonable doubt only inference to be drawn was appellants were involved. appellants also in possession of stolen items shortly after robbery. doctrine of recent possession invoked. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MA Hawyes AJ and SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. sentence. 2 counts of armed robbery. prescribed minimum sentence of 15 years imposed on each count, 10 years of which to run concurrently. victims not physically harmed. self.employed, 33 years old and previous convictions for possession on unlicensed firearms \'97 no misdirection in sentence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Du Plessis AJ and Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. attempted murder. evidence to sustain charges. also assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm (count 2). licensed firearm used as weapon to fend off drunk complainants in club, shot going off at some point in melee. should have realised firearms could be discharged in such circumstances. evidence supporting conviction for attempted murder in count 1 on basis of dolus eventualis but only for assault on count 2. married father of seven, employed and with no previous convictions. sentences too harsh and reduced to wholly suspended sentence on both counts.

Judges: MA Makume J and N Nkosi AJ
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. truck and contents to value of r2 million. part of syndicate \'96 age 34, married with 2 children. guilty plea. goods recovered same day. minimum sentence not justified. sentence of 15 years' imprisonment altered to10 years.

Judges: T Brenner AJ and R Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. appellant convicted of accepting and not returning r30 000 deposit for sale of motor vehicle and then selling same vehicle to another party. qualified advocate, 42 years of age with previous convictions. no remorse. sentence of 4 years' imprisonment confirmed.

Judges: W Hughes J and AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. single witness. rape of 6.year.old girl. by uncle. in her bedroom after braai. corroborated by medical evidence. no misdirection in rejection of appellant's evidence. no grounds for interference with sentence of 15 years imprisonment. appeal dismissed.

Judges: AA Louw J and RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. admission of guilt. accused paying admission of guilt fine on written notice in terms of s 57(1)(b) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. accused unaware that she would acquire criminal record. admission of guilt set aside.

Judges: EM Makgoba J and PD Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. obstructing the course of justice. what constitutes. no legal duty on appellant, after having reported crime to police to assist police in its investigations. access to victim was unrestricted and at least 11 police officers knew victim was at care facility. no legal duty alleged in charge sheet, no conviction could follow. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: TM Makgoka J and N Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. generally. approach on appeal. credibility findings of trial court. no misdirection committed. appellant failed to identify any material misdirection in manner in which evidence was considered. application for leave to appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Dos Santos 2017 JDR 2053 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 20 (GP)
Judges: HF Jacobs AJ and C Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. human trafficking. sentence. imprisonment. life imprisonment \'97woman part of criminal enterprise trafficking young women to south africa for sexual purposes. sentence upheld on appeal.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and JW Louw J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. accused convicted under obsolete legislation. firearms control act 60 of 2000 removed provisions of repealed arms and ammunition act 75 of 1969. appropriate to set aside conviction, prosecution to continue in terms of s 313 and 324 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Judges: Shirilele A.J (Hughes J concurring)
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence \'97 rape of 4.year.old girl \'97 guilty plea. remorseful. nineteen years old, first offender. caught in act. child suffering incontinence and displaying signs of trauma. no grounds for interference with imposition of prescribed life term.

Judges: Manyathi AJ and Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. theft. what constitutes. appellants pushing motor vehicle out of parking bay but disturbed before could remove entirely. court satisfied that appropriation had taken place and correctly convicted of theft of motor vehicle. further conviction of theft of r900 cash and radio face from interior confirmed. no misdirection in effective sentences of 8 and 11 year's imprisonment, respectively, for first and second appellants.

Judges: Francis J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. against sentence for murder and aggravated robbery. application for. factors raised already considered when deviating from minimum sentence. no reasonable prospects of another court reaching different conclusion. application dismissed.

Judges: CP Rabie J, NM Mavundla J and MHE Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. also charges of housebreaking with intent to steal and theft, aggravated robbery and unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition. gang stole 4 shotguns and ammunition during break.in of shopping centre. security guards shot and killed when returned to rob shops. insufficient emphasis on youthfulness of appellant. effective sentence of 50 years reduced to 35 years.

Judges: Jansen J and Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. cautionary rule. children. complainant both single witness and child witness. evidence consistent with letter written to stepmother and what told to teacher. version credible in all respects. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Maumela J and Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. trial. assessors. appointment of. for purposes of trial. failure to appoint assessors in terms of s 93ter does not constitute such an irregularity as would render proceedings per se failure of justice. discussion of stare decisis principle and precedence of s v naicker and s v du plessis. reviewed, despite accused not having been convicted. ordered to be remitted back to court to continue.

Judges: N Kollapen J, LM Molopa-Sethosa J, TJ Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. what constitutes. refusal of presiding officer to recuse himself in circumstances where he convicted appellant's co.accused on plea of guilty in separate trial. mere fact of such not giving rise to reasonable apprehension of bias, judges often required to admit confessions where co.accused implicated. no basis for trial judge to have acceded to request for recusal and appeal had to fail.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and M Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. child. age 17 and charged with theft. age only emerging after conviction. conviction set aside and matter remitted back to magistrate for child to be assessed by probation officer or otherwise handled according to the child justice act 75 of 2008.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. cautionary rules. necessary caution taken in assessing evidence of complainant as single witness. complainant proved to be credible and reliable witness. no discrepancies or contradictions. corroboration not required as other witnesses evidence would not have implicated appellant in commission of offence. appeal against conviction dismissed, appeal on sentence succeeds, sentence reduced to 8 years' imprisonment.

Judges: PM Mabuse J and WRC Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. recusal. in what cases. judgment reserved in application for bail pending appeal. recusal by magistrate upon receipt of letter from accused expressing dissatisfaction with manner of adjudication\'97 should not have done so without substantive application on part of accused. matter to proceed afresh before another magistrate.

Judges: NM Mavundla J and HJ De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. onus of proof on state. reasonable possibility that accused not guilty. single witness. caution. dna results exclude appellant. appeal upheld, convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: W Hughes J and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to steal and theft. state did not prove accused broke into complainant's home on count 1. in the circumstances removal of complainant's property resulted in theft. court exercising powers in terms of s 304(4) of cpa to set aside conviction on count 1 to replace with theft conviction. sentence confirmed.

Defendant: Dibakoane 2015 JDR 1090 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 532 (GP)
Judges: Ismail J and Swartz AJ
Summary: criminal law. fundamental rights. right to legal representation at state expense. legal representation is a fundamental right however has its limitations and cannot be used to delay trial or frustrate commencement. appellant was not interested in securing legal assistance. appeal dismissed, conviction and sentence confirmed.

Judges: JW Louw J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. cautionary rule. children. complainant both single witness and child witness. evidence was not clear and satisfactory in every material aspect. appeal succeeds, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: CP Rabie J and VRSN Nkosi AJ
Summary: criminal law. theft. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. money for purchase of grain used for other purposes by director of grain commodity services company. dispute over nature of agreement between parties. misdirection in evaluation of probabilities. appeal succeeding and convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. in respect of convictions and sentences. all relevant factors considered by court a quo. not persuaded another court would come to different opinion. application dismissed.

Judges: Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. aggravated robbery, theft and defeating the administration of justice. accused dishonest and struggled to answer straight.forward questions. version that acted in self.defence inherently improbable. on conspectus of evidence accused lured deceased, a taxi driver, to house with intent to kill him and rob of for motor vehicle. sentence. nineteen years old and left school in grade 6. brazen and callous killing. no remorse. dumped body in secluded spot. found in possession of stolen vehicle by tracker. no substantial and compelling circumstances. sentenced to life term for murder, 15 years for robbery, 3 years for theft and 5 years for defeating the ends of justice.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J, WRC Prinsloo J and NV Khumalo
Summary: criminal law. obstructing course of justice. poachers shot in self.defence by 16.year.old son of game farm owner. bodies burned to disguise cause of death. first offender, 59 years old and married with 2 children. committed out of fear and to protect son. lost everything and had to sell farm following threats from surrounding community. sentence in order.

Defendant: De Beer 2016 JDR 0543 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 106 (GP)
Judges: MM Jansen J and Kganyago AJ
Summary: criminal law. legal representative. conduct of. plea explanation tendered in terms of s 115 of cpa shocking and unprofessional. failure to call witnesses possibly due to awareness of accused's lack of funds. convictions set aside and remitted to regional court to allow applicant to lead further evidence.

Judges: Jansen J and Rabie J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. sentence too harsh. suspended part to be omitted. furthermore invoice to be amended to reflect correct case number, payment made and by correct accused. sentence amended accordingly.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and A Basson J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. white collar crime. fifty.one.year.old engineer falsifying claims for projects for kickbacks. company reimbursed in full. guilty plea. no misdirection in imposition of sentence. sentence of 8 years confirmed on appeal.

Judges: I Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. pending petition to high court. theft of trust funds and fraud by attorney. case arguable on facts. magistrate may have erred in application of relevant law. reasonable prospects of success. entitled to bail pending finalisation of appeal.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J and TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. theft by attorney of trust moneys. substantial and compelling circumstances found to deviate from minimum sentence of 15 years imprisonment. sentence of 8 years imposed. not shockingly inappropriate. appeal dismissed.

Judges: RG Tolmay J and N Kollapen J and D Makhoba AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. of mentally disabled person. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. also charge of housebreaking and theft. clear from answers and evidence that understood proceedings and was competent witness. not satisfied met legal definition of mental disability. stolen items found in appellant's room. evidence of guilt overwhelming. conviction on rape charges confirmed though words 'of mentally disabled person' in order deleted. conviction for housebreaking and theft confirmed.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. value of goods relevant factor affecting severity of sentence. court ought to have considered ability of accused to pay fine and fine within reach of accused. court misdirected itself. sentence set aside, replaced with fine of r3000 or 3 months' imprisonment.

Judges: D Dosio AJ and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. elements of. absence of consent. both factual and legal. complainant mentally challenged. at no point evidence of factual consent. basis alone appeal fails. not strict compliance with s 1 of criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act 32 of 2007). cannot with certainty say no legal consent. however on evidence clear complainant unable to differentiate between meaning of "rape" or "sexual intercourse". appeal fails as no factual consent proven. appeal against conviction and sentence fails.

Judges: Ismail J
Summary: criminal law. bail. schedule 6 offences. appeal against refusal of. refusal by regional magistrate. robbery aggravating; possession of arms and ammunition; possession of explosives. appellant arrested because of gunshot wound to leg, similar to that sustained by perpetrator. dna and cellphone evidence against appellant. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Moloto AJ and Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. rape. of children under 16. accused age 20. accused's relative youthfulness insignificant in face of rape of 7 year olds. 2 life sentences confirmed on appeal.

Judges: TA Maumela J and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. inference drawn not only reasonable inference that could be drawn from available facts. does not exclude version of appellant, that hired to drive truck not knowing was hijacked. state witness unable to identify attackers. mere fact drove stolen truck insufficient evidence. appeal upheld.

Judges: EM Kubushi J and AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. counterfeit goods. in terms of penalty clause in act, imprisonment period in respect of current offence may not exceed 3 years. miscarriage of justice. sentence set aside, replaced with r24 000, alternatively 3 years imprisonment\'97counterfeit goods act 37 of 1997, ss 2(1) and 19.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J, MF Legodi J and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. charge.sheet. where state intends to rely upon sentencing regime created by act, needs to be brought to attention of accused. failed to stipulate in charge sheet nor any mention made of section or act during proceedings. sentence of life imprisonment wrongly imposed. sentence set aside and sentence of 20 years' imprisonment imposed.

Judges: DS Molefe J and RG Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. what constitutes. accused's legal representative in regional court never admitted as attorney. constituting fatal irregularity. proceedings set aside on review and trial to start de novo. possibility of criminal charges to be investigated.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. irregularity by court not to convict and sentence accused after plea of guilty submitted. matter remitted to regional court to remedy omission.

Judges: EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. applicant's claim for damages for assault by police dismissed. leave granted on basis another court might find differently on probabilities.

Judges: Maumela J and Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. non.compliance with s 74 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. accused was 17 years of age but charge sheet reflected age of 18. section is peremptory. parent or guardian to assist accused in criminal proceedings. prejudicial to accused if not assisted. proceedings set aside and referred back to be heard de novo.

Judges: Munzhelele AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. from magistrates' court to high court farm employee facing charges of murder and attempted murder (sch 5). incidents occurring during attempt by complainants and deceased to steal scrap metal from farms. all factors considered by court a quo. no misdirection in finding that appellant had not shown interests of justice demanded release on bail. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MM Jansen J and De Klerk AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. victim almost 16. accused aged 26, first offender and under influence of alcohol. having regret that incident occurred. 10 years of which 4 suspended.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. correctional supervision. conversion of imprisonment into correctional supervision in terms of s 286b of cpa. accused incarcerated for 23 years' since indefinite sentence imposed in terms of s 286b of cpa. accused has undergone various programmes within prison and positive outcomes which would help integrate into society. accused suitable candidate for sentence to be converted to correctional supervision.

Judges: MV Semenya AJ and LT Modiba AJ and MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. murder, robbery with aggravating circumstances. sentence. thirty years imposed on each of 2 counts of murder, 20 years for aggravated robbery. fifteen years on 1 murder count to run concurrently with other. father and son killed and robbed of r23 000 business takings. appellant contending that effective sentence cruel, inhuman and degrading. was 33 years old, employed, owned property, married with 3 children and had previous conviction for robbery and assault. court finding offences committed out of greed not need. sentences confirmed but cumulative effect excessive, sentences ordered to run concurrently.

Judges: TM Makgoka AJ and R M Keightley AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. robbery with aggravating circumstances. minimum sentence of 25 years' imprisonment for third offender in terms of s 51(2)(a) of act. previous convictions would have to be that of robbery with aggravating circumstances to trigger s 51(2). not sufficient that previous conviction 1 of robbery only. was robbery simpliciter. trial court misdirected itself in its interpretation the previous convictions. sentence substituted for 15 years' imprisonment.

Defendant: Bakane 2015 JDR 2389 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 576 (GP)
Judges: FG Preller J, NV Khumalo and KLAM Manamela AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. admissibility. pointing out. trial court accepting that some slapping and rough handling took place. using discretion to accept the somewhat tainted evidence in the interest of justice. on appeal. the prohibition is against the admission of evidence obtained by a process that violates the constitutional rights of the accused. only if the accused person has been tortured or assaulted in order to force information from him, must that information be excluded \'97the rule does not mean that any improper conduct, even if unconnected to the making of the statement, results in the exclusion of evidence. that would be an application of the controversial rigid exclusionary rule of north american law.

Judges: NB Tuchten J and HJ Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity. what constitutes. guilty plea under s 112(1)(a) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 and court imposing incompetent sentence of imprisonment without option of fine. conviction and sentence reviewed and set aside. remitted to trial court for further consideration.

Judges: Bam J and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. admission of guilt. setting aside of. admission of guilt fine paid after accused misled by attorney. no intention to plead guilty. probable accused did not fully appreciate and understand consequences of admission of guilt. set aside.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. murder. senseless and sustained pursuit. kidnapped bystander and forced him to drive accused and injured victim. fired at person trying to intervene. burned dying victim alive. age 30 and having deprived and fatherless upbringing. life sentence.

Judges: E Swartz AJ and TA Maumela J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. failure of accused to testify or lead evidence. court bound to conclude that totality of evidence taken in conjunction with silence excluded any reasonable doubt about guilt.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 2160 (GP)
Judges: Nonyane AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). on rape charge withdrawn following day. arrested solely on pointing out by complainant suspected of fraud. suspicion not reasonable. arrest and detention unlawful. awarded damages of r60 0000.

Defendant: Minister of South African Police Services 2015 JDR 2265 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. commercial offences. companies. offences in terms of companies act 61 of 1973, ss 417 and 418. application for order directing that respondents, in event prosecutor seeking warrant of arrest on criminal charges for alleged offences under provisions, present copy of present application and any order issued pursuant thereto to the magistrate. fears of arrest premature. application removed from roll for lack of urgency.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 0272 (GP)
Judges: Khami Makhafola J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality. arrest without a warrant. contending subjected to xenophobic attack by 2 white members of saps. alleging unlawful arrest, injuria, arrest and detention. denied knowing men were members of saps who were busy with counterfeit operation at market at time. plaintiffs lacking credibility. defendants justified in using force to control situation. claim dismissed.

Judges: Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. unlawful search, arrest, detention, malicious prosecution. claims not proven. plaintiffs claims dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 1156 (GP)
Judges: D Makhoba AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). policeman pointed as assisting in 'truck hijacking'. incident reported in daily sun newspaper. case withdrawn as main witness untraceable. plaintiff's evidence improbable and false and arresting officer exercising discretion rationally. arrest lawful. claim dismissed.

Judges: TM Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. parole. requirements for release. prisoner serving sentence of life imprisonment. parole board recommending release of prisoner on day parole to prepare for full parole. national council of correctional services (the nccs) not accepting recommendation of parole board and placing further for applicant. minister accepting recommendations of nccs. nccs and minister's decisions made without having regard to the judgment on sentence, a key requirement. decision set aside on review and matter remitted to minister for reconsideration.

Judges: NP Mngqibisa-Thusi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. unlawful arrest, detention, malicious prosecution and assault. mutually destructive versions. evidence of plaintiff and his witness full of contradictions and inconsistencies. plaintiff tailored evidence. claims not proven. plaintiff claims dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 2281 (GP)
Judges: Mngqibisa-Thusi J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. based on accusation that murdered person and sold body parts. shame and isolation in community after accusations of witchcraft. no longer able to practice as traditional healers. detention lasting approximately 300 days before matter withdrawn. awarded r930 000 and r750 000, respectively, for unlawful arrest and detention and r150 000 for malicious prosecution.

Defendant: The Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2017 JDR 1607 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 218 (GP)
Judges: Legodi J and Molefe J and Unterhalter AJ
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. parole. eligibility of prisoner for placement on. provisions of s 73(6)(b)(iv) of correctional services act 111 of 1998, in that adopting date of sentencing and not commission of offence as determining when more severe regime came into operation, inconsistent with the provisions of s 9 of constitution.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 1088 (GP)
Judges: SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful detention and assault. severely assaulted on way to police station by police officers. suffocated with a plastic bag, kicked in face, handcuffed during duration of assault. incarcerated in bad cell conditions for 3 days. awarded r816 000.

Judges: JJ Strijdom AJ and SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. whether had reasonable grounds to suspect appellants had committed offences. evidence that arresting officer formed suspicion which is objectively sustainable. reasonable suspicion that committed public violence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Nowosentz L AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. plaintiff arrested and detained for 44 days for illegally entering and remaining in south africa, despite producing and handing in passport and valid work permit. police failed to inform prosecutor of this fact. plaintiff drug counsellor, speaks widely on topic. well.known and highly regarded in community. r600 000 awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 1176 (GP)
Judges: Hiemstra AJ
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. return of goods. application for. order to return goods would be brutum fulmen. no case made to vary order. applicants also failed to follow correct procedures.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security (Police) 2014 JDR 2418 (GP)
Judges: EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. mutually destructive factual accounts. versions of complainant and appellants conflicting. plaintiff and witness for, impressive witnesses. evidence credible compared to defendant's. contradictions between statement and evidence in court material. plaintiff case proved on balance of probabilities. claim succeeds with costs.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2015 JDR 0781 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 103 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J, WRC Prinsloo J and AA Louw J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. forfeiture order. application for in terms of s 48 of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998 (poca). whether application infringes appellant's constitutional rights to fair trial and property. court must protect rights on factual grounds. balancing of rights against legislative objectives of poca. outweighs rights of appellant. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Head of Rooigrond Correctional Centre 2015 JDR 0250 (GP)
Judges: BA Mashile J
