Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. parole. lengthy term of imprisonment imposed before coming into operation of correctional services act 111 of 1998. where offenders sentenced before ch iv of act came into operation and placement on parole is considered, to be guided by policies and guidelines applied by former parole boards. error that act was applied indiscriminately without any reference to policies and guidelines. respondents are ordered to consider placement of applicants on parole.

Judges: C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). identity document stolen and used in various fraudulent acts. arrest based on mtn statement linked to cellphone used. not reasonable to form suspicion on such scant evidence and arrest accordingly unlawful. in cells for 5 days, not allowed to change clothes and food so bad could not eat it. awarded r90 000 in damages.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security NO 2014 JDR 1730 (GP)
Judges: Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. seizure by police in terms of ss 20 and 22 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. no facts advanced to justify reasonable grounds existed to search and seize without warrant. search and seizure thus unlawful and set aside. goods and monies as per list annexure a to be returned to applicant.

Judges: L Adams AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest on a warrant. zimbabwean citizen arrested. mistaken identity. unlawful arrest not justified by s 46 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. awarded r240 000 in damages for unlawful arrest and detention.

Judges: Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. legality of. all jurisdictional requirements. police officer acted with reasonable suspicion that plaintiff involved in robbery. arrest and detention lawful met to discharge onus. claim dismissed.

Judges: NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. forfeiture order. application for in terms of s 48 of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. volkswagen 365 scirocco motor vehicle \'97 on basis instrumentality of offence or acquired with proceeds of unlawful activities. court not persuaded funds lawfully acquired. order granted.

Judges: S Potterill J and JW Louw J
Summary: criminal law. domestic violence. protection orders. variation of order. provision of emergency maintenance deleted in subsequent court appearance. was varied without appellant being court. emergency monetary relief cannot be open.ended maintenance for applicant and/or child. magistrate did not err in granting amendment. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Gcabashe AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b) detained for 14 months until acquittal in regional court on charge of robbery of a spaza shop. in dispute whether injuries to feet caused by police assault or though running on hot sand and rocks when allegedly chased from scene. mutually destructive versions. witnesses for defendant not credible and probabilities favouring plaintiff. defendant liable.

Judges: Ranchod J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). on charge of theft \'97 arrest justified but detention after expiry of 48 hours until brought before court unlawful. damages of r85 000 awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Constitutional Development 2017 JDR 0066 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 659 (GP)
Judges: NV Khumalo J
Summary: criminal law. intimidation. contravention of s 1(1) of intimidation act 72 of 1982. constitutionality of. expressions or threats of instigation of violence excluded from protection of freedom of expression by s 16(2) of constitution. reverse onus provision in s 1(2) justified by nature of penalty sanctioned and ease with which accused could discharge onus.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant . criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40. lawfulness of. onus on defendant to prove lawfulness of actions. upon failure to discharge onus. upon application by plaintiffs for judgment at close of defendant's case.judgment for plaintiffs without hearing their evidence.

Judges: Mali AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention\'97 plaintiff arrested and detained for 2 days with 30 other detainees. no explanation provided for arrest, conducted in presence of fianc\'e9e. had to explain to employer was reason for absence from work. plaintiff felt humiliated and unlawfully deprived of liberty. awarded r70000 in damages.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 0002 (GP)
Judges: MD Mohlamonyane AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, ss 40(1)(a) and (h). legality of. plaintiff shot during arrest for possession of dagga. plaintiff was the aggressor and police actions justified. claim for damages dismissed.

Judges: Kollapen J and SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. domestic violence. protection orders. interim protection orders directed to be served on minor respondents in presence of guardian. no specific provision for rights of child respondents in proceedings in terms of act. evident children's act 38 of 2005 providing overarching and comprehensive protection to all children in all legal proceedings, which included the protection from harassment act. act accordingly not in violation of equality guarantee as related to treatment of child complainants and respondents. protection from harassment act 17 of 2011, s 3.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2017 JDR 0004 (GP)
Judges: D Pillay J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. appellant never informed that provisions applicable and sentence adjudicated afresh. rape of 6.year.old by 26.year.old. unmarried with 2 children. no remorse and very serious offence. appeal upheld and sentence of 22 years' imprisonment imposed.

Judges: Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for malicious prosecution. duration and conditions of detention. personal circumstances and other factors considered.

Defendant: The Minister of Safety and Security 2018 JDR 0323 (GP)
Judges: ML Senyatsi AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. action for damages. against police. quantum. allegation by police that plaintiff kept human skeleton and unlicensed firearm at his home, resulting in forced relocation as endangered in community and violation of dignity. awarded r850 000 in damages.

Judges: Maboku Isaac Mangena AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). arrest for alleged riotous behaviour in public. mutually destructive versions. unnecessary demonstration of power by police, version far.etched and afterthought to avoid liability. minister liable for proved damages.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 2063 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 682 (GP)
Judges: E Bertelsmann J, S Mothle J and FG Preller J
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. search warrant. setting aside of. conditions under which issued interpreted strictly to avoid invasion of privacy. affidavit used to apply for warrants failed to comply with formalities required. appeal succeeds.

Judges: MF Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest, assault and detention. purpose of damages. game ranger, employed for 20 years at kruger national park, unlawfully arrested for alleged possession of horn and firearms. assaulted incurring injuries to arms legs and feet. suffered reputational damage among colleagues and community. awarded r200 000 for unlawful arrest and detention and r150 000 for the assault.

Judges: Keightley AJ
Summary: criminal law. assault. by police officer. plaintiff unable to show deliberately shot by police. no claim in alternative, negligently. evidence of complainant and witness had material contradictions. credible aspects of plaintiff's evidence, taken with defendant's evidence do not support plaintiff's case. claim dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 2315 (GP)
Judges: Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. another court may come to different conclusion. application granted. superior courts act 10 of 2013, s17(1)(a).

Judges: MP Canca AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. against judgement and order for payment of damages for unlawful arrest in sum of r180 000. contending inter alia that sum excessive. allowing for depreciation, in line with awards in similar matters. no reasonable prospects of success. application dismissed.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J, N Ranchod J and HJ Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. detention by police for longer than 48 hours. investigating officer informed late of arrest and only able to transport to court on tuesday (arrested on saturday). whether continued detention lawful. no evidence of obstructive behaviour on behalf of investigating officer. acted with due expedition and in compliance with s 35(1)(d)(ii) of the constitution. appeal upheld and successful claim for damages by respondents in court a quo set aside.

Judges: NB Tuchten J, MW Msimeki J and HJ De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). zimbabwean truck driver arrested and truck confiscated. documents reflected consignment containing teak decking but in reality containing contraband cigarettes. no evidence arresting officers knew that first respondent knowingly transporting contraband or that reasonably suspected such. awards of r 280 000 for arrest and detention and r 377 510 for loss of income not contested on appeal.

Judges: GC Wright J
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. defences. justification. private defence. strict conditions. defensive act must be necessary. police officer shooting through closed door to defend himself from attack by 2 angry men. no way to escape from house he was in. in circumstances acted reasonably. claim dismissed.

Judges: Munzhelele AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. defendant denying that plaintiffs arrested and detained at police station. defendants' case full of contradictions and allegations of assault appeared fabricated. failed to prove claim on balance of probabilities and claims dismissed.

Judges: MA Lukhaimane AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. legality of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). unlawful arrest and assault while in detention. conflicting versions of what transpired at scene. insufficient evidence of assault. all actions dismissed with costs.

Judges: N Janse Van Nieuwenhuizen J
Summary: criminal law. damages. for unlawful arrest and detention. 5 months on charge of armed robbery at casino (where employed as cashier) despite no evidence. hardworking 29.year.old humiliated in front of wife and child. lost employment, accommodation and financially embarrassed. awarded r1 041 315.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 1902 (GP)
Judges: W Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. damages. for assault. awarded against police. fired on vehicle. gunshot wound to plaintiff's back, exiting lower abdomen. left with significant scarring and ptsd. awarded. r500 000 general damages; r236 690 for future medical expenses; and r4 696 191 for future loss of earnings.

Judges: NB Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. no evidence led as to suspicion by arresting officer. arresting officer's approach to power of arrest is when in possession of statement implicating suspect he must arrest. arrest thus not justified and lawful. awarded r150 000 damages.

Judges: AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. damages. action for damages. against police. quantum. community patroller sustained gunshot wound to right foot. continued to suffer effects of bullet shrapnel in foot, scarring and impaired function. awarded r162 815 for future medical expenses and r 100 00 in general damages.

Judges: Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest and detention. plaintiff arrested as suspect in attempted armed robbery, and allegedly assaulted at various points during course of arrest and subsequent thereto. was never charged. was reasonable suspicion of involvement. continued detention subsequent to non.identification of suspects, and refusal of complainant to proceed with charges, lawful, being justified by objective facts. claim for unlawful arrest and detention dismissed but claim in respect of unlawful assault upheld.

Judges: SS Mphahlele J
Summary: criminal law. damages. action for damages. against police. for alleged assault during arrest. versions mutually destructive. plaintiff's version more probable. minister 100 % liable for proved damages.

Judges: H Kooverjie AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. liability of. plaintiff claiming assaulted and detained in room during altercation with police officer at station where trying to have documents certified. episode probably sparked by plaintiffs confrontational attitude. claim dismissed.

Judges: MF Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. legality of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). on suspicion of kidnapping after plaintiff handed identity document to daughter 2 weeks after her father disappeared. decision to arrest taken before interview \'97 suspicion not reasonable and arrest unlawful. awarded r375 for unlawful arrest and detention, r100 000 for infringement of dignity and respect.

Judges: De Klerk AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. domestic violence. interim protection order having been issued against person but not served upon her. arrested without a warrant of arrest. protection order stipulates arrest to be effected if imminent harm to complainant. conduct of plaintiff did not constitute imminent harm. arrest unlawful. awarded r55 000 damages.

Judges: A Millar AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). plaintiff accused of wrongfully letting stolen truck pass border checkpoint while on duty as police officer. arrest based on information received that could and should have been investigated further. case ultimately withdrawn. minister of police liable. quantum. 5 days in custody before release on bail. suffered added humiliation as incarcerated in uniform and at police station where previously stationed. awarded damages of r275 000.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Constitutional Development 2014 JDR 1801 (GP)
Judges: AA Louw J and DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. trial. discharge of accused at close of state case. discharge partially granted. review application against by first application. refusal of discharge interlocutory order and not appealable. no possibility of review unless irregularities in trial alleged. irregularity which leads to failure of justice. if renders trial unfair. application refused, case referred for finalisation.

Judges: JS Strydom AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. liability. for criminal acts committed by police officer. plaintiff punched and kicked by unidentified policemen who appeared to be looking for a particular suspect. defence 1 of bare denial. court finding police liable on the probabilities.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 2558 (GP)
Judges: M Beatson AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). reasonable grounds for arrest. no reasonable conduct in this regard. refusal to allow plaintiff to produce identity document, or to compare identity numbers removes all reasonableness from conduct of arresting person. arrest was unlawful. damages of r75000 awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2017 JDR 1440 (GP)
Judges: A Millar AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. for assault. plaintiff arrested without warrant, wrongfully and unlawfully shot and unlawfully detained by the police. suffered abdominal gunshot wound, small and large bowel perforation and frank hematuria. readmitted for further surgery for intestinal obstruction secondary to adhesions that had formed. awarded globular award of r650 000.

Judges: Makhubele AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest, assault and detention. evidence does not satisfy requirements of s 40 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. no reasonable suspicion justifying arrest and detention. claim upheld, liable to compensate plaintiff for 100% of proven or agreed damages.

Defendant: The Minister of Correctional Services 2017 JDR 1835 (GP)
Judges: Louw J
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. action for damages against minister of prisons and prison officials. liability. inmate claiming arm broken by wardens with batons when he intervened to stop fight. evidence of warders contradictory and evasive. court finding for plaintiff.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 0949 (GP)
Judges: Modiba AJ (Msimeki J and Olivier AJ concurring)
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(c). claim partially successful as detention on ground that ceased to be unlawful when remanded in custody. on appeal, seeking order declaring whole detention period unlawful. implicated by admission statement of another known by arresting officer to have been induced by torture. no substantial reason for arrest and detention in violation of constitutional rights. no reason for further detention and order of magistrate for remand in custody not sanitising unlawfulness of detention. appeal successful and damages adjusted accordingly.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 1691 (GP)
Judges: Jansen J and Mbha J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40. lawfulness of. mob arrest. arrest lawful in circumstances. subsequent assault however unlawful and wrongful. appeal in respect of unlawful arrest and detention dismissed, appeal against unlawful assaut upheld.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 2643 (GP)
Judges: EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. without warrant for cable theft and detained for 3 days in police station. subsequently remanded in custody for 40 days. plaintiff applying for default judgment in claim for damages in amount of r1 500 000. subsequent detention by court order therefore not unlawful and plaintiff accordingly only entitled to damages for 3.day.period. compensation in amount of r800 000 just and equitable.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2017 JDR 0159 (GP)
Judges: Rautenbach AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). altercation arising when police removed cow to return to owner. all plaintiffs ultimately arrested and plaintiffs 1 to 3 shot and injured. reasonable grounds for arrest. attack on police exaggerated and firing of live ammunition unwarranted. arrest accordingly lawful. assaults on first to third plaintiffs unlawful, minister liable.

Judges: TJ Kruger AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. no reasonable grounds for suspicion to arrest. failure by police officer to make simple enquiry to clear up incorrect suppositions. first defendant liable for wrongful and unlawful arrest.

Judges: LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). cannot be said arresting officer acted unreasonably based on information, coupled with statements made and medical examinations, in forming reasonable suspicion plaintiff had committed offence of rape. plaintiff failed to produce evidence indicative of unreasonable actions on part of arresting officer. claim dismissed.

Defendant: Regional Magistrate Mr T P Mudau 2014 JDR 1670 (GP)
Judges: AJ Bam J and FG Preller J
Summary: criminal law. review. in what cases. applicant contended magistrate had legal duty to call witness. witness was wrong witness and applicant and counsel accepted on record. power to call witness discretionary. evidence of witness was not necessary to deliver judgment. application dismissed.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against withdrawal of. discretion to be exercised judiciously and not capriciously. no reasons provided by magistrate for withdrawal of bail. cancellation of bail reviewed and set aside. bail of r10 000 and original conditions reinstated.

Judges: Mogotsi AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). version of defendant more credible. plaintiff pointed out dagga to police and on that basis arrest was effected. suspicion police had regarding plaintiff was confirmed by pointing out. possibility of finding dagga on busy taxi rank and linking to plaintiff improbable. arrest lawful and reasonable in circumstances. action dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 1601 (GP)
Judges: C Pretorius J, PM Mabuse J and MJ Teffo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). employee and head of security arrested on charge of theft of chicken pieces \'97detained overnight and matter withdrawn next day. based on report by owner of store. no investigation of till slip produced as proof of payment. suspicion not reasonable in circumstances. arrested on duty and in full view of customers. damages of r80 000 awarded.

Judges: Strijdom AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. further detention of accused. defendant failed to show on balance of probabilities that arrest or detention of plaintiff lawful. damages awarded in amount of r120 000.

Judges: Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(q). due to plaintiff threatening wife that would kill her, verbally and via sms. justified to arrest without warrant due to severity of threat. lawfully arrested on provisions of s 40(1)(q) ,as suspected plaintiff of having committed act of domestic violence in terms of s 1 of domestic violence act 116 of 1998. action dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs 2015 JDR 2598 (GP)
Judges: Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. environmental offences. rhino horn. moratorium on domestic trade in rhino horn. substantial non.compliance with consultative and participatory process by public as contemplated by ss 99 and 100 of act. reviewed and set aside. national environmental management biodiversity act 10 of 2004, ss 57(2), 99 and 100 and regs thereto.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 0518 (GP)
Judges: Ranchod J, Prinsloo J and Fabricius J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest on a warrant. contending not shown warrant despite requesting such. relied upon different cause of action in particulars (ie arrested without a warrant). claim as pleaded therefore not proven. dismissal of claim by court a quo confirmed on appeal.

Judges: DS Molefe J and TS Kekana AJ
Summary: criminal law. domestic violence. breach of order in terms of domestic violence act 116 of 1998. arrested without warrant for contempt of order allegedly in terms of s 3 of the act. relying on emotional abuse and not physical violence as required by provision. arrest and detention accordingly not lawful and appeal upheld. appellant arrested in front of children and detained for 17 hours. awarded r40 000 in damages.

Defendant: Minister of Correctional Services RSA 2016 JDR 0081 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 452 (GP)
Judges: TJ Raulinga J
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. conditions of incarceration of. application for order affecting conditions and that confiscated items be sealed and no one, including police, have access to such items. items in question having been confiscated after applicant's cell searched and firearm and items that could be used in an escape found. applicant not having exhausted internal remedies. property subject of police investigation and could not be returned without jeopardising progress therein. public policy considerations emphasised. correctional services act 111 of 199, s 21.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 2091 (GP)
Judges: MW Msimeki J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). not necessary a crime be committed or arrestee later charged or convicted for police to rely on s 40(1)(a) of act. evidence support arrest was lawful, and plaintiff never assaulted as alleged. claim dismissed.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). legality. rape charge. claiming that pointed out by 13.year.old complainant's father in absence of complainant and not informed of rights. version rejected. arrest justifiable. claim dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 1057 (GP)
Judges: AJ Bam J, EM Kubushi J, LM Molopa-Sethosa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). requiring arresting peace officer to have reasonable suspicion that suspect having committed offence. arrest lawful.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security NO. 2016 JDR 1224 (GP)
Judges: Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. seizure without search warrant in terms of s 22 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. police could have applied for warrant without defeating purpose of search (illegal gambling and dealing in drugs). search and seizure invalid and items to be returned.

Judges: Van Niekerk J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). public prosecutor giving instruction for arrest on charge of fraud. no reasonable basis therefor. clearly assisting complainant by using state mechanism to achieve nothing more than debt collection. arrest and detention accordingly unlawful and plaintiff entitled to damages from minister. institution of prosecution malicious and entitled to claim damages in this regard from minister and ndpp.

Judges: N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. education. access to personal laptop computers for study purposes. policy allowing said devices not applied consistently. security considerations can be alleviated by having laptops searched on regular basis, no modem access. no case made for prohibition. application granted.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 2630 (GP)
Judges: D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. liability for shooting. no corroboratory evidence for claim that plaintiff shot. failed also to lead evidence on quantum. absolution granted.

Judges: AML Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). suspicion to be based on reasonable grounds and not only on admissible evidence \'96 may be formed on hearsay evidence, character of suspected person. factual background must be reasonable to form suspicion. unable to find reasonableness in arrest. incarcerated for 23 days till released. loss of income. award of r657 510,76 including general damages.

Defendant: City of Tshwane Metropolitan Municipality 2018 JDR 0336 (GP)
Judges: MM Munzhelele AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. unlawful detention in police holding cells overnight. general damages issue. plaintiffs artisans working for tshwane metro and incarcerated with violent criminals. psychological trauma. awarded general damages of r30 000 and r10 000 for future medical expenses as agreed.

Applicant: General Council of the Bar of South Africa
Defendant: Jiba 2016 JDR 1698 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 47 (GP); 2017 (2) SA 122 (GP)
Judges: Legodi J
Summary: criminal law. legal practitioners. advocate. removal from roll. on ground that advocate not fit and proper person to remain on roll of advocates\'97advocates in national prosecuting authority. when fit and proper person for legal profession. test. difference between removal or suspension of such officers under s 12 of national prosecuting authority act 32 of 1998 and removal from roll of advocates under s 7 of admission of advocates act 74 of 1964. court finding that advocates in question not fit and proper persons to remain on roll of advocates. ordered that their names be struck off roll of advocates. admission of advocates act 74 of 1964, s 7(1)(d).

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2018 JDR 0149 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 436 (GP)
Judges: Wright J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. national director of public prosecutions. conduct of. inquiry into and suspension of acting ndpp and special director of public prosecutions. adverse comments by courts having led to their being struck from roll of advocates. essential for state president to act swiftly and decisively in terms of s 12(6)(a) of the national prosecuting act 32 of 1998 to hold inquiry and suspend officials.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2017 JDR 2078 (GP)
Judges: Tlhapi J, Mothle J and Wright J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. national director of public prosecutions. conduct of. inquiry into and suspension of acting ndpp and special director of public prosecutions. adverse comments by courts having led to their being struck from roll of advocates. essential for state president to act swiftly and decisively in terms of s 12(6)(a) of the national prosecuting act 32 of 1998 to hold inquiry and suspend officials.

Defendant: Sherman Amos (Deputy Registrar: Road Traffic Infringement Agency) 2017 JDR 0491 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 35 (GP)
Judges: Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. traffic offences. adjudication of road traffic offences act 46 of 1998. adjudication of offences under act. provisions of act regarding sending of courtesy letters and infringement notices peremptory. failure by road traffic infringement agency to follow precepts leading to notices and penalties being set aside.

Judges: DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). reasonable suspicion. police officers used their discretion reasonably in exercising arrest and subsequent detention was lawful. action dismissed with costs.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2016 JDR 0709 (GP)
Judges: AJ Louw AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. legality. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). ethiopian refugee and asylum seeker arrested and detained for 6 days for not being in possession of valid asylum.seekers' permit although renewal at home. arrest not per se unlawful, however, continued detention unlawful after production of valid permit. plaintiff awarded r150 000. refugees act 130 of 1998, s 37(b).

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2015 JDR 0507 (GP)
Judges: NM Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. accommodation. urgent application by first applicant that findings and sanctions against him arising out of disciplinary proceedings be reviewed and set aside, as well as consequent decision to transfer him from 1 correctional centre to another. failure to exhaust internal remedies available to him. applicant, as sentenced inmate, does not have right to demand where must be held. facility from which applicant removed has no capacity to deal with high risk inmates; facility to which has been moved, does; as such, version of respondents to prevail. application dismissed.

Judges: SC Mia AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. duties of. national instruction 7 of 2017 giving directives on how to deal with trespasser. saps may react per instruction and pursue matters in terms of trespass act, not required that court order be issued compelling police to do what was required. nothing preventing applicants from taking reasonable steps to safeguard property. application for order inter alia compelling response from public order police to land invasion dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Police 2016 JDR 2104 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 441 (GP)
Judges: WRC Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. prosecutor. conduct of. plaintiff stabbed 22 times, raped and robbed in own home. perpetrator on bail at time despite several previous convictions for rape. r6 830 377 (in total) awarded against police and prosecuting authority.

Judges: AC Basson J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). mistaken identity. duplicate id document issued to another with same name. plaintiff arrested for fraud on complaint by game stores. policeman handed copies of 2 ids with differing photos, assuming plaintiff fraudster despite being shown original id document \'97 could easily have verified matter with home affairs. suspicion accordingly not reasonable \'97 second defendant not liable as arrest not sufficiently connected to issuing of 2 ids. first defendant liable, plaintiff awarded r300 000 for unlawful arrest and detention.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2014 JDR 1920 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 478 (GP)
Judges: Mavundla J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. release on parole. prisoner applying for review of parole board decision. parole be revoked for reasons of subsequently discovered transgression committed whilst still in prison prior to release on parole. video made on cellphone of a drinking party, leaked to media. transgression constitute breach of parole conditions. commissioner has wide discretion to grant or cancel parole. conduct of applicant was serious and undermined general authority of correctional services. applicant dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Justice & Correctional Services 2014 JDR 1597 (GP)
Judges: Bertelsmann J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. release on parole. prisoner applying for review of parole board decision. applicant appeared before board composed of 5 members. postponed to deliberate during which time composition of board changed. replacement by member who had not been part of board during hearing. new board revoked parole. breach of right to fair hearing before properly constituted board. manner in which decision made offended rights to fair administrative proceedings and just administrative action. reviewed and set aside, referred back to second respondent.

Judges: NP Mngqibisa-Thusi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. detention of accused by police. detention following lawful arrest on rape charge. only released following day despite being granted bail. continued detention not justified. managing director of own company with health problems. awarded r350 00 damages and legal costs to secure his release.

Applicant: Director of Public Prosecutions: Gauteng, Pretoria
Defendant: Mtshali 2016 JDR 1281 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 463 (GP)
Judges: De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. condonation. requirements for. appeal by dpp against lenient sentence imposed for rape. fact of lenient sentence imposed not brought to attention of prosecutor's superiors despite general instructions to do so. public interest required that condonation be granted where non.custodial sentence imposed for violent rape.

Judges: SAM Baqwa J and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. sexual offences. pornography. child pornography. possession of in contravention of s 27(1)(a) of the films and publications act 65 of 1996. sentence. accused convicted of 481 counts of possession of child pornography and sentenced to 2 concurrent terms of 5 years' imprisonment. pictures depicting absolute depravity. sentence disturbingly inappropriate and increased to 1 of 10 years' imprisonment.

Applicant: Director of Public Prosecutions North Gauteng, Pretoria
Judges: NV Khumalo J and TV Ratshibvumo AJ
Summary: criminal law. trial. postponement of. refusal of. section 342a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. rights of child complainant at stake. failed to hold enquiry. should have established if any prejudice would have been suffered by any of the parties and if interests of justice would have been served by granting or refusing postponement. only regard given to speedy trial rights of accused. no justifiable reason for refusing postponement, respondent on bail. gross irregularity. appeal upheld, decision set aside and remitted back for trial to start de novo.

Defendant: Minister van Veiligheid en Sekuriteit 2014 JDR 1663 (GP)
Judges: Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. unlawful arrest and detention. suffering from post.traumatic stress disorder as result of previous trauma suffered exacerbated by arrest and detention. plaintiff has duty to mitigate damages due to failure over years to manage long.term post.traumatic stress disorder. total award of r266 000 for unlawful arrest, detention, malicious prosecution and legal costs.

Defendant: Minister of Justice and Correctional Services 2015 JDR 1119 (GP)
Judges: SAM Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. release on. medical grounds. recommended by medical parole advisory board. minister refusing release. minister taking into consideration representations from other respondents without disclosing to applicant. also taking into consideration factor at variance with evidence before him. decision set aside on review and court ordering release subject to parole board determining conditions.

Judges: JJC Swanepoel AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). bag containing prohibited substances at feet of plaintiffs. not reasonable to conclude in possession thereof and that offence committed in presence. arrest and detention unlawful.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security NO 2016 JDR 1178 (GP)
Judges: C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. police. vicarious liability of employer for delictual acts of employee. tenants removing attached goods from flat accompanied by 2 policeman. plaintiff spat at, humiliated and threatened with arrest. police witnesses dishonest. defendants liable. plaintiff suffering from ptsd and depression. awarded r60 000 in general damages and r40 000 for future medical costs.

Defendant: Minister Van Veiligheid en Sekuriteit 2016 JDR 0014 (GP)
Judges: WF Pienaar AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without a warrant. legality. on charges of inter alia treason, assault gbh and malicious damage to property. arising out of incident in which police station was shot at with paintball. plaintiffs, of which the second was only 17 years old, alleging that assaulted and denied access medical attention and legal representation. court finding reason for arrest punishment and therefore competely unfounded. defendants acting in fraudem legis and in violation of constitutional obligations. award of r 170 000 to first plaintiff and r80 000 to the second.

Judges: BR Tokota AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(a). employer laid charge of assault against employer (plaintiff) \'97 arrested on basis of statement and medical report. detained in custody by court and no bail application brought. released after 8 days on withdrawal of charge. police acted reasonably and in good faith. claim dismissed with costs.

Judges: JJ Strijdom AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. wrongful arrest. damages. arrested for assault with intent to cause grievous bodily harm. pushed worker off premises because worker smelled of alcohol. plaintiff missing meeting with customer because detained. causing him to lose being awarded job. whether he could recover this from minister.

Judges: WRC Prinsloo J and TA Maumela J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). arresting officer had reasonable suspicion of theft. lawfulness of arrest proven. jurisdictional facts present. appeal dismissed.

Judges: W R C Prinsloo J
Summary: criminal law. damages. for assault. awarded against police. assaulted during police raid looking for drugs. police were acting within course and scope of employment. claims upheld, r90 000 awarded to plaintiffs 1.3 and r92 000 to plaintiff 4, costs to follow.

Defendant: The President of the Republic of South Africa 2017 JDR 1994 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 317 (GP)
Judges: D Mlambo J, N Ranchod J and WHG Van der Linde J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. national director of public prosecutions. appointment and removal from office of. request by ndpp to vacate office. what constitutes such request. required to emanate from ndpp and not from persuasion by payment of a greater sum of money than permitted by law.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 1050 (GP)
Judges: PA Van Niekerk AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. not persuaded that another court would come to a different conclusion. applicant's evidence was vague and riddled with contradictions. appeal refused with costs.

Defendant: Media 24 Limited 2017 JDR 1137 (GP) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 416 (GP)
Judges: W Hughes J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witness. children. identification of. prohibition of identification of child witness and victim. prohibition extending to victim under age of 18 years. prohibition not extending into child's majority. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 154(3).

Defendant: The Regional Magistrate, Springs Mrs B Oswell 2017 JDR 0592 (GP)
Judges: Ranchod J and Makhoba AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. before conclusion of trial. of ruling, after trial.within.a.trial, on admissibility of evidence obtained and admissions made during search and seizure. premature to exercise power of review as trial incomplete and court may yet overrule earlier decision.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2018 JDR 0319 (GP)
Judges: SS Mphahlele J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. malicious prosecution. liability. defendant malicious in persisting with numerous futile postponements whilst aware that witnesses (to housebreaking and rape charges) could not identify suspects and dna evidence failing to link the plaintiffs to crimes. defendant 100 % liable for proven damages.

Defendant: National Director of Public Prosecutions 2017 JDR 0344 (GP)
Judges: Strydom AJ and Moshidi J and Meyer J
Summary: criminal law. murder. conspiracy to commit. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. incorrect reliance on inadmissible extra.curial statement of 1 accused against co.accused. single witness eye witness unsatisfactory. state case falling short of proof beyond reasonable doubt. appeal upheld and convictions and sentences of all 4 appellants set aside.

Judges: JR Murphy J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. without a warrant. arrested for possession of firearms without a license and detained overnight, matter. plaintiff, an ex.policeman, contending that maliciously arrested and prosecution due to assistance rendered to 2 associates in bail application following arrest on fraud charges. probabilities favouring defendants \'97 first defendant succeeding in discharging onus of proving arrest lawful. also no basis for holding prosecution instigated with malice by defendants 2 and 3. action dismissed with costs.

Judges: Mali AJ
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. section 22(a) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. armed police forcing entry into wrong house and traumatising family. 4 family members each awarded r25 000.

Judges: SS Mphahlele J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). arrested on fraud charge regarding alleged wrongful subletting of premises. evidence provided of sufficient weight to induce reasonable police officer to form opinion that plaintiff had committed offence justifying arrest without warrant. claim dismissed.

Judges: Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. defences. private defence. what constitutes. second defendant acted lawfully in the circumstances. second defendant was stabbed and seriously injured. despite shots fired by himself he was approached again with sharp object in hand. second defendant shot into soil in assailants direction to avoid another attack. he had reasonable grounds to believe he was in danger. did not exceed limits of self.defence. use of force was reasonable in circumstances. arrest not unlawful. claim dismissed.

Applicant: Acting National Director of Public Prosecution
Defendant: Democratic Alliance (Society for the Protection of Our Constitution Amicus Curiae) 2016 JDR 1211 (GP)
Judges: AP Ledwaba DJP and C Pretorius J and SP Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. decision by acting national director of public prosecution to discontinue prosecution against president zuma irrational and reviewed and set aside. applicants extracted and misinterpreted aspects of main judgment. no merits in arguments and no reasonable prospects of successful appeal. application dismissed.

Defendant: NATIONAL DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC PROSECUTIONS 2015 (3) SA 122 (GP)
Judges: Prinsloo J and Moseamo AJ
Summary: criminal law. statutory offences. prevention of organised crime. confiscation order. benefits of crime. sawmill company convicted of grading road on own property before obtaining environmental authorisation  c. company's motives altruistic and intended to reduce environmental impact. no benefit to company proven as intended by poca. order set aside. prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998, s 18.york timbers (pty) ltd, which owned and operated a sawmill plant, was convicted in a regional magistrates' court for grading a road on its property  d before obtaining environmental authorisation in terms of s 24 of nema *it had been accepted as part of its guilty plea statement in terms of s 112(2) of the cpa\'86 that the grading had been undertaken by an overzealous forester who had been requested only to survey and mark out a proposed new ramp road. the new road had been planned specifically to avoid environmental harm to the residents of the neighbouring town and had taken place after  e the engagement of the services of an environmental affairs practitioner and an environmental impact assessment had been lodged with the authorities. after conviction the court ordered that a confiscation enquiry be held in terms of s 18 of poca \'87 into any benefit that the appellant may have derived out of its criminal activity. the appellant was subsequently sentenced to a fine of r180 000 and a confiscation order granted in the amount of  f r450 000 for expenses ostensibly saved. the present matter concerns an appeal lodged against this order. a further appeal against the sentence was still pending at the time of the hearing of the present appeal.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 1701 (GJ)
Judges: Vally J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. versions of plaintiff and appellant, diametrically opposite. plaintiff's version more probable. plaintiff proven unlawful arrest, assault and detention by police. damages to be determined at later hearing.

Defendant: Minister of Correctional Services 2014 JDR 2174 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 99 (GJ)
Judges: Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. transfer of. transfer of prisoner in terms of s 43 of the correctional services act 111 of 1998. rights of sentenced prisoners as entrenched in the constitution of republic of south africa act 108 of 1996, in particular s 35(2)(e). rule of law and residuum principle. respondents transferring applicant without consultation or affording him opportunity to make representations. conduct of respondents violating principle of audi alteram partem and natural justice. decision to transfer applicant accordingly reviewed and set aside.

Judges: Hertenberger AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. liability of minister for delictual acts of police officer. plaintiff shot by second defendant in thigh during altercation. he had previously been arrested by second defendant for robbery but was acquitted. defendant claiming under threat by plaintiff who was about to receive a firearm. court finding shooting not justifiable. awarded plaintiff r150 000 general damages.

Defendant: Director of Public Prosecutions, Gauteng Local Division, Johannesburg 2017 JDR 1073 (GJ)
Judges: ML Twala J and CI Moosa AJ
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. national director of public prosecutions. decision by senior public prosecutor to refuse representations for withdrawal of charge. application for review of. internal remedies not exhausted. application ill.conceived and bad in law. dismissed with costs on attorney and client scale.

Applicant: The Director of Public Prosecutions Gauteng Local Division, Johannesburg
Defendant: The Regional Magistrate, Krugersdorp 2017 JDR 1113 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 93 (GJ)
Judges: M Makume J and WL Wepener J
Summary: criminal law. review. of discharge of accused at end of prosecution's case. evidence revealing sufficient evidence against accused for him to be put on his defence. discharge constituting gross irregularity and set aside.

Judges: NE Ramapuputla AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without warrant. act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). lawfulness. arrested outside home, allegedly for being drunk. released at court after 4 days in police cells. defendant producing no relevant evidence thus failing to discharge onus of proof. conditions in cell awful, separated from baby and deprived of liberty when driven around for hour before put in cells. awarded r200 000 in damages.

Judges: Weiner J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without a warrant. legality of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 s 40(1)(b). crime in a foreign country. no investigations made by defendant that crime was an offence in portugal, nor that same was offence in rsa. suspicion not reasonable. damages awarded to plaintiff.

Judges: Van Der Westhuizen, A J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(h). received information that using smoking dagga at address. no drugs found. could not be said that arresting officer formed independent suspicion re commission of offence. arrest unlawful. fifty.one year old, detained 5 days and lost employment. awarded r100 000.

Judges: NF Kgomo J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). whether suspicion acting upon was on reasonable grounds. arresting officer acted unreasonably in that eyewitness to robbery told him that plaintiff not was involved in armed robbery. despite this still arrested plaintiff and detained him for 66 hours in appalling conditions. appellant still carries stigma of being arrested in front of neighbours and family. damages in amount of r140 000 awarded.

Defendant: The Minister of Higher Education 2018 JDR 0017 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 485 (GJ)
Judges: RS Willis AJ
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. rights of. right to education. unlawful interference with amounting to constitutionally invalid act. failure of prison authorities to forward examination entry form to educational authorities.

Judges: E Swartz AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. magistrate correct in sentence of direct imprisonment. length however harsh under circumstances of present case. shorter sentence will possibly have same desired effect, realising blameworthiness and opportunity to rehabilitate. appeal upheld.

Judges: HW Sibuyi AJ and WHG Van Der Linde J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. girl age 9 kidnapped and kept naked and unfed for 2 days. raped twice resulting in vaginal injuries that required surgery. 2 life sentences and 5 years for kidnapping.

Defendant: Zumani 2014 JDR 1232 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 84 (GJ)
Judges: Van Oosten J and Z Buthelezi AJ
Summary: criminal law. firearms and ammunition \'96 unlawful possession of firearm in contravention of s 3 of firearms control act 60 of 2000. joint possession of firearms by 4 occupants of motor vehicle. 2 firearms thrown out of vehicle while being chased by police. no evidence as to who had done so. principles of joint ownership restated. presumption in s 117(2) of act that state has to show despite taking of reasonable steps it was not able with reasonable certainty to link possession of firearm or ammunition to any other person. 'reasonable steps' for presumption to become operative. condition not fulfilled and presumption not operative. remainder of evidence insufficient to prove joint ownership. convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J, ML Mailula J and Z Carelse J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against sentence. power of court on appeal to interfere with sentence. appeal to full bench. appellants convicted on 5 counts consisting of murder, robbery with aggravating circumstances and unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition. life imprisonment on murder charge and effective 18 years' imprisonment on remaining charges imposed. evidence led at trial in court a quo analysed and considered. appellants' version rightly rejected as false by trial court. conviction unassailable.

Defendant: YG (The Children's Institute, The Quaker Peace Centre, Sonke Gender Justice and Freedom of Religion South Africa Amicus Curiae) 2017 JDR 1805 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 64 (GJ)
Judges: RM Keightley, J and E Francis J
Summary: criminal law. assault. common assault. defences. parent's right of moderate chastisement of child. constitutionality of. defence infringing ss 9, 10 and 12 of constitution.

Judges: Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape evidence to sustain charges. sixteen counts of rape, 2 of compelled rape and 11 of aggravated robbery. liked through dna to 9 rape complainants. circumstantial evidence overwhelming. guilty on all but on all but 2 rape counts.

Judges: T Ncongwane AJ and I Opperman J
Summary: criminal law. fraud. sentence. mother of 3 pleading guilty to 1 count of fraud amounting to r656 099 and sentenced to 7 years' imprisonment. trial court omitting to weigh all relevant issues pertaining to best interests of minor child and therefore not in position to consider whether imprisonment appropriate. remitted to magistrate for re.sentencing.

Judges: B Mashile J and R Keightley AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. minimum sentence legislation not to be departed from lightly or for flimsy reasons. aggravating circumstances far outweigh personal circumstances. appeal against sentence dismissed.

Judges: Wright J
Summary: criminal law. extradition. application for. requirements under extradition act 67 of 1962. compliance with s 9(3)(a)(i) not compulsory. sufficient to comply with (i), (ii) or (iii). word 'or' appears after (ii) indicating an alternative. legislature did not intend more than 1 authentication of same document. instead 3 alternative ways to authenticate. appeal dismissed, bail extended.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and L Windell J
Summary: criminal law. review. criminal proceedings not finalised. accused represented by attorney. during course of trial presiding officer informed that attorney had been suspended from practice prior to commencement of trial. attorney's lack of right of appearance constituting irregularity and failure of justice per se. part.heard proceedings set aside and de novo trial ordered.

Defendant: Van Der Linde 2016 JDR 1318 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 377 (GJ)
Judges: CH Nicholls J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. offences. money.laundering. what constitutes. fraudulent vat refunds deposited into business accounts and then immediately withdrawn by means of cash cheques or deposited into another business account. where no attempt at concealment, money.laundering not proven.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and K Satchwell J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. sentence. robbery with aggravating circumstances. minimum sentence in terms of s 51 of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. robbery involving hi.jacking of vehicle and personal items of complainant. serious injuries sustained by 66.year.old complainant. imposed 15 years as appellant was 62 years of age, no previous convictions and had spent 14 months in custody awaiting trial. no misdirection shown. seriousness of hi jacking outweighing mitigating factors. appeal dismissed.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal. onus on bail applicant. exceptional circumstances exist which in interests of justice do not require his detention. sworn affidavits tendered. disclosed hiv status. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Avvakoumides AJ and Hundermark AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. cumulative sentence. 2 counts of possession of suspected stolen property. bakkie and minibus. 2 counts of fraud regarding identity document and death certificate. effective sentence of 23 years replaced on appeal with 1 of 13 years.

Defendant: Taunyane 2016 JDR 2199 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 163 (GJ)
Judges: Satchwell J, Van Oosten J and Masipa J
Summary: criminal law. murder. premeditated or planned murder. misdirection in making finding at sentence that murder premeditated when should have been done before conviction. substituted by conviction of murder with dolus directus. no compelling and substantial circumstances justifying deviation from the minimum sentence of 15 years' imprisonment. court making allowance, however, for the 2 years spent in prison awaiting trial and 18 years' imprisonment imposed.

Judges: R Keightley AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. all offences were committed with common intent. all 3 offences inherently linked with common intent. magistrate misdirected by separating count 3 from other charges. order amended to reflect all offences to run concurrently.

Judges: D Fisher J and D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. sufficiency of. single witness in rape complaint. misdirection by court a quo in failing to take into account absence of evidence of doctor and witness regarding force and coercion used, such being essential point of departure in versions of complainant and appellant. state failing to show version of appellant not reasonably possibly true. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: DSS Moshidi J and Sutherland J
Summary: criminal law. corruption. public officer. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. police officials allegedly demanding to avert arrest and detention of complainant. evidence of single witness not satisfactory and insufficient to secure conviction. appeal succeeding and convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: CK Matshitse AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. multiple counts including murder, attempted murder and firearm offences, most of which took place at tavern. first offender, 22 years old and unemployed. youthfulness and prospects for rehabilitation amounting to substantial and compelling circumstances. effective sentence of 15 years imposed.

Judges: CK Matshitse AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. firearm robbed and later used in shootings in tavern. single witness, to shooting and removal of firearm from appellant in tavern, approached with necessary caution. correctly inferred that same person involved in robbery of firearm later involved in incident in tavern. sufficient to found convictions for aggravated robbery, murder, 2 counts of attempted murder and unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition.

Defendant: Skhosana 2016 JDR 1042 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 456 (GJ)
Judges: D Dosio AJ and SE Weiner J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. admissibility. photographs. appellant observed breaking into house on cctv. security officer taking cellphone photo of appellant after his arrest. provisions of s 37(1)(d) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, which permitted police officer to take photographic image of any arrested person, not unconstitutional. photograph admissible. sentenced to 8 years on charge of housebreaking with intent to steal and theft.

Defendant: Skhosana 2014 JDR 2046 (GJ) \'97 Now repoerted at 2015 (1) SACR 526 (GJ)
Judges: Victor J and Satchwell J
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. unavailability of to continue with trial. part.heard trial where evidence already adduced. magistrate in near fatal accident, leaving him unable to preside again. disability of magistrate renders earlier proceedings to nullity and to commence de novo. legislation silent on whether nullity to be declared by high court on pre.conviction matters. nullity principle ex lege sets trial aside.

Judges: Avvakoumides AJ and Hundermark AJ
Summary: criminal law. robbery aggravating. appeal against sentence. 18 year sentence being 3 more than prescribed minimum. trial court taking all relevant circumstances into account. appeal dismissed.

Judges: SC Mia AJ and D Mlambo JP
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. twenty.year.old complainant (and new employee) raped and kept hostage for 2 days by much older appellant (employer) on business trip. evidence of single witness correctly approached with necessary caution\'97 corroboration by medical evidence. appellant's version correctly rejected. convictions for kidnapping and rape (two counts) in order. minimum sentencing legislation not applicable at commission of offence and maximum jurisdiction of regional at time 10 years. fifteen years on each rape count replaced with 10 years, to run concurrently with 5 years on kidnapping count.

Judges: Satchwell J and Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. contempt of court. what constitutes. accused insisting on continuing case in absence of sick legal representative. refused to leave witness stand and called presiding officer a liar. reluctantly confirming conviction, court should have informed accused of charge and postponed matter to let him cool down. sentence of 4 months reduced to 10 days which had already been served.

Judges: Satchwell J; Mailula J and Boruchowitz J
Summary: criminal law. murder and robbery with aggravating circumstances. evidence required to sustain charges. young boy killed and robbed of cellphone. witness receiving cellphone from appellant as security for loan. corroborated in important respects despite being a single witness and possible suspect. pointing out of body by appellant to another witness. evidence, though circumstantial, sufficient to justify conviction. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MI Mangena AJ and I Opperman J
Summary: criminal law. murder. attempted murder. sentence. restraint order obtained compelling surrender of property against police officer. shot randomly at liquidators, sheriff and police officers when serving order at his home. fifty.seven years old and first offender. court a quo failed to indicate how interests of society could be served by effective jail term of 12 years. pre.sentence report categorising as candidate for correctional supervision. sentence set aside and replaced with correctional supervision.

Judges: EK Tsatsi AJ and BA Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. none found, as appellant raped 13.year.old complainant in presence of his sister and cousin. he also stole their money and cellphones. severe impact on complainant. no merit against appeal. sentence confirmed.

Judges: Shangisa AJ and Sutherland J
Summary: criminal law. housebreaking with intent to rob and robbery. sentence. 1 count of assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. broke into shack, beat complainants with sticks and bricks and stole belongings. sixteen years' imprisonment imposed in respect of housebreaking and robbery and 10 years' imprisonment on assault charge. magistrate not providing justification for imposing sentence exceeding prescribed minimum of 15 years. prevalence of offence overemphasised and failed to consider other relevant factors. sentences set aside and replaced with a sentence of 10 years' 5 years' imprisonment respectively.

Defendant: Sebofi 2014 JDR 2263 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 179 (GJ)
Judges: Roland Sutherland J and Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. trial. right to a fair trial. rape conviction and life sentence set aside on appeal. in interests of justice, appeal court mero motu remitting case to trial magistrate to require further evidence to be admitted. application of ss 304(2)(c)(v), 167 and 186 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Judges: Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. criminal procedure. fundamental rights. right to fair trial. magistrate committing irregularities in respect of application of provisions of s 112 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 during course of trial. infringing appellant's right to fair trial guaranteed in s 35(3) of constitution. vitiating entire proceedings. conviction and sentence set aside on appeal.

Judges: Sutherland J and Francis J
Summary: criminal law. extradition. warrant of arrest in terms of s 5(1) of extradition act 67 of 1962. validity of. fact of previous unsuccessful attempt to have applicant extradited not disclosed to magistrate issuing warrant. whether non.disclosure rendered warrant invalid. even if facts surrounding previous warrants had been disclosed this would not have affected magistrate's decision to issue warrant. arrest and detention lawful.

Judges: Ingrid Opperman J and MB Mahalelo J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. owner of tuck shop robbed by group \'97threatened with firearm and knife and inter alia cash, cigarettes and airtime vouchers taken. complainant in count 2 robbed of golf used as getaway vehicle. reliability of identification strengthened by appellant 2 having been seen by witnesses selling ice cream shortly before incident and appellant's 1 and 3 known by sight from sport matches. no misdirection in conviction of all on 2 counts of aggravated robbery. sentences of 10 years on each count, taken together for sentencing purposes, too lenient, but interference not warranted.

Judges: Mudau AJ and Makume J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. appeal against conviction. identity of accused established by complainant and witnesses. accused fought with driver for her handbag and was then chased and apprehended by 2 witnesses. appeal against conviction and sentence of 6 years dismissed.

Judges: Mudau J and Swartz AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. rape of a 13.year.old girl by relative. prescribed minimum sentence imposed by regional court. seriousness of crime emphasised. no substantial and compelling circumstances. appeal against sentence dismissed.

Judges: RE Monama J and TL Mosikatsana AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. fifteen years' imprisonment minimum sentence prescribed for robbery aggravating. trial court imposed 18 years yet did not articulate considerations which justified sentence in excess of minimum. discretion not exercised judiciously. shockingly inappropriate. sentence set aside and minimum imposed.

Judges: MM Mabesele J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. life imprisonment. when to be imposed. gang leader stabbing rival gang member several times with okapi knife. previous convictions, 21.years.old and still at school. gangs consisting of pupils feared by community and parents. needing sentence with strong deterrent effect. youthfulness not constituting substantial and compelling circumstance. life imprisonment imposed.

Judges: Spilg J
Summary: criminal law. trial. postponement of. application on behalf of accused 2 (in abstentia) on grounds of ill health. pleaded to charges and evidence heard in part. court required sufficient evidence to determine whether indisposition temporary or indefinite. conflict between medical experts\'97 execution of warrant for arrest of accused 2 suspended and cautioned to appear on next court date pending examination by certain named medical practitioners.

Defendant: Porritt 2016 JDR 1441 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 700 (GJ)
Judges: Spilg J
Summary: criminal law. trial. centralisation of. application for. on grounds that because of discomfort and expenditure of lengthy trial at a centre far from accused's home, fair trial rights would be infringed. accused not satisfying court that their inability to prepare properly for trial would amount to infringement of their rights. application dismissed.

Judges: Wepener J
Summary: criminal law. bail. cancellation of. appeal against. leave to appeal having been granted by supreme court of appeal. accused seeking by way of application, declaratory order that cancellation suspended pending hearing of appeal. accused required to proceed in terms of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. application proceedings not competent.

Judges: Sutherland J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. leave to appeal on conviction refused. argument advanced that court should exercise its inherent jurisdiction to correct unsafe conviction. no such inherent jurisdiction and law restated. finding of premeditation an exaggeration in totality of circumstances \'97 despite being 20 at time of offence and no longer a youth, immaturity not to be ignored. sentence of 19 years reduced to 10 years.

Defendant: Phika 2017 JDR 1999 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 392 (GJ)
Judges: M Victor J and L Adams AJ
Summary: criminal law. plea. guilty. informal plea bargain between state and accused. magistrate not accepting plea of guilty to offence of culpable homicide and insisting that prosecutor change charge to 1 of murder. matter then proceeding before same presiding officer. proceedings improper but not set aside in circumstances where further delay prejudicial to accused.

Defendant: Patel 2015 JDR 1852 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (2) SACR 141 (GJ)
Judges: P Coppin J and TD Vilakazi AJ
Summary: criminal law. extradition. double criminality rule. whether been satisfied. extraditable offence. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Pataka 2018 JDR 0613 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 135 (GJ)
Judges: D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. pending appeal. when to be granted. prospects of success on appeal. mere fact that court considers that appellant has reasonable prospects on appeal did not per se mean that interests of justice dictate release on bail.

Judges: GB Rome AJ and S Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. rape. defences. consent. version of sexual history between parties undermined by medical evidence. no reason to reject assessment of evidence by court a quo. convictions for rape and assault of 15.year.old girl confirmed. violence used during and after rape. no remorse. life term imposed appropriate.

Judges: ML Mailula J and IS Mlaba AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. identification. assessment. broke into shop through roof and stole cash and clothing. chased and arrested by security guard who never lost sight of them. no room for mistaken identity. convictions confirmed.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and TV Ratshibvumo AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. admissibility. statement made to police by suspect prior to being apprised of right to remain silent . suspect, at time of questioning, neither arrested or accused person. failed to warn or caution before enquiring as to what had transpired. report therefore elicited should have been excluded from evidence. once inadmissible evidence excluded, remaining evidence insufficient to constitute proof of guilt beyond reasonable doubt. conviction cannot stand. appeal upheld.

Judges: N Ranchod J and NA Engelbrecht AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. presumptions. doctrine of recent possession. theft took place in relatively small town, easily accepted not much time lapsed since breaking in and time of arrest. nature of goods, time lapse since complainant left home and time of arrest good in all probability still in hands of persons who dispossessed. appeals dismissed.

Judges: D Dosio AJ and J Teffo J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. adequacy of proof. rape of 12.year.old girl. single witness and child witness. court alive to cautionary rule. complainant credible. appellant's version correctly rejected. conviction in order. first offender, aged 38 and married with 10 children. insufficient reasons to deviate from minimum sentence. life term confirmed.

Judges: WHG Van der Linde J and HW Sibuyi AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. unplanned murder by first offender. minimum sentence of 15 years appropriate. generic factors not amounting to substantial and compelling circumstances. stabbed partner when he found her at their home with another man.

Judges: Fisher J and Makume J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. rape of 10.year.old girl. complainant's version probably fabricated. enmity between appellant and mother of complainant. failure by trial to consider matter carefully and competently resulting in miscarriage of justice. appeal upheld. conviction and sentences to be set aside and appellant released immediately.

Judges: Francis J and Mokgoathleng J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. 2 complainants, 1 incident, second complaint stabbed whilst attempting to assist first. court misdirected by not taking into account cumulative effect of sentence. sentence ordered to run concurrently.

Judges: E Theron AJ and LR Adams J
Summary: criminal law. theft. proof of. conviction on contravention of s 37 of general law amendment act 62 of 1955 on original charge of robbery of motor vehicle. facts sufficient to found conviction for theft and finding altered accordingly. no misdirection in sentence of 4 years' imprisonment.

Judges: M Klein AJ
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. common purpose. clear from footage obtained. guilt established. found guilty of robbery with aggravating circumstances; murder; unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition.

Judges: Twala AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. conspiracy to commit murder of policeman. single witness. necessary cautioned applied. no prospect of other court coming to different conclusion. sentence of 17 years for such offence appropriate. application refused.

Judges: MM Mabesele J (R Mokgoathleng J and C Van Veenendaal AJ concurring)
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. criminal capacity. sane automatism. policeman shooting deceased as obeying instructions to exit vehicle. version that panicked and acted in state of automatism correctly rejected by court a quo. no premeditation and intent in form of dolus eventualis \'97 age 31, first offender and breadwinner. sentence increased from 12 (4 sp ) to 18 years.

Defendant: Nel 2017 JDR 2046 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 576 (GJ)
Judges: AH Petersen AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. application for. procedure. timeous ruling to be made on applicable schedule or section of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Judges: BA Mashile J and D Fisher J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. robbery with aggravating circumstances. complainant grabbed from behind around neck, pockets picked and cellphone stolen after struggle. sufficient light from cars and buildings to identify appellant and knew him from before. saw suspect 2 days later and called police. dock identification. appellant silent. sufficient evidence to convict appellant. appeal dismissed.

Judges: MB Mahalelo AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. fifteen years' imprisonment imposed for robbery with aggravating circumstances. complainant assaulted, threatened with firearm and items worth r145 000 taken. serving 15.year sentence for similar offence. whether sentences to run concurrently. cumulative effect considered. appeal upheld, ordered that 10 years of sentence run concurrently with sentence presently serving.

Judges: Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence to sustain charges. also aggravated robbery and unlawful possession of arms and ammunition. gang robbery of cash crusaders, cash and electronic goods stolen. multiple shots fired at policeman performing duties. both accused identified through cctv footage and making confessions. fingerprints of accused 1 found in vehicle used in robbery. dock identification of accused 2. evidence sufficient to prove guilt of accused on all charges.

Judges: Stegmann J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. multiple charges arising out of 6 incidents. identified and linked to counts 1\'963. stolen items recovered. appellant untruthful. insufficient evidence to link to remaining counts and set aside. convictions and sentences on counts 1\'963 confirmed.

Judges: Wepener J and Vuma AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. rape of 15.year.old girl \'97 test on appeal regarding interference with imposition of sentence by court below. no misdirection by regional magistrate in finding presence of substantial and compelling circumstances justifying lesser sentence than prescribed life term. sentence of 15 years confirmed.

Judges: Avvakoumides AJ
Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. robbery with aggravating circumstances. appellant charged with 18 others in apparent theft and robbery syndicate. state conceding case against him weak. court on appeal finding in circumstances that in interests of justice that be conditionally released on r1000 bail.

Judges: R Matthys AJ and M Victor J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. aggravating circumstances. sentence. armed robbery of bank. trial court not providing reasons for sentencing 2 appellants to terms in excess of prescribed minimum applicable, conclusion inescapable that sentencing decision arbitrary and discretion not exercised judicially. first appellant 33 years old with previous convictions, married with dependents and employed as street vendor. second appellant 31 years old, married with dependents and employed in butchery. no remorse. no substantial and compelling circumstances. sentences reduced from 25 to 20 years for first appellant and 25 years to 15 years for second appellant.

Defendant: Munyai 2017 JDR 0821 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 168 (GJ)
Judges: Sutherland J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. further evidence. application for. approach to. application woefully inadequate in that circumstances in which complainant recanted her incriminating evidence not explained, evidence on which conviction based nevertheless problematic. court providing directions for further conduct of case.

Judges: D Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. expert evidence. dna analysis. dna evidence linking accused to rapes, despite some of witnesses being unable to identify him. found guilty of 23 charges ndcomprising of rape, robbery aggravating and kidnapping.

Defendant: Mukuyu 2017 JDR 0701 (GJ) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 27 (GJ)
Judges: S Kuny AJ and B Mashile J
