Summary: criminal law. bail. appeal against refusal of. magistrate approached in balanced way and gave due weight to sentiments of community and strength of state's case. considered necessary grounds in terms of s 60 (4) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. court found reasonable probability that appellants would attempt to evade their trial than serving jail term and would interfere with 7.year.old son who will testify at trial. hearsay evidence admissible in bail proceedings. appeal dismissed.

Judges: NV Khumalo J and Webster J
Summary: criminal law. aggravated robbery. sentence. first offender, age 25 and poorly educated. all day crime spree with an unlicensed firearm involving 2 counts of housebreaking and aggravated robbery. no substantial and compelling circumstances. 20 year globular sentence confirmed on appeal.

Judges: Phatudi J
Summary: criminal law. stock theft. appellant's versions changing and contradictory. on totality of evidence, appellant properly convicted. 4 year sentence (two years suspended for 5 years). 7 goats stolen. appellant 52 years old, widow, first offender with 7 children. sentence replaced with 2 years, wholly suspended for 5 years.

Judges: TA Maumela J and Y Sidlova AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. theft. accused having long record of convictions for crimes of dishonesty. theft of motherboard. sentence of 15 years' imprisonment. sentence disproportionate to offence. previous convictions overemphasised. sentencing to be blended with mercy to give balanced approach. sentence does not fit crime and accused. sentence set aside and replaced with 7 years' imprisonment.

Judges: TA Maumela J and L Pillay AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. white.collar crime. falsified tax returns, 31 counts. sentence imposed harsh and excessive. sentence reduced to effective sentence of 8 years' imprisonment.

Judges: Makhoba AJ and Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. maintenance. failure to pay maintenance in contravention of s 31(1) of maintenance act 99 of 1998. court has discretion to convert trial into an enquiry in terms of s 41 of the act. was not necessary in this regard. all elements of offence proved beyond reasonable doubt. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Baloyi AJ and Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. robbery with aggravating circumstances. on appeal found that evidence supporting convictions where 2 men attacked and robbed at petrol station. common purpose. previous conviction of robbery more than 10 years old, and robbery, not aggravated robbery. 12 years imprisonment.

Judges: Mbongwe AJ and Prinsloo J concurring
Summary: criminal law. evidence. of identification. assessment of. theft of 3 television sets worth r9000. witness identifying person seen on cctc removing televisions sets as accused. court examined cctv and identity of person in question not clear due to poor quality of footage. possibility person not accused. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: MJ Teffo J and R Tolmay J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. cautionary rules. all evidence in entirety and complainant's conduct after incident cannot conclude clear and satisfactory in all material aspects. appellant's version of consensual sex is reasonable possibly true. appeal upheld, conviction and sentence set aside.

Defendant: Dlamini 2013 JDR 1824 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 530 (GP)
Judges: Lamprecht AJ, AML Phatudi J and A De Vries AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. period spent in prison awaiting trial. quantification of. all circumstances of individual accused to be assessed. such period not on its own 'substantial and compelling circumstance' for purposes of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. not substantial and compelling in this instance of murder and aggravated robbery. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Pretorius J, P Ebersohn AJ and N Sethusa AJ
Summary: criminal law. robbery with aggravating circumstances, murder and unlawful possession of firearm and ammunition. evidence to sustain charges of. appeal against conviction and sentence. deceased shot and motor vehicle, cellphone, firearm and sundry items taken. body dumped alongside of road. vehicle and firearm recovered. states' case based on common purpose, recent possession and circumstantial evidence. convictions confirmed. life imprisonment for murder excessive taking into account relative youth of appellants. sentences for all appellant reduced to effective 20 years' imprisonment.

Judges: VRSN Nkosi AJ and EM Kubushi J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. sentence. convicted of assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. burnt partner with boiling water and stabbed him during his sleep. sentence of 3 years' imprisonment shockingly inappropriate. sufficient mitigating factors warranting a suspended sentence. sentence set aside, 3 years imprisonment, half suspended.

Judges: Strijdom AJ and Dosio AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. 3 counts of housebreaking committed at separate businesses. 12 years' imprisonment. 30 year old father of 3 with a previous theft conviction. in cases of serious crime the personal circumstances of the offender, by themselves will necessarily recede into the background. appeal against sentence dismissed.

Judges: Kubushi J and Makgoba J
Summary: criminal law. child offender. age 15. drowning another child by pushing under the water 5 times. knowing that deceased could not swim well and making no effort to rescue when deceased stayed under water. dolus eventualis proved. sentenced to 5 years in youth care centre.

Defendant: Chokoe 2014 JDR 0739 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 612 (GP)
Judges: TJ Raulinga J and C Pretorius J
Summary: criminal law. review. trial. record. record lost, destroyed or incomplete. part.heard trial, record destroyed in fire at the magistrates' court. all attempts to be made to reconstruct. turn to secondary evidence. failure to obtain, all witnesses to be recalled to give evidence again \'97trial to continue in normal way.

Judges: Dosio AJ and Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. attempted murder. evidence to sustain charge of. arising out of argument over right of way of taxis. complainant stabbed repeatedly with knife in his abdomen and requiring hospitalisation. no misdirection in evaluation of evidence. conviction of first appellant on competent verdict of assault and second appellant guilty of attempted murder in order. no grounds warranting interference with sentence. 1 year imprisonment wholly suspended imposed for first appellant and 10 years for second appellant confirmed.

Judges: DM Thulare AJ and TJ Raulinga
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. personal circumstances not accorded appropriate consideration. troubled youth call for attention. to be subjected to programmes for correction. appeal upheld, sentence reduced to 20 years' imprisonment.

Defendant: Chabalala 2013 JDR 1972 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 458 (GP)
Judges: Ismail J and Jordaan J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304(4) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. sentence imposed inappropriate. magistrate erred in not invoking s 297(5) of the criminal procedure act, allowing fine to be paid over period of time. failure to invoke, impression imprisonment was intended. conditional sentence is appropriate taking into account personal circumstances of accused. sentence imposed set aside and replaced.

Judges: KE Matojane J and NS Masango AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against sentence. murder. twelve years' imprisonment imposed after stabbed deceased. court aware of seriousness of offence, found substantial and compelling circumstances to warrant lesser sentence. concluded mitigating factors outweighed aggravating. took into account personal circumstances. reasoning balanced and fair, no misdirection. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Makgoba J and SP Mothle J
Summary: criminal law. trial. cassettes recording such missing. trial magistrate relocated to australia. present magistrate thus unable to proceed with sentencing. previous proceedings set aside and to commence de novo before another magistrate, should state wish to proceed.

Judges: Prinsloo J and Kollapen AJ
Summary: criminal law. corruption. contravention of s 1(1)(b)(i) of the corruption act 94 of 1992. appeal against conviction. question was whether appellant, on his own version, realised that he was bribed. offence was committed by receiving money, knowing that it was meant to be bribe. even if receiver had no intention of assisting briber, he was still guilty. all requirements were proved. appeal dismissed.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and DS Fourie J
Summary: criminal law. admission of guilt fine. review of. charge formally withdrawn yet subsequent to withdrawal admission of guilt fine paid. fine to be repaid, conviction was not in accordance with justice. proceedings set aside and monies to be repaid.

Judges: Ratshibvumo AJ and Makgoka J
Summary: criminal law. rape. defences. consent. complainant left party extremely drunk and went to sleep in room. sister observed appellant having sexual intercourse with sleeping complainant. only woke up when police arrived. consent not sought by appellant. no misdirection by trial court. version of appellant correctly rejected. even if consent sought, vitiated by drunkenness. conviction confirmed. misdirection in application of s 51(1) rather than s 51(2) of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 1 count of rape only \'97minimum prescribed sentence 10 years' imprisonment not life. sentence set aside and replaced with 10 years' imprisonment.

Judges: Fabricius J and N Jansen Van Nieuwenhuizen AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. accused had paid admission of guilt fine in respect of charge. accepted by prosecutor. proceedings stopped by magistrate. proceedings set aside.

Judges: B Vally J and AP Ledwaba DJP
Summary: criminal law. review. whether appeal or review appropriate. allowed to interfere in exceptional circumstances, where interests of justice calls for intervention. magistrate recused herself due to allegations of bias towards accused. senior magistrate referred on review. proceedings in court a quo were not in accordance with justice justifying intervention. conviction set aside, matter remitted back to court.

Judges: Matojane J and Mngqibisa-Thusu J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. what constitutes. appellant convicted after pleading guilty to contravening s 1(1) of the criminal law amendment act 1 of 1988. appellant enquired at judgment stage what he allegedly stole. appellant had not been questioned in terms of s 112(1)(a) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. did not understand nature and consequences of guilty plea and rights were not explained to him. serious miscarriage of justice. conviction and sentence set aside, matter to start de novo.

Judges: D Makhoba AJ and N Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. accused having stolen items of insubstantial value. court failed to request pre.sentence report. appellant first offender and 6 years' imprisonment excessive. sentence imposed set aside, 18 months imprisonment suspended conditionally.

Judges: Legodi J; RG Tolmay; Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. assault. crimen injuria. inconsiderate driving. appeal against convictions. complainant taking photos of appellant after a driving and swearing incident. appellant attempting to take camera away and slapping complainant. 2 versions examined. character and demeanour of appellant and complainant described.

Judges: D Makhoba AJ and Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. arms and ammunition. declaration of unfitness to possess firearm in terms of s 103(1) of firearms control act 60 of 2000. legal representative did not properly address court and did not take full instructions. appellant requires licence to possess firearm in order to be employed as security guard. subsequently prejudiced when declared unfit. order of declaration of court a quo set aside.

Judges: MM Jansen AJ and PM Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. admission of guilt. setting aside of. admission of guilt fine paid on behalf of accused. no indication on record that summons served upon accused as required. issuing of summons and subsequent proceedings irregular. requirements of s 54 (3) not adhered to and proceedings in terms of s 57 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 irregular. conviction set aside.

Judges: Jordaan J and VV Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. accused plead guilty to possession of 4.9 grams of dagga. erroneously sentenced to 90 days imprisonment. plead guilty and terms of s 112(1) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1997 applied \'97sentence imposed thus not competent. sentence set aside immediately, accused cautioned and discharged.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 0040 (GNP)
Judges: RM Keightley AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. malicious prosecution. charges initiated to exact revenge against plaintiff for initiating complaints campaign against police officers and colleagues. significant contradictions in defence witnesses testimonies, rendered defendant's version implausible and improbable. statements made by second and fourth defendant were false, and made knowing it to be false. plaintiff's claim succeeds, amount of r179 884.80 awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Security And Security 2012 JDR 1284 (GNP)
Judges: Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. damages. arrest, detention and assault, involved torture. plaintiff accused of killing husband, arrested and driven to bush, assaulted and tortured during course of a day. photographic evidence led as to injuries sustained. state witness testimony vague in testimony in comparison to plaintiff and plaintiff's witnesses. duty on police to protect, failure entitles 1 to sue for damages. claim for general damages. award at discretion of court. deprived of liberty, humiliated, degraded, traumatic experience \'97judgment in favour of plaintiff, r220000 damages awarded.

Judges: De Vos J
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. forfeiture order in terms of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. preservation order followed by forfeiture application. on amount of us dollars and a motorcar. contravention of exchange control regulations. raised that mens rea lacking because money received from zimbabweans who trade in us dollars, for goods sold and delivered at shop. role of reserve bank. preservation order set aside.

Judges: Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. forfeiture order. application for in terms of s 50 of the prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. application for order of civil forfeiture. which property liable for forfeiture. meaning of 'instrumentality of an offence'. property must be shown to have been instrumental in, and not merely incidental to, commission of offence. this entailing factual inquiry. where property used for repeated offences over prolonged period of time. all property was linked in a reasonably direct manner to the commission of the crimes and equally was functional and played reasonably direct role in commission of the offence. forfeiture order granted against all property listed in draft order.

Defendant: National Prosecuting Authority 2014 JDR 0330 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 589 (GP)
Judges: Mlambo JP
Summary: criminal law. court. radio and television broadcast of judicial proceedings. application for broadcast permission of criminal trial. contestation of constitutional rights of freedom of expression and right to fair trial. applicant's also relied on open justice principle. balancing exercise of contesting rights. court's discretionary power in terms of s 173 of the constitution. objective is to uphold interests of justice. full audio and limited audio.visual and photography relief permitted.

Judges: H Kooverjie AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). legality of. reasonable suspicion to arrest was not present. police failed to do basic investigation as did not form own suspicion. simply relied on testimony of 1 eye witness, did not investigate scene of crime. failure to discharge onus of lawful arrest. plaintiff's claim succeeds.

Judges: Tuchten J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest. plaintiff arrested on charge of theft of property from common home. former husband instituted baseless charge. took place at place of employment, in front of school principal. detained overnight in cell, slept on thin length of sponge. amenities below standard plaintiff accustomed to. treated as criminal in community after arrest. awarded r75 000.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2012 JDR 1285 (GNP)
Judges: Mabuse J
Summary: criminal law. damages. arrest, detention and assault, involved torture. plaintiff accused of killing uncle, arrested , assaulted in house, then driven to bush where further assaults took place, during course of day. photographic evidence led as to injuries sustained. evidence by doctor who took biopsy, supported evidence of plaintiff and its witnesses. plaintiff made a good witness , no reason to impeach evidence. state witness was not impressive. testimony unreliable. inference that not an honest witness. judgment in favour of plaintiff, r150000 damages awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2013 JDR 2146 (GNP)
Judges: Hiemstra AJ
Summary: criminal law. police. liability of. officer shot plaintiff in foot. 2 mutually destructive versions on crucial aspects. plaintiff's version far more probable. 2 police officials also the state witnesses evidence riddled with contradictions. defendant liable for damages plaintiff can prove.

Judges: JR Murphy J, EM Kubushi J and N Khumalo AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. legality of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). court erroneously misread decision of minister of safety and security v sekhoto and another 2011 (1) sacr 315 (sca). no fifth jurisdictional requirement requiring arrest to be last resort. not incumbent to determine if reasonable suspicion existed. appeal upheld, order of court a quo set aside.

Defendant: Regional Magistrate, North Gauteng Division, Pretoria 2013 JDR 1303 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2013 (2) SACR 565 (GNP)
Judges: Fabricius J, Makgoba J and Hughes AJ
Summary: criminal law. prisoner. conversion of sentence to correctional supervision. section 276a(3) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. where date of release not more than 5 years in the future. minister seeking review of decision to convert where charges serious, contending that this inappropriate in light of community interests. 4 youths beating and stabbing homeless man to death and showing no remorse. decision to convert sentences of 2 prisoners set aside. ordered to return to prison.

Judges: Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. police officer failed to analyse and assess quality of information at disposal before arrest. had done so could have avoided arrest. dereliction of duty. suspicion was not based on reasonable grounds. subsequent detention unlawful. damages of r200 000 awarded.

Judges: Nkosi AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. without a warrant. no reasonable suspicion. alleged getaway car same colour as car driven my plaintiff and friends. eye.witness gave different account. failed to discover cctv footage to assist in defence. failed in duty to ensure arrested correct suspects. arrest and detention unlawful, r70 000 damages awarded.

Judges: Tlhapi J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest. pointed out by a resident as being a robber. put in back of police van for protection from angry crowd. police having been summoned to complex for another robbery. whether police officer's suspicion reasonable. in the circumstances the decision was rational. plaintiff's claim dismissed with costs.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2013 JDR 1263 (GNP)
Judges: Collis AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful. arrested without cause and justification. prosecution malicious. arresting officer conceded plaintiff not person who caused arrested persons to flee. cannot establish plaintiff wanting to defeat or obstruct course of justice. claim succeeds.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2012 JDR 1045 (GNP)
Judges: Zondo J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. unlawful arrest and detention. based on evidence given, not much information was given by witness to police which implicated witness and the plaintiff. therefore cannot be said that police had reasonable grounds for the suspicion that plaintiff had committed murder. detention prior to bail refusal is unlawful, due to arrest being unlawful. detention thereafter not unlawful, order of magistrate's court was not attacked in any way. damages to be determined at a later hearing. arrest and detention to first date of appearance of plaintiff was unlawful.

Judges: DS Molefe J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest on warrant. copy of warrant. only upon demand is arresting officer bound to hand copy of warrant to arrested person. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 39(2). if refuses then arrest will be unlawful. under current circumstances even if not show plaintiff copy of warrant, police did not act unlawfully. arrest lawful as result. claim dismissed.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest and detention. false claim. unlikely plaintiff arrested and detained as arrest register not indicate plaintiff arrested on date alleged. no logical reason. material contradiction in plaintiff testimony, testified never been arrested, yet similar action instituted against defendant. plaintiff fails in proving claim. dismissed with costs.

Judges: HJ Fabricius J and ML Twala AJ
Summary: criminal law. indictment and charge. further particulars. request for \'97incomplete, void of any detail and substantial information and vague. charge is particular and would enable accused to know exactly what state intends to do and why. failure to produce docket has not resulted in failure of justice. reasonable accused and legal representative would know what being confronted with to prepare a proper defence. application for review dismissed.

Defendant: MEC for Safety and Security 2013 JDR 2113 (GNP)
Judges: NV Khumalo J and Hiemstra AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. appeal against. absolution from the instance. plaintiff led evidence of different cause of action than what pled in summons. delictual claim for assault and unlawful arrest. cause of action so different reasonable court will not find for plaintiff. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2013 JDR 2128 (GNP)
Judges: Matojane J
Summary: criminal law. damages. measure of. for unlawful arrest and detention. plaintiff driving around in early hours of morning with friend, pulled over, assault and arrested by police. arrested for rape and robbery. kept in cell in appalling conditions. detained for 112 days, upon release plaintiff's work had been given to someone else. wife and 4 children to maintain. r800 000 awarded to plaintiff.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2013 JDR 1709 (GNP)
Judges: Chetty J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. unlawful arrest and detention. 3 students' version that they attempted to assist man being assaulted. police assaulting and arresting them. further assaults at police station. racial insults. police version that plaintiffs interfering with their duties. found in favour of the plaintiffs. first plaintiff r60 000 unlawful arrest, r60 000 assault, plus future medical expenses. second plaintiff r60 000 unlawful arrest, r70 000 assault, plus future medical expenses. third plaintiff's quantum postponed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 0751 (GNP)
Judges: Avvakoumides AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest on warrant \'97\'97 based arrest on plaintiff's previous conviction of same offence. did not form reasonable belief. arrest and subsequent detention unlawful. r90 000 damages awarded.

Defendant: Minister of Safety And Security 2012 JDR 1297 (GNP)
Judges: Bosman AJ
Summary: criminal law. damages. unlawful arrest and detention. measure of. reasonable grounds for arrest. arrested without a warrant. evidence that not sufficient time to obtain warrant, not accepted. police went to plaintiff's house knowing full well who resided there. motive clear, premeditated aim to arrest plaintiff and look for possible criminal offence. no reasonable grounds shown to exist warranting arrest or detention. arrest and detention unlawful.

Judges: C Cambanis AJ and S Potterill J
Summary: criminal law. review. defendant objected to charge sheet on basis unclear and umambiquous. on plain reading charge sheet as cross referenced with preamble sets out essential elements of charge and narrates conduct of accused in commission of charges. no merit in objection. review dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2013 JDR 2014 (GNP)
Judges: Van Niekerk J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. legality of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). was a reasonable suspicion that plaintiff had committed an offence. suspicion plaintiff's permit not genuine and plaintiff unable to provide reasonable explanation. basis for arrest, not unreasonable. search and seizure of liquor done in accordance of gauteng liquor act 2 of 2003. claims dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Correctional Services (Pro-Liberty Constitution Compliance Association Amicus Curiae) 2013 JDR 2111 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 471 (GJ)
Judges: Van Oosten J
Summary: criminal law. prisons. prisoner. parole. constitutional challenge. section 136(1) of the correctional services act 111 of 1998. that inconsistent with provisions of s 35(3)(n) of the constitution of the republic of south africa 108 of 1996. section 35(3)(n) of constitution affords right to benefit from least form of punishment. 'punishment' not refer to way which punishment is served. wording of subsection clear, serving of sentence cannot be read into. date of sentence is the operative date for purposes of determining parole eligibility. application dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Police 2014 JDR 0999 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 601 (GP)
Judges: Teffo J
Summary: criminal law. domestic violence. protection order. breach of. arrest in terms of s 8(4) of domestic violence act 116 of 1998. warrant linked to issuing of protection order. plaintiff arrested without warrant. police have authority to arrest without warrant, but no evidence led that arrest justified without. also no proof interim protection order served upon plaintiff. became aware of order upon arrest. order of no force or effect as not been served \'97thus no contravention of non.existent order. damages of r120 000 awarded.

Judges: J Hiemstra AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). legality of. failed to show legality of arrest. shocking and disturbing as plaintiff's version is, not improbable. state's version had glaring contradiction, failed to explain plausibly. plaintiff awarded r200 000 compensation.

Defendant: The Minister of Safety and Security 2011 JDR 0735 (GNP)
Judges: Kollapen J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1) (b) lawfulness of. requirements for defendant's reliance on s 40(1)(b)  discussed. whether defendant established reasonableness of arresting officer's suspicion that suspect committed schedule 1 offence \'97prima facie proof not required for satisfying requirements of s 40(1)(b)  but that suspicion resting on reasonable grounds. lack of proof not in itself precluding the formation of reasonable suspicion. determination of reasonableness of suspicion requiring critical assessment and evaluation of all relevant and available information by arresting officer at time of arrest. in casu, defendant's suspicion reasonable. arrest accordingly lawful and claim dismissed.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 0379 (GNP) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 163 (GP)
Judges: S.A.M. Baqwa J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without warrant. arrested at airport on strength of warrant issued in pretoria. arrival in country triggered movement control system, was listed as 'wanted' person. warrant must exist in real terms as document that can be exhibited when necessary, hence need to reapply when original goes missing. failed to prove lawfulness of arrest. damages in amount of r120 000 awarded for detention and arrest.

Judges: Hiemstra AJ
Summary: criminal law. state. liability for acts of police. liability for criminal acts committed by police officer. connection between the wrongful act of the second and third respondents are as closely related to their duties as police officers. first defendant vicariously liable for damages plaintiff may prove she suffered. second and third defendant also personally liable for damages that may be proven.

Judges: Sutherland J
Summary: criminal law. murder. evidence. found insufficient on appeal. convictions set aside. unprofessional and amateurish police investigation of the assassination of a fellow officer. given the vulnerability of police officers, resources available should have been used to the hilt and professionalism should have been exhibited at every step. the families of the members of the police force deserve nothing less. in this case they have been ill.served.
Court: North Gauteng High Court, Pretoria (Middelburg Circuit)

Judges: AM Kgoele J and RD Hendricks J
Summary: criminal law. theft. what constitutes. review. 3 t.shirts to value of r 149,95 thrown on floor inside shop before apprehended. amounting only to attempted theft and verdict altered accordingly. previous convictions, value of items low and 35 years old. sentence of 2 years reduced to 2 years wholly suspended. length of time before submitted on automatic review unacceptable, copy of judgment to be forwarded to magistrates' commission.

Defendant: Pilane 2015 JDR 0696 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 247 (NWM)
Judges: Hendricks J and Djaje AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. calling, examination and refutation of. the oath. administering of. provisions of s 162 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 peremptory.

Defendant: Lerumo 2017 JDR 1885 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 202 (NWM)
Judges: RD Hendricks J and TJ Djaje J
Summary: criminal law. trial. accused. failure to appear in court. issue of warrant of arrest. practice of staying execution of such warrants not in accordance with prescripts of s 67 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977 and must be done away with.

Judges: RD Hendricks J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). unable to provide satisfactory explanation for possession of unbranded cow and calf and arrested for stock theft. police officer acting reasonably and arrest lawful. on bail for similar offence at time of arrest, further detention accordingly justified. claim dismissed.

Judges: Hendricks J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). buyer of branded stolen cattle identifying plaintiff as seller. brand marks not matching permit provided by seller. reasonable suspicion of theft well.founded and entitled to arrest without warrant. claim dismissed. stock theft act 57 of 1959, s 9.

Judges: Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant . criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). failed to comply with third jurisdictional fact, arresting officer did not know which relevant section with which plaintiff was charged. simply referred to as 'hit and run'. also none of offences in road traffic act 93 of 1996 form part of sch 1. arrest and detention unlawful.

Defendant: Wang 2018 JDR 0209 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 426 (NWM)
Judges: Gura J and Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. corruption. sentence. offering incentives to employee of mining company to persuade employer to purchase machinery from foreign manufacturer. representatives of manufacturer sentenced to 10 and 5 years' imprisonment respectively. sentences confirmed on appeal.

Judges: AM Kgoele J and N Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. plea. plea of guilty. duty on presiding officer. questions merely repeating, in form of leading questions, allegations in charge.sheet. too much legal jargon used for unrepresented lay person. doubt whether answers sufficient to enable presiding officer an informed opinion on guilt or otherwise of accused. convictions and sentences set aside. matter remitted to start de novo before different presiding officer.

Judges: RD Hendricks J and T Djaje AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. rape of 14.year.old girl by uncle (twice). married, aged 52 (43 at time of offence), 4 children and breadwinner. abused position of trust. life term imposed shocking ,warranting interference. reduced to 18 years on appeal.

Judges: RD Hendricks J, AM Kgoele J and N Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed minimum sentences. criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 2 counts of rape and 1 of attempted rape. not informed of minimum sentencing provisions entitling court to sentence afresh. thirty.two.year.old stepfather of 12.year.old complainant. previous conviction for violence. sentence of 15 years' imprisonment for attempted rape confirmed. life terms on each of rape counts altered to 25 years.

Judges: Hendricks J, Kgoele J and Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. also aggravated robbery. guilty plea. sign of remorse or contrition. misdirection in not finding substantial and compelling circumstances. sentences of life imprisonment for murder and 15 years' imprisonment for robbery reduced, respectively, to 22 and 10 years, sentences to run concurrently.

Judges: RD Hendricks J, Samkelo Gura J and N Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. rape of 6.year.old female by 25.year.old male. first offender. no remorse. not warned that minimum sentence act applicable and life term accordingly set aside. replaced with 22 years' imprisonment.

Judges: Leeuw AJ and Landman J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence to sustain conviction. complainant and brother attacked by appellant (armed with knife) and another. complainant raped by both assailants. police fetched by brother and appellant arrested at scene. appellant chose not to testify. conviction in order. previous convictions. no remorse. no misdirection in imposition of prescribed life term.

Judges: Hendricks J and Djaje AJ
Summary: criminal law. fraud. sentence. first appellant, an attorney, colluding with second appellant to divorce his wife, without her knowledge. second appellant misrepresenting herself as wife for purpose of service of papers. only plausible reason to deprive complainant of her half of joint estate. relatively advanced age. first appellant losing standing as attorney. sentence of 8 years for both appellants too severe. sentence for first appellant replaced with 5 years, 2 suspended; and for second appellant 3 years in terms of s 276(1)(i).

Judges: AM Kgoele J; Samkelo Gura J and N Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. appellant not informed of  possibility of life imprisonment at beginning of trial when still unrepresented. unfair and life term set aside \'97first offender, 35 years of age, sole parent a of 4 children. raped 8.year.old friend of daughter, in full view of daughter. sentence to 25 years imprisonment.

Judges: Hendricks J and Gura J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence to sustain charges. complainant was employee of appellant. evidence of complainant credible. court showing necessary caution regarding single witness to event. conviction in order. no misdirection in sentence of 8 years. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: MM 2017 JDR 1103 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 344 (NWM)
Judges: MM Leeuw JP and RD Hendricks ADJP
Summary: criminal law. trial. mental state of accused. order in terms of s 47 of the mental health care act 72 of 2002. review of. magistrate not entitled to submit matter on review after making order.

Judges: TJ Djaje AJ and N Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. expert evidence. dna analysis. presentation of such evidence. chain of handling of samples from collection to analysis to be properly presented.

Defendant: Masoanganye 2015 JDR 0259 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 577 (NWM)
Judges: F Diale Kgomo JP and MH Rampai AJP and RD Hendricks J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. generally. trial court's evaluation of evidence. presumption that trial court's findings of fact are correct. first appellant correctly convicted. no demonstrable and material misdirection by trial court. only erred in exonerating third appellant. evidence was overwhelming. appeal against convictions and sentences dismissed.

Judges: MM Leeuw JP and AA Landman J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. age 49 and first offender. raped victim age 15 in her bedroom. threatened her with knife and cut her on arms and legs when she resisted. life sentence confirmed on appeal.

Judges: Samkelo Gura J and AM Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges. complainant dragged from tavern to school where raped by appellant and co.accused. her evidence reliable. requisite caution used in evaluation thereof. appellant and co.accused failing to put forward alternative version. conviction in order. appellant aged 26 and first offender. under influence of alcohol. not premeditated. misdirection in finding no substantial and compelling circumstances. sentence altered from life to 22 years.

Judges: Hendricks J and Gura J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. sentence. state accepting guilty pleas to competent verdicts of robbery and assault with intent to do grievous bodily harm. misdirection in imposition of 12 years for attempted murder and robbery, vitiating sentence (counts taken together). aged 39 with previous convictions, but showed remorse. complainant was peace officer trying to enforce law. sentence reduced to 5 years.

Defendant: Mabitle 2016 JDR 2000 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 325 (NWM)
Judges: AA Landman J and N Gutta J and TJ Djaje AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. factors to be taken into account. youthfulness and mercy. contract killing. sentence of life imprisonment on 20.year.old offender reduced to 25 years' imprisonment.

Judges: MM Leeuw JP and AM Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. repeat rape of minor step.daughter. dna evidence \'97first offender. guilty plea. caused rift in family and complainant relocated to stay with relatives in another village. evidence overwhelming suggesting had no choice but to plead guilty and therefore not sign of remorse. sentence less than life imprisonment not justified. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Leepile 2016 JDR 0236 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 513 (NWM)
Judges: N Gutta J and TJ Djaje AJ
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. conduct of. descending into arena of conflict. presiding officer to guard against such conduct. might create impression of partisanship or that issues pre.decided. should not put attacking propositions to accused or cross.examine accused.

Judges: RD Hendricks J and AM Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charge. gang rape. complainant credible witness. supported by first report and medical evidence. conviction sound. no remorse. injuries. discussed throwing her in o pen grave. court a quo correctly finding no substantial and compelling circumstances. life terms imposed on appellants confirmed.

Defendant: Byleveld 2017 JDR 1527 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SA 218 (NWM)
Judges: AA Landman J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. authorisation of by director of public prosecutions (the dpp). section 252a(5)(b) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. prosecution of agent or informer conducting covert operations. requirement that prosecution be authorised not only applicable to operations authorised by dpp in terms of s 252a(2)(a), but even where agent may have acted  outside of mandate. that indictment signed by deputy dpp not justifying inference that dpp had authorised prosecution.

Judges: Samkelo Gura J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. use of force in effecting arrest. lawfulness of. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 49(2). police officers admitting to tackling plaintiff when attempting to arrest for driving under influence of liquor. court satisfied that attack justified and plaintiff the author of his own misfortune. claim for damages dismissed.

Defendant: Msiza 2016 JDR 1999 (NWM) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 42 (NWM)
Judges: Landman J
Summary: criminal law. contempt of court. what constitutes. failure of police to render assistance with execution of civil order of high court. order providing that assistance had to be given by police if requested by sheriff. no request made by sheriff in instant case. contempt of court not proven.

Judges: Gura J and Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. bail. withdrawal of. bail withdrawn mero motu and without accused having an opportunity to oppose such. withdrawal grossly irregular.

Judges: Samkelo Gura J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. without warrant. act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). arrested and detained overnight on fraud charge later withdrawn due to insufficient evidence. actions of police not reasonable and intended to victimise plaintiff. arrest and detention accordingly unlawful. awarded r100 000 in damages and r20 000 legal costs.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2017 JDR 0428 (NWM)
Judges: Kgoele J
Summary: criminal law. arrest. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1)(b). manager of scrap metal dealership for allegedly for contravening the second.hand goods act 6 of 2009. claimed to have no knowledge of burnt copper cable on premises. suspicion founded on reasonable grounds and claim dismissed.

Judges: Hendricks J, Gutta J
Summary: criminal law. extradition. appeal against extradition order granted by magistrate. whether appellant's constitutional fair.trial rights would be infringed should he be extradited to requesting state (botswana). extradition enquiry correctly held in terms of s 10 of the extradition act 67 of 1992, botswana being foreign state. magistrate conducting enquiry under s 10 having no power to consider whether constitutional rights of persons sought to be extradited may be infringed; such aspect for minister to decide under s 11 of act. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Minister van Veiligheid en Sekuriteit 2013 JDR 2740 (NCK)
Judges: CJ Olivier J
Summary: criminal law. prosecuting authority. prosecutor. liability of. exemption from liability where acts done in good faith. attitude and intention with which the deed committed important in determining question whether prosecutor acted in good faith. there could be no question of good faith where there was animus iniuriandi. national prosecuting authority act 32 of 1998, s 42.

Applicant: The Director of Public Prosecutions, Northern Cape
Defendant: Swart 2018 JDR 0963 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 211 (NCK)
Judges: Matlapeng AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. reservation of question of law. question of law. what constitutes. whether trial court failed to apply applicable legal principles to proven facts. in casu, court examining record and finding trial court had accounted for all evidence and accorded it due weight in acquitting accused. no question of law raised, but 1 of fact.

Judges: Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. theft of unpolished diamonds. value of r 1,4 million. was in position of trust as senior sorter. theft of employer must be heavily penalised. custodial sentence appropriate. accused first offender, with ill health and minor daughter. justifies departure from minimum sentence. count of theft 8 years' imprisonment and count of possession of unpolished diamonds 2 years' imprisonment imposed, respectively.

Judges: Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. assessment of. accused was senior sorter of diamonds and his actions captured on cctv cameras along with evidence looked at in totality, indicative of accused's guilt. only inference to be drawn. state proved guilt beyond reasonable doubt. guilty of theft of 525 grainers of unpolished diamonds and contravention of s 18, s 1, 82(a) and 87(a) of the diamonds act 56 of 1986.

Judges: LP Tlaletsi AJP and LG Lever AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. grabbed and raped 9.year.old girl while she was walking in the veld. linked through dna evidence. first offender, 39 years old, single with 1 child. not most severe form of rape. prospects for rehabilitation. life term reduced to 18 years.

Defendant: Steward 2016 JDR 1681 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 156 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP and Olivier J and Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. prosecution. conduct of. rape trial in regional magistrates' court. prosecution conducted incompetently and amounting to dereliction of duty resulting in acquittal of appellant. numerous aspects not properly investigated resulting in many unanswered questions. those parties culpable ought to account to their superiors.

Defendant: Smous 2017 JDR 1660 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 108 (NCK)
Judges: Tlaletsi AJP and Williams J and Ndlokovane AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. imprisonment. murder of former girlfriend. prevalence of violence in country. prescribed minimum sentence of 15 years' imprisonment insufficient in circumstances. sentence of 18 years' imprisonment imposed.

Defendant: Setlholo 2017 JDR 0488 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 544 (NCK)
Judges: LP Tlaletsi J and MV Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. corruption. sentence. police officer soliciting bribe from person who had been lured into fake illicit diamond transaction. fact that perpetrator a police officer an aggravating factor. sentence of 10 years' imprisonment confirmed on appeal.

Judges: Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. viva voce and documentary evidence. corrupt activities. various individual and entities involved. based on assessment of evidence parties respective verdicts of guilty or not guilty set out.

Defendant: Rossouw 2017 JDR 1874 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 179 (NCK)
Judges: MC Mamosebo J and SL Erasmus AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed minimum sentence. criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. substantial and compelling circumstances. consideration of on appeal. proper enquiry required. cumulative factors including provocation; consumption of alcohol; prior assaults of appellant by deceased; and that appellant mother of 3 children and gainfully employed, constituting substantial and compelling circumstances justifying lesser sentence.

Defendant: Nwabunwanne 2017 JDR 0490 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 124 (NCK)
Judges: Erasmus J
Summary: criminal law. bail. application for. onus. on accused. section 60(11) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. before burdened with onus, jurisdictional fact that offence was 1 listed in sch 5 or 6 to act to be properly established. given drastic consequences of s 60(11), desirable that procedural provisions of s 60(11a) be closely adhered to. second or subsequent application on new facts. accused should not lightly be denied opportunity of presenting new facts.

Judges: LP Tlaletsi JP and MC Mamosebo J
Summary: criminal law. stock theft. sentence. theft of 8 sheep. sentence of 6 years' imprisonment upheld on appeal where accused had previous conviction.

Judges: F Diale Kgomo JP and JA Snyders AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. murder. female stamped and trampled man to death. guilt in form of dolus eventualis \'97 age 19, dysfunctional background and intoxicated at time of incident. first offender and pleaded guilty. deviation from prescribed sentence justified. sentence of 15 years' imprisonment reduced to 12 years of which 4 were suspended.

Defendant: Maringa 2017 JDR 0489 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 561 (NCK)
Judges: Matlapeng AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. special entry in terms of s 317(2) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. prisoner discovering many years after conviction that defended by attorney without right of appearance. requirements of s 317 met and condonation granted for lateness of application.

Defendant: Kordom 2017 JDR 0622 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (1) SACR 173 (NCK)
Judges: CJ Olivier J and JA Snyders AJ
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. factors to be taken into account. provocation. what constitutes. period between provocative act and commission of offence. clear that short period between 2 actions. provocation present.

Judges: F Diale Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. multiple charges (34) some of which included complainants under age of 16. that first offender irrelevant. 7 life terms imposed, sentences imposed on remaining counts to run concurrently. accused's name to be recorded in register of sex offenders.

Judges: Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. rape. evidence sufficient to sustain charges \'97 included 33 counts of rape and 3 of attempted rape (complainants included 2 minors) \'97 dna links in 22 counts. state witnesses honest and reliable. appellant dismissed as inveterate liar. accused found to be a serial rapist. convicted on all counts excepting 2 (rape and attempted rape) where insufficient evidence.

Judges: Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imprisonment. term of. non.parole period. non.parole period of 25 years imposed in 30.year sentence. appellant not provided with opportunity to make representations. constituting overreach in circumstances and procedurally unfair. appeal upheld and non.parole portion set aside.

Defendant: JA 2017 JDR 0621 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (2) SACR 143 (NCK)
Judges: F Diale Kgomo JP and CJ Olivier J and SL Erasmus AJ
Summary: criminal law. rape. sentence. life imprisonment. minimum sentence in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. relatively old offender. argument that would only be eligible for parole when very old and therefore life imprisonment not appropriate, rejected.

Judges: CJ Olivier J and SL Erasmus AJ
Summary: criminal law. indictment and charge. main count withdrawn and 2 counts added. described as 'alt' and '2nd alt' when clear should have been second and third counts as understood by all parties. court ordering charges to be renumbered counts 1 & 2. matter remitted to magistrate for further proceedings.

Defendant: DW 2016 JDR 1713 (NCK) \'97 Now Reported at 2017 (1) SACR 336 (NCK)
Judges: MC Mamosebo J and Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. child. trial. child under age of 18 years at commission of offence. provisions of child justice act 75 of 2008. legal practitioner representing child offender required to make extra effort in ensuring best interests of child paramount. child consequently deprived of compulsory preliminary enquiry in terms of s 5 and possibility of diversion. sentence of r1500 or 5 months imprisonment altered to caution and discharge.

Judges: Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. trial. presiding officer. recusal of. whether presiding officer being privy to factual background as set out should continue to preside in trial of accused 2 and 3. proper administration of justice would entail accused should not hold any reasonable apprehension presiding officer biased against him. fair trial rights may not be sacrificed for practical reasons. order granted, trial of accused 2 and 3 to commence de novo before different judge.

Defendant: De Besch 2018 JDR 0588 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 22 (NCK)
Judges: LP Tlaletsi JP, Williams J, Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. life imprisonment. when to be imposed. murder committed with dolus directus attracting different minimum sentence that if planned or premeditated, accordingly imperative that trial court specify whether murder indeed planned or premeditated. no such specification in casu; accordingly misdirection in imposition of life term and sentence reduced to 23 years.

Defendant: DD 2014 JDR 1253 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 165 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. evidence. circumstantial evidence. assessment of. none other than minor accused committed offences beyond any shadow of doubt. murdered parents and sister to cover up rape of sister. guilty on charges of rape; murder of parents and sister; and defeating ends of justice.

Defendant: Coetzee 2015 JDR 1979 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 120 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. life imprisonment. numerous sexual offences involving the manufacturing of child pronography, rape and sexual assault of young children. accused, 23.year.old first offender. accused diagnosed with paedophilic disorder. accused displaying measure of remorse and wanting treatment. prescribed minimum sentence of life imprisonment would create an injustice. sentence of 24 years' imprisonment imposed.

Defendant: Asele 2015 JDR 1505 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2016 (1) SACR 13 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP and Olivier J and Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against sentence. general rule that appeal court must decide question of sentence according to facts in existence when sentence imposed, not according to new circumstances. no material misdirection. not at liberty to interfere with life sentence. appeal dismissed.

Defendant: Scholtz 2016 JDR 2289 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2017 (1) SACR 483 (NCK)
Judges: MV Phatshoane J
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. confiscation order in terms of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. benefits of crime that may be confiscated. not restricted to net amount of proceeds but also includes value of appreciation of assets so acquired.

Defendant: Director: Public Prosecutions Northern Cape 2016 JDR 1298 (NCK)
Judges: Olivier J, Phatshoane J and Mamosebo J
Summary: criminal law. fundamental rights. right to a fair trial. right to be tried within a reasonable time. delay in bringing prosecution. application for stay of prosecution before postponement date refused. whether proceedings 'pending' before court a quo in terms of provision. court finding in negative. appeal dismissed. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 342a.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2015 JDR 1894 (NCK)
Judges: Phatshoane J and Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. seizure by police in terms of s 20 of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. review of. premature forfeiture declaration of vehicle. no proper investigation conducted. decision reviewed and set aside.

Defendant: The Minister of Safety and Security 2010 JDR 0850 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP; Lacock J et Mjali AJ
Summary: criminal law. traffic offences. possession of vehicle bearing falsified engine or chassis number. policeman seizing truck trailers on basis of their chassis' having been tampered with; appellant seeking restitution thereof. national road traffic act 93 of 1996, s 68(6).

Defendant: Thenga 2012 JDR 1037 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2012 (2) SACR 628 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP et Pakati J
Summary: criminal law. contempt of court. appellant absented herself prior to being excused. no proper procedure was followed in the course of being charged with contempt of court. the magistrate who charged appellant was the presiding officer and direct subordinate of appellant served as prosecutor. both should have recused themselves. magistrate had misdirected view that appellant had to communicate directly. not wrong for appellant to ask any of persons mentioned to intercede on her behalf. valid to send letter and excuse advanced was valid. irrational not to grant absolution. appeal upheld. conviction and sentence set aside.

Defendant: Swartz 2013 JDR 2744 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 461 (NCK)
Judges: CJ Olivier J and BM Pakati J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304(4) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977\'97 interpretation of s 113 (2) of the act. words 'unless the prosecutor explicitly indicates otherwise'. refer to indication by prosecutor after plea of not guilty noted and in absence of such contrary indication, trial would proceed on original charge laid. acceptance of initial guilty plea explicit indication as envisaged. convictions set aside.

Judges: MC Mamosebo AJ and Williams J
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. sentence. compulsory residence in a child and youth care centre. magistrate to have taken cognisance, chances of assistance minimised due to age. enjoys protection of child justice act till age of 18 years. sentence to be tailored to assist in reintegration into society and to resist against reoffending. sentence confirmed and in addition youth care centre to offer additional programmes as contemplated in s 191(3)(e) of children's act 38 of 2005.

Judges: MC Mamosebo AJ and HJ Lacock J
Summary: criminal law. criminal procedure. review. powers of court on review. magistrate who initially heard matter was in different jurisdiction. magistrate who did subsequent hearing did not have authority to order trial to start de novo. reviewable irregularity. irregular to have accused plead again. lower court does not have power to set aside its own proceedings. sentencing proceedings taken to commence from where previous magistrate left off. conviction by first magistrate confirmed, proceedings up to and including conviction of second magistrate set aside, sentence by second magistrate confirmed.

Judges: Lacock J and Williams J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witness evidence. to sustain charge of theft of motor vehicle \'97single witness in casu a co.perpetrator. cautionary rule. testimony not reliable or credible. no corroboration. state conceding appeal should succeed. convictions and sentence set aside.

Defendant: Oliphant 2013 JDR 2816 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 98 (NCK)
Judges: MV Phatshoane J and MC Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. accused plea of guilty converted to not guilty and matter referred to different presiding officer to proceed de novo. grossly irregular and must be set aside. position prior to conversion of plea is in place. decision of magistrate set aside, remitted to regional court to be dealt with in terms of s114 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977.

Judges: Lacock J and Williams J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. rape. of man. sentenced to 10 years, 2 of which suspended. appeal. appellant alleging that complainant consented. conviction confirmed but sentence set aside and matter returned to court a quo for reconsideration of sentence. direct imprisonment considered inappropriate.

Judges: CJ Williams J and CC Olivier J
Summary: criminal law. theft. sentence. theft by employees from employers\'97 employers bank client. accused stole money in their possession in transit to being conveyed to automated teller machines. lied to police and employer regarding being robbed. realised mistake and surrendered themselves to police. expressed remorse, was not premeditated. substantial and compelling circumstances found yet 10 years imprisonment still too severe and shockingly inappropriate. sentence on theft reduced to 7 years imprisonment, 4 years suspended; and on obstructing course of justice 3 years imprisonment, to be served concurrently.

Judges: Kgomo JP, Phatshoane J and Pakati J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. indecent assault. touching daughter's private parts. on appeal sentence of 6 years (two suspended) replaced with 4 years (two of which suspended for 5 years). appeal against conviction failing in light of testimony of mother and 2 daughters.

Defendant: ERA 2013 JDR 1608 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 183 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP and Erasmus AJ
Summary: criminal law. diversion programme for juveniles. offence prior to child justice act. whether charges could be re.instated after being withdrawn for diversion programme. expectation created that accused would not be prosecuted on same facts. convictions on counts 1 to 3 set aside. remitted to magistrate for sentencing on count 4.

Defendant: Dumba 2010 JDR 1407 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2011 (2) SACR 5 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP
Summary: criminal law. murder. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. accused convicted of murder with direct intention to kill his wife. cout had regard to all factors in mitigation and aggravation and was satisfied that substantial and compelling circumstances existed. accused sentenced to 8 years' imprisonment.

Defendant: Carter 2013 JDR 2281 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 517 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP and Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against conviction and sentence. court a quo caused a miscarriage of justice. clear from evidence complainant been raped, yet convicted on attempted rape. no authority cited explaining deviation from original charge. appellant did not testify. appeal against conviction and sentence dismissed.

Judges: MC Mamosebo AJ
Summary: criminal law. prevention of crime. restraint order in terms of prevention of organised crime act 121 of 1998. application for under s 26. permits plaintiff to approach court on ex parte basis. obtaining interim order does not put respondent at disadvantage. adequate disclosure by plaintiff of material facts. persuaded on reasonable grounds that confiscation order will be granted, vesting court with discretion to confirm provisional restraint order. provisional order confirmed.

Defendant: Minister of Justice & Constitutional Development 2013 JDR 2739 (NCK)
Judges: Kgomo JP and L Lever AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. exhumation of body. inquests act 58 of 1959, s 3(4). murder trial at advanced stage. defence applying for discharge. whether suicide or murder. deceased suffering 2 bullets wounds to head.

Defendant: Van Eeden 2018 JDR 0692 (NCK) \'97 Now reported at 2018 (2) SACR 218 (NCK)
Judges: L P Tlaletsi JP and C J Olivier J
Summary: criminal law. trial. irregularity in. what constitutes. accused represented at trial by attorney who was barred from practising by high court interdict, at instance of law society. fatal irregularity. proceedings set aside.

Defendant: Minister of Safety and Security 2014 JDR 0891 (GSJ)
Judges: TL Mosikatsana AJ
Summary: criminal law. arrest. legality of. arrest without a warrant. criminal procedure act 51 of 1977, s 40(1). incidence of the burden of proof. whether defendant adduced sufficient evidence to justify plaintiff's arrest and detention. crucial shortcomings in evidence of police witnesses. plaintiff's evidence accepted.

Judges: K Satchwell J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. correctional supervision. conversion of imprisonment into correctional supervision in terms of s 276a(3) of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. application made by case management committee on request from accused's legal representatives. parole board declined application to forward application to court a quo. accused failed to show any remorse, main purpose for payment of fine was to get reduction in sentence. no right to a non.custodial sentence. no indications of bias in parole board's decision. application dismissed.

Judges: Wepener J
Summary: criminal law. damages. unlawful arrest and detention. each case to be considered on own facts. awards from state coffers should be approached with restraint. where relative short periods of wrongful detention, circumspection required in awarding of damages. damages payable in amount of r50 000.

Judges: I Opperman AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. sentence. robbery with aggravating circumstances. minimum sentence in terms of s 51 of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. appellant's previous lengthy period of imprisonment did not act as deterrent to reoffend. committed current offence for which convicted whilst on parole. court a quo did not err in conclusion no substantial and compelling circumstances present. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. admissibility. hearsay evidence. admissibility in terms of s 3 of law of evidence amendment act 45 of 1988. application by state for hearsay statements attributed to four.year.old child witness to murder admitted into evidence. child allegedly making statements to witnesses but clamming up at attempts to obtain a formal statement. rights to fair trial. section 35(3)(i) of the constitution. application refused.

Judges: Mudau AJ and Weiner J
Summary: criminal law. murder. mens rea. intention to kill. dolus eventualis. trial court justified in finding degree of intent dolus eventualis, appellant's acted in common purpose. nature of evidence rules out state witnesses conspired to implicated appellants. accused 3 and appellant's acted in common purpose of assaulting deceased. fully supported by evidence. appellant's denial of complicity not reasonably possibly true. appeal dismissed.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and G Wright J
Summary: criminal law. review. special review. sentence imposed not in accordance with justice. convicted and sentenced based on a non.existing act. section within aviation act 10 of 1972 under which convicted repealed by civil aviation act 13 of 2009. proceedings vitiated by irregularity, therefore not in accordance with justice. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: Francis J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. leave to appeal. application for. reasonable possibility another court will come to different conclusion. leave granted.

Defendant: Trichart 2014 JDR 0897 (GSJ) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (2) SACR 245 (GJ)
Judges: Vally J and Moshidi J
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. probation officer's report. value of. probation officer skilled officer's of the court who assist courts in finding relevant facts material to sentence and making recommendations. magistrate committed material irregularity by irrationally dismissing report due to alleged lack of experience.

Judges: CJ Claassen J and Mokgoathleng J
Summary: criminal law. child offenders. murder. 15 years old at time of offence. fight over stolen cap ending in deceased being stabbed 5 times. sentenced to compulsory residence in child care centre until 19 years of age. whether this too lenient. referred back to regional court for sentence to be considered afresh.

Defendant: Tlale 2013 JDR 2335 (GSJ) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (1) SACR 88 (GJ)
Judges: TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentencing. minimum sentencing provisions. substantial and compelling circumstances. planned robberies by armed gang. no remorse. personal circumstances and hardships outweighed by seriousness of offences. substantial and compelling circumstances not found.

Judges: TP Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. robbery, attempted murder, kidnapping and firearm offences. multiple charges against 6 accused. various acquittals, but several convictions for all six.

Judges: CJ Claassen J
Summary: criminal law. multiple charges of assault, housebreaking, attempted murder, arson and murder. accused and sister giving alibi defence. their testimony contradictory. found guilty on all but 1 charge.

Judges: Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. robbery. sentence. robbery with aggravating circumstances. minimum sentence in terms of s 51 of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. factors indicate sentence to be increased rather than decreased. no remorse, disregard for law, committed offence while on parole. sentence imposed not disproportionate. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Mudau AJ and B Spilg J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against conviction. theft. theft of monies of complainant. not actual theft of monies, as monies was paid into bank account of second appellant, but cause complainant to be deprived of his money. appellant sold steel wires and monetary value deposited into accounts. second appellant correctly convicted. appeal dismissed.

Judges: De Vos J and Ebersohn AJ
Summary: criminal law. review. special review in terms of s 304a of criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. family violence. sentence of 12 months imprisonment suspended for 5 years. magistrate failed to explain to accused rights to legal representation on day of trial. record does not reflect. conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: B Mashile J and I Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. only substantial and compelling circumstance trial court could have found is period spent in custody awaiting trial and sentence. appeal dismissed.

Judges: I Opperman AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. record. record lost, destroyed or incomplete. record inadequate for proper consideration of appeal. evidence is mostly inaudible and reconstruction does not help much. judgment of court also inaudible. sentence imposed also unprecedented. appeal upheld, convictions and sentences set aside.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. assessment of. identification. evidence not meet requirements to overcome cautionary rule. insufficient evidence to identify appellant as observed assailant for few seconds, was dark and frightened. evidence was not satisfactory in all material respects nor corroborated. appeal allowed, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. credibility. single witness. court took cognisance of fact that single witness. necessary caution applied. evidence was satisfactory in all material respects. appeal dismissed.

Judges: Lamont J and Mathopo J
Summary: criminal law. review. powers of court. failure of justice. 2 different magistrate's heard matter, 2 different please submitted for same charge. impermissible in terms of s 106(2) of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. appropriate proceedings before second magistrate be set aside and trial continue before first magistrate. proceedings and conviction set aside in terms of s 304(2)(c)(iii) of the act and remitted back to first magistrate.

Judges: Joffe J
Summary: criminal law. corruption. contravention of s 4(1)(a) of prevention and combating of corrupt activities act 12 of 2004 (pcca). accused also charged with defeating or obstructing administration of justice. at all relevant times accused acted in his capacity as former national commissioner of south african police services. accussed found guilty of corruption in contravening s 4(1)(a) of pcca, but was found not guilty of defeating or obstructing administration of justice.

Judges: Lamont J
Summary: criminal law. sexual offences. criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act 32 of 2007. contravention of s5 of the act. state established each of facts required to be proved as element of offence set out in s 5. any defect in charge cured by evidence led, establishing facts. section 56 of the act contemplates on conviction of any offence under act there will be sentence. word 'sentence' must be read as invoking judicial officer to pass an appropriate sentence contemplated by provisions of ch 28 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. accused falls to be convicted on counts 1.9, 11, 13.27, 29, 31.35, 37, 39.48, 50.58.

Judges: B Mashile J and I Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. result of not ordering to run concurrently, sentence disproportionate to crime. cumulative effect of sentence is harsh. sentences on counts 4.5 and 7.7 to run concurrently. effective 16 years' imprisonment.

Judges: B Mashile J and I Opperman AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. imposition of maximum allowable sentence. no indication on record of intention to impose more than maximum sentence. no reasons either as to why felt there was need for it \'97trial court correct no substantial and compelling circumstances. exceeding sentence on each count violation of principles laid down in s v maake. sentences reduced to 10 years' imprisonment on each count.

Judges: Francis J and July AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. concurrence of sentences. when appropriate. regard to be had to nature of offences and close connection in time and place and intention. present case no overlap between rape and murder charge and being in possession of unlicensed firearm. no conjoining to time and place of offences. this ground of appeal fails, appeal against sentence upheld, replaced with 10 years' imprisonment, not to run concurrently with any other sentence being served.

Judges: Victor J and Vally AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. imposition of. factors to be taken into account. convicted of contravening s 5(b) of the drugs and drug trafficking act 140 of 1992. sentence not shockingly inappropriate. relevant mitigating factors taken into account. court did not misdirect itself. appellant as courier, and parent should be aware of consequences of actions. appeal dismissed.

Judges: B Mashile J and SA Thobane AJ
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. cautionary rules. evidence of single witness having to be substantially satisfactory in every material respect or corroborated in order for court to base finding on. numerous intrinsic improbabilities, omissions and contradictions and lack of corroboration by other witnesses. reject complainant's evidence as probable. appellant's version is more probable. appeal upheld, convictions and sentences set aside.

Defendant: Okah 2013 JDR 0219 (GSJ) \'97 Now reported at 2015 (2) SACR 561 (GJ)
Judges: CJ Claassen J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. to sustain multiple charges of terrorism. acts of terrorism committed by nigerian national in his country of birth. accused resident in south africa \'97jurisdiction of south african court. conspiracy. convicted on all counts. protection of constitutional democracy against terrorist and related activities act 33 of 2004.

Judges: PN Levenberg AJ and M. Tsoka J
Summary: criminal law. search and seizure. search warrant. validity of. warrant issued in terms of s21 of the criminal procedure act 51 of 1977. warrant failed to comply with legal requirements of identifying offence, specific person and premises to be searched, who to conduct search. appeal upheld, judgment set aside, found not guilty on all charges and acquitted.

Defendant: Nyembe 2013 JDR 1274 (GSJ) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 105 (GSJ)
Judges: Van Oosten J
Summary: criminal law. rape. proof of. dna analysis. weight to be attached to dna analysis and results. multiple charges of kidnapping, rape, robbery with aggravating circumstances. only evidence implicating accused. sufficiency of where chain evidence and correctness of analysis admitted. dna result corroborated by similar fact evidence of 3 incidents. guilt proven beyond reasonable doubt. found guilty on charges 1\'9614.

Judges: Francis J and July AJ
Summary: criminal law. sentence. prescribed sentences. minimum sentences. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 'substantial and compelling circumstances'. complainant suffered superficial lacerations during rape. sentence disproportionate to the crime. plea of guilty, state of intoxication, and uncontrollable sexual desires sufficient factors to justify imposition of lesser sentence. appeal against rape sentence upheld and reduced to 20 years' imprisonment, sentences to run concurrently.

Defendant: Ngubeni 2013 JDR 2120 (GSJ) \'97 Now reported at 2014 (1) SACR 266 (GSJ)
Judges: Victor J and Nonyane AJ
Summary: criminal law. juvenile offenders. diversion of. from criminal justice system. in terms of child justice act 75 of 2008, s 52. during mitigation of sentence court became aware accused 16 years old. magistrate erred in setting aside conviction and noting plea of not guilty. in these instances must go directly on review after realise error. change of plea to not guilty a nullity. appropriate for this court to set aside conviction.

Judges: SA Thobane AJ and B Mashile J
Summary: criminal law. evidence. witnesses. credibility. single witness. minor contradictions, cumulatively they are material to main issues. magistrate finding that complainant made good impression misplaced. evidence not satisfactory nor corroborated. appellant's version reasonably possibly true. appeal upheld, conviction and sentence set aside.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J and R Monama J
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against sentence. 2 convictions of rape, 18 years' imprisonment. personal circumstances of appellant nothing out of the ordinary. 5 previous convictions. no misdirection by trial court. no grounds for interference on appeal. dismissed.

Judges: FHD Van Oosten J, T Mosikatsana AJ and R Mokgoathleng J
Summary: criminal law. appeal \'96 rape. evidence. assessment of. children. cautionary rules. evidence correctly accepted by trial court. version of appellants correctly rejected as false by trial court. appeal dismissed.

Judges: RE Monama J, TM Makgoka J and TD Vilakazi AJ
Summary: criminal law. prescribed sentences. minimum sentence. imposition of in terms of criminal law amendment act 105 of 1997. 5 years to be imposed in respect of first offender. sentences of 18 and 12 years respectively, for attempted robbery with aggravating circumstances and attempted murder, not sanctioned. material misdirection, could therefore not competently be imposed. sentence reduced to effective imprisonment of 25 years'.

Judges: Claassen J and Satchwell J (Mailula J In Absentia)
Summary: criminal law. appeal. against conviction and sentence. life imprisonment for murder of 2 women. single witness corroborated by admission statements made by appellants 1 and 2 and ballistics evidence. evidence of conspiracy involving 3 appellants. no misdirection. appeals dismissed.

Judges: Mudau AJ
Summary: criminal law. general principles of liability. common purpose. proof of. unidentified gunman and accused associated in common purpose to commit crimes. continued active association.

Judges: Van Oosten, J
